Name: Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology
Overview: Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology (GMIT) is a prestigious university situated in Galway, Ireland. It offers a wide range of degree programs, including undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate courses in various fields. In addition, the university also provides online distance education programs for students who are unable to attend on-campus classes. The cost of attendance may differ for international and domestic students, depending on the course chosen. On average, an international student can expect to pay around 10,92,725 INR in tuition and fees, excluding other miscellaneous expenses. GMIT provides numerous scholarships, work-study opportunities, and funding options to deserving students, which are awarded based on their academic performances and achievements. According to Emolument, alumni and graduates working as Logistics, Operations, and Purchasing specialists from GMIT are the highest earners with an average annual income of $84,000. The university also has a dedicated Career Planning Service team to assist students in building their CVs, finding suitable job opportunities, and securing internships and part-time/summer jobs. These services are available to students whether they are seeking employment after graduation or during their studies.
Eligibility Overview:
The following are the entry requirements for applicants to various programs at our university:

- Higher Certificates (Level 6) and ab initio Bachelor degrees (Level 7) require a minimum of Grade O6/H7 or higher in five Leaving Certificate subjects, including Mathematics and English or Irish. The minimum points required for entry is 160.
- Bachelor's Degrees with Honours (Level 8) require a minimum of Grade O6/H7 or higher in six Leaving Certificate courses, including Mathematics and English or Irish. Of these, two must be passed in higher-level papers at Grade H5 or higher.

For further details on specific entry requirements, please follow this link: https://www.gmit.ie/study/apply-to-gmit/irisheu-students/cao-student/entry-requirements. Our university values academic excellence and strives to maintain high standards for our students. As such, meeting these requirements is crucial for admission to any of our programs. We encourage all applicants to work hard and achieve the necessary grades for successful entry into our university.

Name: Maynooth University
Overview:
Maynooth University (MU), a constituent of the National University of Ireland, is located in County Kildare, 25 km from the vibrant city of Dublin. With a diverse community of over 13,000 students and 900 staff members from more than 20 countries, MU is a hub of cultural diversity and academic excellence. The university offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs through its 26 departments and three faculties, including popular courses in Social Science, Humanities, and Natural Sciences. MU also has a strong focus on research, with esteemed research institutions such as the Irish Climate Analysis and Research Units (ICARUS), Institute of Immunology, National Institute for Regional and Spatial Analysis, The Callan Institute, and the National Centre for Geocomputation under its name.

At MU, students can enjoy top-notch facilities and modern amenities, with two connected northern and southern campuses. The university also provides on-campus accommodations in five different residences - The Courtyard Plaza, The Courtyard Apartment, The River Apartment, The Village Apartment, and The Rye Hall - for full-time registered students. Apart from academics, MU offers an active campus life with over 100 clubs and societies to choose from, including sports like rugby, badminton, tennis, surfing, canoeing, archery, and kayaking.

Furthermore, MU has strong connections with the industry, with top companies such as Google, Microsoft, Facebook, IBM, Intel, HP, Coca-Cola, Cadbury, Goldman Sachs, L'oreal, and Unilever actively involved in the university's activities. Students also have access to a plethora of scholarships, including the MU Entrance Scholarships, MU Sports Scholarships, and the Google Women Techmakers Undergraduate Scholar Award worth USD 1000, to support their academic endeavors.

In terms of tuition fees, MU offers competitive rates, with an average annual fee of USD 13,700 for undergraduate programs and USD 14,800 for postgraduate programs. With its exceptional academic programs, cutting-edge research facilities, and vast opportunities for professional growth, Maynooth University is truly a remarkable institution for students seeking to advance their education and career in Ireland.

Accommodation: Maynooth University offers on-campus housing options for its students, comprising of five diverse residences. These include Courtyard Plaza, Courtyard Apartment, River Apartment, Village Apartment, and The Rye Hall. Keep in mind that on-campus residences are only available for independent students who do not require any outside support. You can expect to share an apartment with people of various backgrounds, including different genders (excluding minors), nationalities, ages, and academic programs. Please note that families and children under the age of 17 are not permitted to live in the university halls. Some of the facilities provided on-campus include a microwave, oven, fridge, and kettle in the fully equipped kitchen, as well as a dining area and lounge. Moreover, all flats have access to free Wi-Fi. If you prefer to live off-campus, there are also fully furnished apartments available for rent at an average price of 500 to 600 EUR monthly. These include studio apartments, three-bedroom, four-bedroom, and communal apartments. You can expect to have services such as parking, central heating, cable television, a washing machine, dishwasher, and microwave in these off-campus accommodations. Additionally, some shared residences offer individual room rentals. So if you are interested in living off-campus, be sure to explore all options available to you.

Name: Trinity College Dublin, the University of Dublin
Overview:
Trinity College Dublin, established in 1592, is considered one of the oldest institutions in Ireland. It has a diverse student population of over 18,000 from 122 countries, and offers a wide range of programs including undergraduate, postgraduate, short courses, and online programs. Trinity is renowned for its exceptional programs in Law, Literature and Humanities, health sciences, and STEM fields.

The college has a competitive acceptance rate of 34%, and interested applicants can apply through the online portal with a fee of 55 EUR. Along with the application, students must submit their academic transcripts, IELTS/TOEFL scores, Letters of Recommendation, and a course-specific CV/resume. The campus spans across 51 acres and boasts impressive Georgian architecture, museums, art galleries, and theatres.

Home to Ireland's most extensive library with over 6 million printed volumes, Trinity Library is a prominent feature of the college. It is also home to the Trinity Business School, Science Gallery, the Long Room Hub Institute for Arts and Humanities, The Lir Academy for Dramatic Art, the nanoscience research center (CRANN), and the Biomedical Sciences Institute. The annual tuition fee ranges from USD 28,000 to 56,000.

To support students financially, the college offers various scholarships such as the Global Business Scholarship and the Postgraduate Research Scholarship. Additionally, students can avail 100% tuition fee waiver through the government of Ireland Scholarship. Accommodation options for students include The Trinity Hall, with a capacity of over 1,000 students, offering shared, single, and twin apartments. Other options include Kavanagh Court and Binary Hub. The average cost of rooms is USD 205 per week, and the annual cost of living can be up to USD 13,800.

Trinity takes pride in its more than 170 societies and sports clubs, providing students with a diverse range of activities to engage in. From hockey, rowing, and investing to advocacy, animation, and zoology, students can choose from a variety of clubs based on their interests. With its location in Ireland's Silicon Valley, the college boasts an impressive 92% employment rate. Graduates from Trinity College have found employment opportunities in some of the world's leading companies, including Google, Facebook, Microsoft, PayPal, LinkedIn, Airbnb, and eBay.
Eligibility Overview: All applicants must have a demonstrated command of the English language. The following qualifications are accepted: 1. Irish Leaving Certificate: a minimum score of 6 in ordinary level English. 2. GCSE: a grade of C or higher in English Language. 3. US High School: a C grade or higher in senior year English. A minimum of 6.5 on the IELTS (academic version) with no individual band score below 6 is required. For dental courses, a minimum of 7 on the IELTS (academic version) with no individual band score below 7 is required. For Clinical Speech and Language Studies, a minimum of 7 on the IELTS (academic version) with no individual band score below 7 is required. A minimum score of 63 on the Pearson Test of English (Academic) - PTE Academic with no score below 59 in the Communication Skills section is required. A minimum of 5 at Higher Level on English A1, A2, or B and a minimum of 4 at Standard Level when presenting IB through English are accepted from the International Baccalaureate program.
Placement: No text provided
Accommodation: The housing facilities at Trinity College Dublin are strategically located within the bustling city centre, either in historically rich buildings within the university's premises, or in more contemporary structures towards the east. This allows students to fully immerse themselves in the lively atmosphere of the city while being close to the university. Your housing experience at Trinity College will be unlike any other, as you will have the opportunity to reside in the spectacular surroundings of the university, which boasts a history of over 400 years. For further details on on-campus housing, please visit: https://www.tcd.ie/accommodation/on-campus/
Course Description:

Trinity College Dublin, the University of Dublin charges an average annual tuition fee of 18,860 EUR. Financial aid is available in the form of scholarships and grants. Some of the notable scholarships provided by the university are Centenary Scholarship Msc Marketing, Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University, Doris Dixon Scholarship, and University Of Calgary International Entrance Award. Name: EDUCO- Technological University Dublin
Overview: Technological University Dublin is the first of its kind in Ireland, established by merging Dublin Institute of Technology, the Institute of Technology, Blanchardstown, and the Institute of Technology, Tallaght. Spread across five main campuses, namely Grangegorman, Aungier Street, Bolton Street, Blanchardstown, and Tallaght, this prestigious university offers a diverse range of student-run societies and clubs, such as Gaelic Athletic Association, football, Handball, powerlifting, archery, rowing, skiing, basketball, kite surfing, and cricket. It boasts a massive population of over 28,500 students and 3,000 staff, with five colleges, affiliated schools, and various research institutes and centers focusing on computer science and STEM subjects. The most sought-after courses at TU Dublin include Product Design, Mechanical Engineering, Architecture, Engineering, Science, Marketing, Hospitality, Music, Optometry, Pharmaceuticals, Construction, Digital Media, and Journalism. Additionally, the TU Dublin Career Development Centre provides excellent job opportunities with leading companies like Accenture, Ernst and Young, Deloitte, Microsoft, Google, and Amazon. Accommodation choices for students at the university include homestays, student accommodation hubs, or private rentals through TU Dublin StudentPad. Living expenses can go up to EUR 12,000 annually, while tuition fees range from EUR 10,000 to 12,500. International students can also apply for scholarships like the Government of Ireland Scholarships and the Centenary Scholarships to fund their studies at TU Dublin.

Name: University College Cork
Overview:
Established in 1845, University College Cork (UCC) is a renowned research institute located in Cork, Ireland. It houses seven faculties - Commerce, Engineering, Arts and Celtic Studies, Medicine, Science, Law, and Food Science and Technology - under four colleges, namely College of Business and Law, College of Arts, Celtic Studies and Social Sciences, College of Medicine and Health, and College of Science, Engineering and Food Science. Spread over a sprawling 42 acres, the campus boasts modern infrastructure including Alfred O'Rahilly, Cavanagh Pharmacy, Brookfield Health Science Center, Bio Green Café, Lewis Glucksman Gallery, Boole Library, and more. With a student strength of more than 21,000, UCC offers a diverse range of extracurricular activities through its 50+ sports clubs and 100+ societies, catering to various interests like gaming, politics, social causes, religion, martial arts, and water sports.

UCC has stringent eligibility criteria for admissions, which includes a minimum score of 6.5 in IELTS, 90 in TOEFL, or 63 in PTE, along with an admission fee of 50 EUR. The university offers over 70 undergraduate and numerous postgraduate programs at an average tuition cost of 16,000-22,000 EUR and 14,000-20,000 EUR, respectively. To support international students financially, UCC provides various options like loans, bursaries, and scholarships, including the CACSSS Excellence Scholarship, SEFS Postgraduate and Undergraduate Scholarship, and Quercus Masters Scholarship, among others.

Name: Dublin City University
Overview: In 1989, Dublin City University (DCU) was founded as a prestigious global institution situated in Dublin, Ireland. Its five campuses, namely DCU Glasnevin, DCU Alpha Innovation, and DCU Sports Campuses in Glasnevin, and DCU St. Patrick's and DCU All Hallows Campuses in Drumcondra, are all located within a 3-kilometer radius and easily accessible via public transportation. The university is composed of five faculties: the Faculty of Science and Health, Faculty of Humanities & Social Science, Faculty of Engineering and Computing, DCU Institute of Business, and DCU Institute of Education. Additional facilities include the Sports Pavilion, Inter Faith Center with medical and counseling services, Church of Ireland Center, DCU Library with over 100 online databases, sound studios, computer labs, The Helix with Mahony Hall, six restaurants, a beauty salon, and general stores. DCU caters to more than 7,400 students who can choose from over 200 postgraduate and undergraduate degree programs in fields such as Business, Health, Sciences, Engineering, and Humanities. Interested applicants may apply for the Fall and Spring intakes once they have achieved the minimum English proficiency scores of IELTS (6.5), TOEFL (92), PRE (63), and completed a 50 EUR application fee. The tuition fees per undergraduate module amount to 900 EUR (for EU Students) and 1,280 EUR (for International students), while postgraduate courses cost 1,880 EUR (for EU Students) and 2,880 EUR (for international students). Financial assistance programs such as the Academic Scholarship Programme (up to 500 EUR), Merit Scholarship Program (up to 2,000 EUR), and Sports Scholarships are offered by the university to its students. On-campus accommodation options include the Hampstead Apartments and College Park Apartments, which offer 4-5 shared bedrooms. The total cost of 6,150 EUR covers amenities such as a kitchen, living room, free Wi-Fi, parking, ATM, and laundry services, among others. DCU also provides pre-placement sessions to enhance employment opportunities for its graduates, who can earn annual salaries ranging from 70,000 USD to 105,000 USD in renowned companies like Dell, Google, eBay, and Intel.

Admission to undergraduate programs is based on the applicant's performance in their high school graduation exams. The following requirements must be met for consideration:

- Scores from multiple sittings may be accepted to meet the entry and program requirements.
- Eligible applicants are evaluated and ranked by their school leaving examination scores for admission consideration.

The fields with the most lucrative job offers for DCU graduates include finance, management, consulting, accounting, and engineering.

Name: University of Limerick
Overview: Established in 1972 as the National Institute for Higher Education, the University of Limerick (UL) is situated in Limerick, Ireland. The university boasts a diverse community of over 11,000 full-time students and 1,300 dedicated staff members. It is composed of four faculties, namely the Kemmy Business School, Faculty of Education and Health Sciences, Faculty of Science and Engineering, and the Faculty of Arts, Humanities, and Social Sciences, offering more than 70 undergraduate and over 100 postgraduate programs, including doctorate and postdoctoral levels. UL prides itself on its unique co-operative education programs, where students have an opportunity to gain eight-month work experience with any of its 1,700 affiliated employers in the industry, public service, and commerce sectors. The university also offers on-campus accommodation for its students, providing 2,500 rooms in six student villages at an average cost of EUR 4,500 annually. When considering the cost of living, the total average for UL students is approximately EUR 10,500 per year. With its strong foundation in co-operative education, the university has become a top choice for students seeking valuable practical experience. To apply, students can visit the university's online portal, pay a 35 EUR application fee, and submit necessary documents, including official academic transcripts, mark sheets, degree completion certificates, and English language proficiency certificates. The cost of various courses may vary from EUR 11,500 to 43,000 per year; however, students can apply for financial aid through the Faculty of Science & Engineering Scholarships, Kemmy Business School International Scholarships, and the Faculty of Arts, Humanities & Social Sciences Scholarships, offering numerous opportunities to support their education.

The rooms are equipped with central heating powered by natural gas, making them comfortable and convenient during colder weather. Additionally, students have access to television and high-speed internet through the UL network. They can also make direct calls using phone cards. The rooms are equipped with necessary facilities to facilitate the garbage disposal process, with weekly pickups.

Students residing on-campus also have the privilege to access the UL Sport gym and pool facilities. For those who prefer to live off-campus, UL has various housing options available on rent. Name: University College Dublin
Overview:
Established in 1854, University College Dublin (UCD) is a renowned public research university located in Belfield, Dublin, Ireland. With a strong academic background and an impressive faculty, UCD is home to six distinct colleges, including the UCD College of Arts and Humanities, UCD College of Engineering and Architecture, UCD College of Social Sciences and Law, UCD College of Science, UCD College of Business, and UCD College of Health and Agricultural Sciences.

UCD offers a diverse range of programs, encompassing 70 majors across 38 schools in various fields, such as Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Architecture, Agriculture, and more. The university also offers PhD programs to students seeking advanced research opportunities.

Students meeting the minimum language proficiency requirements of IELTS (6.5), TOEFL (90), UCLES (Grade c), or PTE (Grade C) can apply online with a nominal application fee of 50 EUR. The tuition fee for undergraduate and graduate courses ranges from 19,900 EUR to 25,600 EUR and 8,500 EUR to 25,600 EUR, respectively. UCD provides various financial aid programs, including President's Awards, UCD Ad Astra Academy, University Scholars, UCS CSC Scholarship Scheme, and UCD Global Excellence Graduate Scholarships, which can cover up to 50-100% of the tuition fee.

UCD graduates have a high employability rate, thanks to the university's industry-focused curriculum and Work Placement Management service. This service helps students secure jobs, internships, and part-time work in top companies like Google, Amazon, Apple, Accenture, and Dell, with an impressive annual package ranging from 77,000 USD to 110,000 USD.

Name: National College of Art and Design
Overview: Data regarding the foundation and evolution of the National College of Art and Design traces back to the establishment of Robert West's drawing school in George's Lane in 1746, which was funded by the Dublin Society. This institution has been greatly influenced by the French Enlightenment, Victorian schools of design, the Arts and Crafts movement, the search for Irish national identity, and developments in British art education in the 1960s. The college has played a significant role in shaping Irish social and cultural developments, particularly in the field of painting, sculpture, and applied adornment in architecture and crafts during the 18th century. Notable Irish artists, such as Sir William Orpen and Oliver Sheppard, have also studied at this prestigious institution. The college has been a driving force in pushing for the reform of industrial design, especially after Ireland gained independence and was looking towards a new economic future. To further strengthen its academic independence, a statute was passed in 1971, giving the college greater autonomy. In 1975, there was a major reformation, expanding the range of degree programs. The college relocated to Thomas Street in the early 1980s, allowing for further expansion of the undergraduate program and the addition of various postgraduate courses and research-based options, including doctoral level studies.
Eligibility Overview:
The following information pertains to the academic requirements for both undergraduate and graduate programs at NCAD for international students: 
1. Undergraduate applicants must possess a high school diploma from their country of origin, equivalent to the Irish School Leaving Certificate.
For admission, certified copies of their secondary or equivalent examination transcripts are required. 
Both the original transcripts and an English translation must be submitted. 
2. Graduate applicants must provide certified transcripts of all previous academic achievements, including secondary or comparative exams and bachelor's degree scores. 
Original transcripts and an English translation must be submitted. 
3. In terms of language proficiency, applicants from non-English speaking countries are required to provide evidence of fluency. 
Equivalent scores from standardized English language proficiency tests are accepted. 
4. These guidelines are important for ensuring that international students meet the necessary academic qualifications for successful enrollment at NCAD.

Name: Dublin Business School
Overview: Founded in 1975, Dublin Business School is an autonomous college situated in the thriving city of Dublin, Ireland. The institute boasts of six well-equipped campuses spread across Aungier Street, Dame Street, Balfe Street, and South Great George's Street to cater to its diverse student population. Its three renowned schools, namely Professional School, School of Business and Law, and School of Arts, offer a wide range of full-time and part-time learning programs that give students access to state-of-the-art facilities, cutting-edge labs, and round-the-clock library services. DBS also offers a vibrant campus life with over 30 sports clubs, including cricket, football, and basketball, and various societies such as law, computer, psychology, debate, fashion, among others, for students to join and explore their interests. With more than 100 courses, including 70 for international students, DBS offers undergraduate and postgraduate programs in disciplines such as Arts, Information Technology, Accounting and Finance, Law, Journalism, and more. The annual tuition fee for undergraduate and postgraduate courses is 9,800 EUR and 13,500 EUR, respectively, and students are required to pay an admission fee of 50 EUR. Apart from these costs, DBS offers partial scholarships of 500 EUR for Level 6, Level 7, and Level 8 programs, and 1000 EUR for Level 9 courses, to provide financial support to international students. Moreover, students can also benefit from the Refer a Friend scheme with a reward of 500 EUR (for Ireland students) and 300 EUR (for overseas students). Housing options near the main campus include student apartments and privately-owned host family accommodations that are conveniently located. One of the popular student residences, Point Campus in Point Village, offers single, double, cluster, and ensuite room options with an average rent of 600 EUR to 1,100 EUR per month. All accommodations are equipped with essential amenities such as washing machines, free internet access, standard rooms, study space, bike storage, launderette, and 24/7 security. DBS also has a dedicated Careers and Appointment Service that organizes various events to help students develop their intellectual skills and prepare them for the professional world. Graduates from Dublin Business School have an average starting salary ranging from 47,000 USD to 72,000 USD per year, making it a highly sought-after institute for higher education.
Eligibility Overview:
Specified Requirements for Admissions at a University

For undergraduate (UG) students: Completion of grade 12 in a relevant field from a recognized board of education. While submission of SAT scores is not compulsory, it is highly recommended.

For graduate (MS) students: Applicants must possess a bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline from a recognized university. The submission of GRE scores is not mandatory.

For Master of Business Administration (MBA) students: Candidates must hold a bachelor's degree in a relevant field from a recognized university, equivalent to Level 8 education in Ireland. They must also submit a GMAT score. Additionally, a minimum of 2-3 years of work experience is required for admission.

English language proficiency requirements are as follows: a minimum score of 6.0 in IELTS or 95 in Duolingo English Test (DET).

Note: This information is crucial for candidates seeking admission to our university, and we request them to strictly adhere to these requirements.

This information, pertaining to the income of graduates from Dublin Business School, suggests that their Executive MBA program provides the most lucrative career opportunities. Accommodation:
University students may choose from a variety of accommodation options during their time at Dublin Business School (DBS). These options include on-campus housing, off-campus accommodations, private student residences, and hostels.

On-Campus Living
DBS offers students the option to live on-campus in their own apartments, which are equipped with all necessary amenities. These apartments are conveniently located in the heart of Dublin, with easy access to transportation services. The university assists students in finding suitable housing on campus.

Off-Campus Accommodations
DBS campuses are situated in central Dublin, providing students with excellent transportation links to the rest of the city. The university offers guidance and support for students in finding off-campus accommodations. 

Private Student Residences
A popular choice amongst students, private student residences provide fully furnished, self-catering houses or flats with multiple single and sometimes double bedrooms. These residences have shared bathrooms, a living/kitchen area, and offer facilities and services tailored for students. Free Wi-Fi is available in all bedrooms.

Rent or Share
Every year, DBS students independently arrange their accommodations, which may include long-term or short-term rentals, as well as sharing arrangements. The university provides resources to assist students in finding suitable housing options.

Hostels
Students can also stay in hostels, which can be booked online through various website services. These hostels are located throughout the city and offer special amenities

Name: Santa Monica College
Overview: Santa Monica College, established in 1929, is a public community college located in Santa Monica, California. Students interested in pursuing an associate degree, bachelor of science, or general education can do so through Santa Monica College. In addition, there is a variety of occupational certificate programs available, including Fashion Design and Accounting, as well as a Logistics and Supply Chain program at the AAS and certificate levels. This college is one of a few community colleges with access to a Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy instrument for research purposes. It is accredited by the Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges. Students benefit from various services offered by the college, such as tutoring, education planning, child care, and on-campus employment opportunities. Incoming students may also qualify for special scholarships ranging from $250 to $2,000.

Eligibility Overview:
Here are the requirements for obtaining admission into the Eckelkamp College of Global Business and Professional Studies:

1. Prospective students must possess a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting or an equivalent qualification.

2. To be considered for admission, applicants must have a minimum undergraduate GPA of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale and have scored a total of 475 or higher on the GMAT exam taken within the last five years. However, this criterion may be waived if one of the following conditions is met:

(a) The student has completed an undergraduate degree from an accredited program accredited by AACSB or ACBSP with a cumulative GPA of at least 3.3 in the past five years.

(b) The applicant has earned a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher in an area that requires a significant amount of analytical or quantitative work, such as business, economics, engineering, statistics, computer science, or law.

3. Applicants must submit a self-statement of 300-500 words explaining the importance of obtaining a graduate accounting degree from Fontbonne University.

4. A current resume must be provided.

5. Proof of English language proficiency is required for non-native English speakers. Applicants must submit TOEFL or IELTS scores (or an approved equivalent from Fontbonne University). A minimum TOEFL IBT score of 71 or IELTS score of 6.0 is necessary.

Applications will be evaluated based on the availability of the program. Complete applications must be submitted at least 14 days before the start of the first term in which the student intends to enroll.

Name: Central Washington University
Overview:
Established in 1891 as the Washington State Normal School, Central Washington University (CWU) achieved university status in 1937. Located in Ellensburg, Washington, this public institution is accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities. With an acceptance rate of 85%, CWU ranks among the top 25 public schools in the US. The university has a total of eight campuses situated at various locations in Washington, in addition to its 380-acre main campus in Ellensburg. Offering over 135 undergraduate, 34 postgraduate, online and Summer programs, CWU's academic offerings are divided into four colleges: the College of Business, College of Sciences, College of Arts and Humanities, and College of Education and Professional Studies. Students can choose from a wide range of subjects, including Chemistry, Education, Physics, Criminal Justice, Health Sciences, Psychology, Social Sciences, Computer Science, Law, Business, and Mathematics.

CWU provides on-campus housing accommodations in 19 residential halls and four apartments, offering fully-furnished single, double, and triple occupancy rooms. These facilities also include Wi-Fi, laundry services, lounges, and designated study areas. The campus boasts of a bookstore, library, Recreation Centre, Veterans Center, dining options, and even a radio station. On the extracurricular front, students have access to over 125 clubs and organizations, including 23 sports clubs and 13 varsity teams.

One of the main goals of Central Washington University is to prepare students for the job market. The university achieves this through a range of resources, including mock interviews, career fairs, and workshops. With a graduation rate of 64%, CWU has a strong track record of helping students secure employment within two years of graduation. On average, these graduates earn an annual salary of 44,900 USD.

For international students looking to study at CWU, the average undergraduate tuition fee is 23,262 USD. However, the university offers a range of merit-based scholarships, with an average award amount of 12,500 USD. These scholarships greatly assist students in making their education more affordable
Eligibility Overview:
Required English Proficiency Levels
1) Achieving a minimum of 79 on the TOEFL iBT (Test of English as a Foreign Language) is necessary. To register for the TOEFL or request score delivery, visit the official website at www.toefl.org. The school's code is #4044. 
For a computer-based TOEFL score, a minimum of 213 is required. In case of an internet-based TOEFL, the score must be 79 or higher. 
For online English programs, a TOEFL score of 88 or above is mandatory. 
Please note that photocopies, "examinee copy" or scores older than 2 years will not be accepted by the Graduate School. 
2) Achieving a minimum academic score of 6.5 on the IELTS (International English Language Testing System) is necessary. The scores should not be more than 2 years old. 
3) A minimum of 105 on the Duolingo English Test is required. This is to ensure a good understanding of the language.

Name: University of Alabama
Overview: The University of Alabama, located in Tuscaloosa, is a state-funded research institution that was established in 1831. Approximately 83% of applicants are accepted at the university, and there are a total of 37,842 students enrolled in various undergraduate, graduate, and professional programs offered by the 13 schools and colleges within the university. These include the College of Arts & Sciences, College of Education, School of Law, and College of Engineering. The institution boasts around 200 programs, with a mix of both undergraduate (around 70) and graduate (around 120) options in fields such as Accounting, Communicative Disorders, Geology, Hospitality Management, and Music Composition. Encouraging distance learning, the University of Alabama provides more than 70 online degree programs across all levels. The university also has designated programs such as the Emerging Scholars Program, UA Early College, and Academic Common Market. Additionally, the university offers an Education Abroad program that allows students to study in over 60 countries worldwide. The estimated cost for undergraduate attendance at the university is USD 25,216 for in-state students and USD 44,686 for out-of-state students. To apply for financial aid, students can complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, which grants access to various options such as loans, scholarships, grants, and work-study programs. These options include the Federal Direct Subsidized/Unsubsidized Stafford Loan, Federal Grad PLUS Loan, Federal Pell Grant, and on/off-campus jobs, among others.
Eligibility Overview: The University of Alabama requires applicants to have a minimum GPA of 3.71 and a higher than average ranking in their high school class. A mix of A's and B's, with a greater number of A's, is recommended for admission. Taking more advanced courses such as AP or IB can compensate for a lower GPA as it demonstrates academic ability beyond the standard high school level. For juniors or seniors, improving GPA in time for college applications can be challenging. In this case, a higher SAT or ACT score is needed to compete effectively with applicants who have a higher GPA than the average of 3.71. While some colleges claim to have no SAT cutoff score, they typically have an average score for the school. The 25th percentile for New SAT scores is 1060 and the 75th percentile is 1280. This means that a score of 1060 or below is considered below average, while a score of 1280 or above is considered above average.

University Ranking:
The University of Alabama is a highly regarded institution in the United States, ranking #143 among all national universities in US News and World Report's 2021 rankings. Its ranking has significantly improved since 2020 when it was recorded at #153. This is due to its notable high acceptance rate of 83% (as reported for admissions in 2020). To be considered for admission, applicants must have a strong GPA, class rank, and high ACT or SAT scores. In addition, letters of recommendation carry significant weight in the application process.

In the global rankings, the University of Alabama holds the position of #419 according to US News and World Report's 2021 rankings. This ranking has remained constant since 2019, maintaining its status outside the top 500 universities in the world. However, the university's ranking in the THE - World University Rankings for 2021 has dropped to the range of 601–800 from 2020 when it was placed between 401 and 500. THE has not provided a breakdown for further ranking since the University of Alabama does not fall among the top 500 universities in the world.

On the other hand, the University of Alabama's position on the QS - World University ranking for 2021 is between 801 to 1000. This university has received lower-than-average ratings in most of the ranking categories managed by QS: employer reputation: 27.7, citations per faculty: 14.5, international student ratio: 4, and academic reputation: 9.4. This has resulted in the university not receiving a total score as it is ranked over 500 in the QS rankings.

In summary, the University of Alabama is a highly sought-after institution in the United States, boasting a rising ranking in the national rankings and a constant position in the global rankings. However, it has room for improvement when it comes to its ranking in the THE and QS rankings, where it falls below the top 500 universities in the world.

U.S. News & World Report ranked the University of the Pacific at 136 for National Universities in 2022. Approximately 72% of full-time undergraduate students receive need-based financial aid, with an average award of $30,000 to $35,000. Name: Kaplan International Languages - Chicago
Overview:
Based on the world-renowned shopping district of Chicago, the Magnificent Mile, lies Kaplan International Languages - Chicago. Kaplan International Languages - Chicago has been accredited by the Accrediting Council for Continuing Education and Training (ACCET).

The institute offers a variety of English courses, including Exam Preparation Courses, Long-Term English Courses, Business English Courses, and Flexible English Courses. The Flexible English Courses allow students to tailor their learning to their own schedule, ranging from one week to a year. These courses are designed to help students improve their general English skills at their own pace. For those looking for a longer commitment, the institute offers Long-Term English Courses lasting more than 20 weeks, with options for both General and Intensive programs. The Business English Courses are also flexible in nature, with duration options ranging from a few weeks to accommodate students' busy schedules. By enrolling in one of these accredited courses, students can not only enhance their level of English but also learn vocabulary relevant to a professional environment. Similarly, Kaplan International Languages - Chicago's Exam Preparation Courses, with a duration of 1 to 24 weeks depending on the course or location, help students improve their English skills and increase their chances of achieving higher test scores.

The institute boasts two classrooms and two student lounges, creating an ideal environment for learning. With an average of 160 students, the school sees a high recommendation rate of 96.5%. The multi-lingual staff, fluent in French, Italian, Russian, Turkish, and Arabic, make students from all backgrounds feel welcome. Additionally, Kaplan International Languages - Chicago hosts three social activities per week, giving students the opportunity to not only socialize with fellow peers but also explore the vibrant city of Chicago.

Name: Northeastern Illinois University
Overview:
Northeastern Illinois University, situated in Chicago, USA, provides a wide range of programs for both undergraduate and postgraduate students, along with online courses for those seeking distance education. The total cost for attending the university will vary depending on the course of study and whether a student is international or domestic.

Scholarships, work-study programs, and other forms of financial aid are available to students at Northeastern Illinois University. The university also offers career planning services to assist students in creating resumes and securing employment opportunities, whether it be upon completing their degree, finding a part-time or summer job, or obtaining an internship.
Eligibility Overview:
Northeastern Illinois University requires international applicants to possess English language proficiency in order to be considered for admission. This can be demonstrated by achieving a minimum passing score on either the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). Eligibility for waiver of this requirement may be determined for those who have completed high school or post-secondary education in an English-language institution in their home country. To check for waiver eligibility, you can complete the English Proficiency Waiver form or contact the Office of International Programs at international-programs@neiu.edu. If you do not meet the English proficiency requirements, you may enroll in the university's Intensive English Program through the School for the Advancement of English Language and Learning (SAELL) to fulfill this requirement.

Minimum scores required for graduate admissions are as follows:

- TOEFL: 550
- Computer-based TOEFL: 213
- Internet-based TOEFL: 79
- IELTS: 6.5 composite score

For admission to the Master of Arts in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL) program, a minimum TOEFL score of 95 or an IELTS score of 7.0 is required.
Placement: The Student Center for Science Engagement at Northeastern Illinois University (NEIU) provides a range of resources and opportunities specifically designed to support science students. These offerings include personalized guidance, academic support, career development, summer research options, and access to scientific conferences. Students in the Information Technology (IT) and Software department at NEIU can expect to earn a competitive salary, with an average annual pay of 98,000 USD. Meanwhile, graduates with a Bachelor of Science degree typically earn around 81,000 USD per year, while those with a Bachelor of Arts degree tend to earn approximately 45,000 USD annually.
Accommodation: Northeastern University offers on-campus student housing options for local, national, and international students. The Nest, which is the university's inaugural residence hall, is positioned towards the west of the central campus area. It comprises of both two and four-bedroom units, all of which are impeccably designed and feature shared bathrooms. Amenities provided include a fully-equipped fitness center complete with strength and cardio equipment, a recreational center with various games and pool tables, furnished apartments, private bedrooms with attached bathrooms, and a sparkling swimming pool. In addition to this, students are also provided with access to modern kitchens equipped with necessary appliances, convenient on-site laundry facilities, as well as essential utilities. While filling out the housing application, students are required to pay a non-refundable application fee of $50, along with a security deposit of $250. For those interested, off-campus student housing options are also available to explore within the United States.

The primary factor for admission to Colorado Mesa University is academic excellence that meets the university's standards. This includes achieving a minimum score of 980 on the SAT or a 61 on the ACT, as well as maintaining a GPA of at least 3.16.

At Nebraska Wesleyan University, we offer on-campus accommodation options that are designed to actively engage, enrich, and enhance your overall university experience. One of the key learning experiences in a residential liberal arts college is living on campus. It allows students to be more connected to the university community, learn important life skills and build tight-knit relationships with their fellow students. Moreover, each facility comes with a central living area, community TV/lounge, laundry rooms, and kitchenettes for your convenience.

Centennial Hall, a co-ed residential hall, is an ideal accommodation for first-year and international students. It consists of single and double rooms that are built around shared lounge areas known as "pods". In addition to gender-specific pods, we also offer gender-neutral pods to cater to a diverse student body. Centennial Hall, which is situated on the Northwest side of our campus, offers a safe, welcoming, and convenient living environment for our students.

Johnson Hall, our most historic residence hall, is an all-female accommodation option that exudes charm and character. It underwent a major renovation in 2012, which added air conditioning, an elevator, and other modern facilities to improve accessibility, increase energy efficiency and enhance the overall living experience for our students.

Pioneer Hall, our recently rebuilt residence hall, offers a vibrant and supportive living environment for first-year students. Connected to Johnson Hall by a large basement lounge, Pioneer Hall is co-ed on most floors and offers air-conditioned living spaces with a variety of amenities, including workstations, pool tables, study rooms, and a TV/social lounge. The convenient location of Pioneer Hall, which is in close proximity to the Story Student Center and dining hall, makes it a popular choice among our students.

Plainsman Hall, another co-ed accommodation option, is situated near the Elder Memorial Speech and Theatre Center and the Weary Center for Health and Fitness. Its modern design includes built-in workstations and shelving, making the most out of the available space. The basement lounge in Plainsman Hall features a kitchen, pool table, ping-pong table, and a TV/social area, making it the ideal spot for students to relax and socialize. Plainsman Hall is home to many first-year students and is co-ed on most floors.

For our sophomore and junior students, we offer air-conditioned suite-style living in Heim and White Suites. These suites feature a central living area with a kitchenette, two bedrooms, and two bathrooms. Each floor in these buildings also has a lounge area with a variety of amenities, including a TV, pool table, foosball, and study tables. The Townhouse Village, our self-contained living option, offers 30 four-person flats equipped with individual bedrooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen with modern appliances, and a washer/dryer. Our student apartments, which are reserved for our junior and senior students, provide individual living spaces and feature a variety of amenities, including a kitchen, refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher, and washer/dryer.

Finally, we also offer Greek housing options to our students. After two complete semesters in a residential hall, students who are active members in good standing can reside in a sorority or fraternity chapter house approved by the university. These houses are self-governing, but we offer support through professional staff advisors, chapter advisors, and live-in chapter directors/parents. Our Greek housing options must meet specific criteria to be considered acceptable campus housing, and our Center for Student Involvement and Residential Education has all the necessary information for interested students.

At Nebraska Wesleyan University, we strive to provide our students with comfortable, safe, and convenient on-campus accommodation options to enrich their university experience. We aim to create a supportive and inclusive community for our students, and our residential facilities play a vital role in achieving this goal.

Name: Purdue University Northwest
Overview:
Purdue University Northwest (PNW) is a prestigious urban college with two separate locations, serving around 8800 undergraduate and graduate students. The two campuses are situated in Hammond and Westville, both of which have been accredited by the Higher Learning Commission (HLC). PNW is home to five distinguished colleges, offering a total of over 70 areas of study for both graduate and undergraduate students. The institute consistently receives recognition as one of the top regional universities, as per the U.S. News & World Report Best Colleges rankings. PNW offers multiple programs, including Majors, Minors, Certificates, Graduate, Undergraduate, Concentration, and Combined (4+1) courses. Some notable colleges and schools at PNW include the School of Education and Counseling, White Lodging School of Hospitality and Tourism Management, School of Engineering, etc.

Several programs are offered at PNW, such as the Post-Master’s Certificate in Adult-Gerontology Clinical Nurse Specialist, BSCmpE/MSECE in Computer Engineering, Master of Science in Couple and Family Therapy, and MSEd in School Counseling, among others. The annual In-State Tuition Fee for Full-Time Undergraduate programs ranges from $8,000 - $8,100. For Out-of-State students, the same program costs between $11,600 - $11,700. These fees are based on a full-time enrollment of 12-18 credit hours for the spring of 2022 and fall of 2021. Domestic non-resident students enrolled before fall 2018 will be charged at the international rate. PNW offers various scholarships to recognize students' achievements and provide financial assistance, categorized as Admissions Scholarships and Specialty Scholarships.

PNW graduates have a wide range of career opportunities in thriving industries, such as manufacturing, education, and healthcare. Some of the top employers of PNW alumni include Michigan City Area Schools, Parkview Health, and La Porte Hospital. PNW alumni hold prestigious positions in prominent organizations worldwide, like Amazon and Microsoft.
Eligibility Overview:
Purdue University Northwest evaluates applicants based on their demonstrated academic excellence, including possessing a high school diploma or GED, fulfilling subject requirements, achieving high grades in relevant courses, overall GPA, class rank, and SAT, rSAT, or ACT scores. The strength of the college preparatory program is also taken into consideration, with a Core 40 diploma being a requirement for applicants graduating from an Indiana public high school in 2011 or later. 

To provide evidence of English proficiency, applicants must submit one of the following tests taken within the last two years: a minimum score of 79 on the iBT or 550 on the paper-based version of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), a minimum score of 6.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), a score of 480 or higher on the Critical Reading section of the Scholastic Assessment Test (SAT), or a grade of A or B on the Ordinary Level English Language Exam (GCSE/IGCSE) in the United Kingdom.

If the results turn out to be positive, further x-rays will be necessary to determine the presence of active tuberculosis. Prior to their arrival on campus, the student's physician must provide documents regarding the x-ray results and any prescribed medication. If medication is needed, it must be started before entering the country to comply with health requirements.

The University of Hawaii at Manoa is a well-known public institution situated in Hawaii, USA, catering to students across the country. The university was established in 1907, initially as a college focusing on agriculture and mechanical arts. Its primary campus is located in Honolulu's Manoa Valley and has expanded over the years to become the flagship campus of the University of Hawaii program. It also boasts of top-notch research resources, such as the Hawaii Institute of Geophysics and Planetology and the Hawaii Institute of Marine Biology, to aid students in their academic pursuits. 
The university consists of 17 schools and colleges offering an extensive range of 200 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs in diverse fields of education. Some of its distinguished programs include MA in Economics, Masters in Accounting, and MS in Civil Engineering. The institution pulls a diverse student body from all around the world, furnishing a dynamic learning environment. With over 200 student organizations, there are abundant opportunities for students to interact and collaborate with peers beyond their academics, fostering holistic development. 
The University of Hawaii at Manoa has produced notable alumni, including eminent names like US Senator Daniel Inouye, former astronaut Ed Lu, and Richard Parsons, the former chairperson of Citigroup. The annual cost of attendance at this prestigious institution varies depending on the chosen course and its duration but can average around USD 30,000.
Eligibility Overview: This is essential data for an official university application, encompassing all necessary information. It is imperative to include all valid academic transcripts, certificates, or grade records showcasing your high school and post-secondary education. An overall grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or above is mandatory. For international applicants, submitting ACT/SAT results is not compulsory. However, certain standardised tests may be required: International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma, Hong Kong Advance Level Examination (HKALE) results, national college entrance exams from your home country (e.g. China Gaokao), and national qualification/credential certificates (e.g. Australia HSC). Additionally, evidence of English proficiency is also necessary, with a minimum TOEFL, IELTS, or EIKEN score required. International applicants must adhere to these English competence verification standards, with the university's basic requirements being TOEFL, IELTS, and EIKEN test scores.

Course Description: University of Hawaii at Manoa is recognized globally for its exceptional academic programs and research contributions. Founded in 1907, it has established itself as a prestigious higher education institution. Located in Honolulu, USA, the university has a diverse and inclusive community of approximately 900 international students. Its reputation for providing high-quality education and conducting groundbreaking research makes it a popular choice for students worldwide. According to Webometrics - World rankings, University of Hawaii at Manoa is ranked 861th among top universities. The university offers a wide range of undergraduate, master's, and doctoral degrees in various fields such as Business, Humanities, and Engineering. It has four intakes in September, January, October, and February. The duration of undergraduate programs is typically four years, while master's programs take one year to complete. The average annual tuition fee for University of Hawaii at Manoa is approximately $30,000 - $45,000. However, the university offers several scholarships and grants to assist students financially, including the USC Associates Scholarships for undergraduate business programs, Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship, You Are Welcome Here Scholarship for undergraduate study in Kinesiology at Michigan State University, and Graduate Incentive Award for MS Applied Economics. The university boasts a beautiful and extensive campus, comprising modern buildings, a well-equipped research library, state-of-the-art laboratories, various centers, clubs, and student residences. Besides its academic excellence, another factor attracting international students to University of Hawaii at Manoa is its post-study work opportunities in the USA. The university fosters a supportive and nurturing environment for students to achieve their career goals and make a positive impact on society. University of Hawaii at Manoa has specific admission requirements, including English proficiency scores such as IELTS and TOEFL and standardized test scores for exams like GRE, SAT, and GMAT. Additionally, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, transcripts from previous schools or colleges, and valid passports and visas for admission.

Name: Bowie State University
Overview: Bowie State University, BSU, holds the distinction of being the first historically black college in the state of Maryland. The institution was established in 1865 by the Baltimore Association for Educational & Moral Development. It is strategically located in Bowie, Maryland, spreading across a sprawling 988 square feet, in close proximity to the city hubs of Washington D.C. and Baltimore. Bowie University offers a diverse range of academic programs, including 22 undergraduate, 19 master's, 2 PhD, and 14 certificate programs, catering to the demands of the ever-evolving job market. Popular majors at BSU include Criminal Justice/Safety Studies, Business Administration & Management, Psychology, Biology/Biological Sciences, and Radio & Television Broadcasting Technology. With an impressive student-faculty ratio of 15:1, Bowie State University focuses on providing quality education to its students. The university also offers various career opportunities, such as Internship programs, Fellowships, Co-op Jobs, Enterprise Management Training programs, and placement assistance after graduation. In terms of extracurricular activities, BSU has a vibrant community, with over 50 clubs for students to join, allowing them to expand their network and make new connections. The campus also features six modern residence halls, fully furnished with essential amenities, providing a comfortable living experience for students. When it comes to affordability, the average in-state cost of attendance at Bowie State University is $8,444 per year, with the out-of-state fee averaging at $19,136 annually, exclusive of additional expenses. The university also offers need-based financial aid and scholarships for full-time undergraduates, with a maximum amount of $7,535.
Eligibility Overview: This university requires applicants to hold a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution with a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale. While conditional admission may be considered for students with a lower GPA, official transcripts must be submitted for evaluation. Transcripts can be evaluated through various methods, including SpanTran, Pathways World Education Services, and Educational Credentials Evaluators. It is also necessary for international students to demonstrate proficiency in English by submitting a satisfactory score from one of the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, or Pearson PTE Academic. This requirement is important for effective communication and academic success at our university.

Placement: The university holds annual career fairs for students to connect with potential employers. These campus events are a great opportunity for companies like Providence Centre Inc, Maryland State Government, and Kearney & Company to recruit talented individuals.
Accommodation: Bowie State University offers students the option to live on-campus in six residence halls or the Christa McAuliffe Residential Community (CMRC), as well as off-campus housing connected to the university. The CMRC provides fully-furnished apartments with one, two, or three bedrooms, while the other residence halls offer double rooms, communal bathrooms, and kitchens. Each dorm has amenities such as vending machines, laundry facilities, cable TV, a lounge area, kitchenettes, and air conditioning. Students with disabilities can receive assistance in finding suitable housing through the Disability Support Services. However, first-year students are not eligible for CMRC housing.

Name: Bluffton University

The university has received programmatic accreditation from the Higher Learning Commission for four programs: dietetics, education, music, and social work. There is a wide variety of over eighty majors, minors, and interdisciplinary programs offered, along with sixteen NCAA Division III athletic teams.

Accommodation:
Bluffton University believes that a student's on-campus lodging is crucial to their overall experience in college. Having said that, the institution fosters students to build relationships within their classrooms, as well as in various social and recreational activities like sports and student organizations. In order to ensure that this community spirit is maintained, Bluffton requires all traditional undergraduate students, who do not live with their parents or spouse and are situated within a reasonable commuting distance, to reside in one of the university's residential halls. These living arrangements not only provide students with a comfortable and convenient living space, but also facilitate the building of long-lasting connections among them. 

Bluffton's residence life program oversees six halls and one set of apartments, where students work as support staff such as hall directors, resident advisers, and ministry assistants. Each hall has its own unique features, but all are equipped with the necessary amenities to make students feel at home. 

Bren-Dell Hall, which was built in 1962 and accommodates 95 students, is located by Riley Creek's waterside. This gender-segregated residence has separate floors for men and women, with a kitchen on each level. The second floor also has a spacious study lounge, while the main entrance's lobby was recently renovated in 2015. 

Hirschy Annex, which was built in 1966 and has room for 107 students, is divided into three floors with separate wings for men and women. The building features a lobby with a computer lab on each level as well as a kitchen on the first floor. A unique feature of this residence hall is the iconic bronze cast of Bluffton's first president, Noah Hirschy, in the lobby. Legend has it that rubbing his nose before an exam brings good luck. 

Hirschy Hall is another traditional residence hall on campus with room for 97 students, built in 1963. Similar to Hirschy Annex, this hall also has separate floors for men and women and a kitchen on each level. The main lobby on the ground floor is spacious and airy, making it a popular spot for students to gather. 

Neufeld Hall, which opened its doors in 2003, is the newest residence hall at Bluffton University. The 108 students residing here are divided into wings by gender, with seniors and juniors given priority. Neufeld's unique furnishings allow students to rearrange their rooms in 50 different configurations without requiring any tools or hardware. Each room also comes equipped with basic necessities such as a bed, desk, and bookcase. 

Ramseyer Hall is a 109-student, co-ed residence hall with ample facilities such as an elevator, a fitness center, and two computer labs. The building's nine floors have study lounges and kitchens on six levels, while the first floor has a fully-equipped kitchen and a conference room. 

Finally, Ropp Hall is the largest residence hall on campus, with room for 231 students. As the first women's residence hall at Bluffton, Ropp has a rich history - its first wing was built in 1914, followed by an annex in 1958 and an addition in 1967. The building's nine floors have a central lounge and different areas designated for studying and cooking. 

All the residence halls on campus have a main lobby with cable television, a kitchenette with basic appliances, laundry facilities, and storage space. Ironing boards are also available in designated areas. Bluffton's residence halls are a welcoming and comfortable space for students to live, learn, and make lasting friendships.

Bluffton University is a prestigious higher education institution recognized globally since its establishment in 1899. Name: Stony Brook University
Overview: Founded in 1957, Stony Brook University is renowned as one of the leading public institutions in the United States. Located in New York, this university has made significant contributions to NASA. Its distinguished research capabilities have even earned it an honorary membership in the Universities Research Association. With a strong focus on research, Stony Brook University offers a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs to its students. Its offerings include various colleges and schools such as the College of Business, College of Engineering and Applied Sciences, Renaissance School of Medicine, School of Health Technology and Management, School of Professional Development, School of Nursing, College of Arts and Sciences, Graduate School, School of Dental Medicine, School of Journalism, School of Social Welfare, and School of Marine and Atmospheric Sciences. Popular programs include Biomedical Engineering, Nursing, Computer Science, and Psychology. Additionally, students have the option to participate in programs like National Student Exchange, Study Abroad, SUNY Korea, and Semester by the Sea. Notable programs at Stony Brook University include the MBA, M.Sc in Finance, B.Sc in Business Management, M.Sc in Mechanical Engineering, and M.Sc in Computer Engineering. Tuition fees for these programs vary, with a minimum fee of USD 10,175.
Eligibility Overview:
Below are the requirements for admission to our university for undergraduate, postgraduate, and MBA programs. Please note the specific academic criteria and standards that applicants must meet to be considered for admission.

For undergraduate programs, candidates must have completed their secondary education in their home country, with a preference for a rigorous curriculum that includes courses in math, science, and English.

Postgraduate programs require a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or its equivalent. If a student has not yet completed their undergraduate studies, their admission will depend on the submission of a final transcript showing the degree and date of completion.

For MBA programs, a 3.0 GPA in previous academic work is necessary for admission. In exceptional cases, a GPA below 3.0 may be considered as conditional admission to the College of Business. However, students admitted on these terms must achieve a 3.0 GPA in their first semester to continue their studies.

It is required to have a minimum GMAT score of 550. However, exceeding this minimum does not ensure automatic admission, as all applications are thoroughly reviewed. The official GMAT score report must be submitted for the application process to proceed.

Additionally, applicants must meet the English language proficiency requirements.

Undergraduate Lodging: Undergraduates can choose between corridor style and suite-style housing. The former offers a double/single bedroom, shared bathroom, and a communal lounge. The latter provides two or three rooms that can accommodate four to six people, along with a shared bathroom and a common room. There are several housing locations to choose from, including West Apartment, Chavez Hall, Tubman Hall, Eleanor Roosevelt, H Quad, Kelly Quad, Mendelsohn Quad, Roth Quad, and Tabler Quad.
Graduate and Family Living: Graduate students and students with families can live in on-campus apartment-style housing. Options include Schomburg Apartments, Chapin Apartments, and West Apartments.

It was founded in 1820 and has been serving students with high-quality education for over 200 years. The university offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and professional programs in various fields of study.

IU has a diverse student community with over 40,000 students from all 50 states and more than 130 countries. The faculty at IU is highly accomplished and dedicated to providing students with an enriching learning experience. The university also has strong ties with leading industries and organizations, providing students with various opportunities for internships and placements.

One of the top universities in the US, IU has a beautiful campus spread across 1,940 acres with state-of-the-art facilities including modern classrooms, research labs, libraries, and recreational facilities. The university also operates several residence halls and communal living spaces to provide on-campus housing for students.

The residence centres at IU Bloomington are divided into three neighbourhoods, each with its unique set of programs, dining options, amenities, services, and academic resources. Assignments are made without any discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or national origin.

For students who prefer off-campus accommodation, there are various options available with an average monthly rent of $550 to $750. These include studio flats, 3-bedroom apartments, 4-bedroom apartments, and shared apartments that are strategically located near major universities and utilities. The rent includes all basic services like power, water, gas, and unlimited internet access.

It is situated in Bloomington, USA and has a diverse student population of approximately 6028 international students. The university offers a variety of undergraduate, graduate and doctoral programs in fields such as Business, Humanities, Engineering and more. There are three intakes for admission - September, January and August. Bachelor's degree programs typically span over a period of four years, while master's degree programs are completed in a duration of one year. The average annual tuition fee at Indiana University is approximately $40,000. However, the university provides numerous scholarships and grants to support students financially. Some of the notable scholarships offered by Indiana University are USC Associates Scholarships for undergraduate business programs, Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship, You Are Welcome Here Scholarship for Bachelor's in Kinesiology at Michigan State University, and Graduate Incentive Award for Master's in Applied Economics. The university's campus is vast and boasts modern buildings, well-equipped research libraries, advanced laboratories, activity centers, clubs, accommodation facilities and much more for its students and faculty. An added advantage of studying at Indiana University is the promising post-study work opportunities in the US. The university's career development programs prepare students to excel in their respective fields and positively contribute to society. Before applying for admission, international students must meet the predetermined requirements such as English proficiency demonstrated through IELTS or TOEFL scores, and standardized test scores of exams like GRE, SAT or GMAT. Along with these, they are also required to submit recommendation letters, work experience certificates, statement of purpose, academic transcripts, and necessary identification documents like passport and visa.

Name: Old Dominion University
Overview:
Located in Norfolk, Virginia, Old Dominion University (ODU) is a well-respected public university. Established in 1930 as a branch of the College of William and Mary, ODU was given its name by King Charles II of England, who nicknamed Virginia "Old Dominion" in recognition of its loyalty during the English Civil War. The university is committed to upholding tradition while also promoting innovation, preparing students to become empathetic and critically aware leaders who can make a difference in the global community.

ODU is organized into eight colleges and one graduate school: the College of Arts and Letters, Strome College of Business, Darden College of Education and Professional Studies, Batten College of Engineering and Technology, College of Health Sciences, College of Sciences, Perry Honors College, School of Cybersecurity, and The Graduate School. These colleges offer a diverse range of academic programs, including over 90 undergraduate, 43 postgraduate, and 50 doctoral programs. The university has an acceptance rate of 89%.

With a vibrant campus life across four campuses, ODU welcomes students from all over the world. The university offers a wide range of courses, including Gender and Cultural Studies, Modeling and Simulation, and Social and Behavioral Sciences. The average annual cost, including on-campus living expenses, is around $40,000, but ODU also provides various grants and scholarships to help reduce this cost to $29,000.

Spread over 251 acres, the main campus of ODU is a beautiful and well-equipped space. It boasts residence halls, recreational areas, libraries, athletic centers, laboratories, and conference halls. ODU has a strong alumni network, with several notable alumni, and ensures a promising job placement rate for students, helping them achieve personal and professional success.
Eligibility Overview: Specific Instructions for Providing Required Credentials at Old Dominion UniversityThe Admissions Office at Old Dominion University reviews all foreign academic credentials to assist applicants. All documents submitted as part of the application process will be considered the property of Old Dominion University and cannot be returned.Transcripts, translations, and standardized test scores must be sent directly to the Office of International Admissions at Old Dominion University, in sealed and stamped envelopes from the university or testing organization. Testing authorities include the Registrar and the Controller of Examinations.Academic transcripts and course descriptions must be submitted in both English and the native language of the applicant if English is not the language of instruction. Translations of academic documents must be official and certified by a licensed or professional translator. Personal translations will not be accepted.To ensure a smooth application process, please follow the above guidelines when submitting your required credentials. For further information, please visit the Old Dominion University's admissions website at the following link: https://www.odu.edu/admission/international#tab165852398370=2&done1612907281342

Name: Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences (MCPHS University)
Overview: MCPHS University, situated in Boston, Massachusetts in the Longwood Medical and Academic Area, is an accredited private institute by the New England Commission of Higher Education. MCPHS offers specialized education programs, both accelerated and traditional, in the field of health sciences and pharmacy. The institute provides various undergraduate and advanced programs in the healthcare industry with campus locations in Worcester, Manchester, and Boston. As an added advantage, MCPHS offers their Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm.D) program through a direct-entry system on their Boston campus, allowing students to gain relevant clinical experience through laboratory work. The courses offered at MCPHS are part-time, allowing students to pursue full-time employment while earning their certificates or degrees. MCPHS creates opportunities for its students to get involved in research work, internships, and clinical placements with some of the leading healthcare organizations. Upon successful completion of their full-time degrees, students can win a 100% tuition scholarship for one of the institute’s six part-time, online master's programs including Master of Public Health, Master of Science in Regulatory Affairs and Health Policy, Master of Health Sciences, MBA in Healthcare Management, Master of Science in Clinical Management, and Master of Science in Clinical Research. The Wall Street Journal/Times Higher Education College Rankings for 2018 recognizes MCPHS as the top-ranking institute for earning potential upon graduation. The institute caters to around 7,100 enrolled students across its three campuses and employs a faculty of 826 members, out of which 292 are full-time. MCPHS employs highly qualified educators, with 90% of its faculty having terminal degrees. The student-faculty ratio at the institute is 13:1. Notable alumni of Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences include renowned entrepreneur Ronald A. Matricarian, currently serving as the Chairman at Systems Oncology LLC, and American politician Robert Goforth from the state of Kentucky.
Eligibility Overview:
The following documents must be submitted along with the completed application for all first-year applicants to be considered for admission: 
- Official high school transcript 
- Official score reports for SAT, ACT, TOEFL, IELTS, and EPE (English Proficiency Exam - MCPHS on-campus test) 
- One letter of recommendation 
- Proof of English proficiency

For convenience, our university offers on-campus housing for all first-year students. This includes residential options and lodging facilities. To learn more about on-campus housing, please refer to the official website at http://www.mcphs.edu/Campuses/Boston/Housing.

For those who prefer to live off-campus, there are a variety of housing choices available. Rent for off-campus housing typically ranges from $1050 to $1150 per month. Some apartments also provide towels, bed linen, and a monthly cleaning service at no extra cost.
