Course Description:
Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences (MCPHS University) is a highly reputable higher education institution with a long history dating back to 1823. Located in the bustling city of Boston, USA, the university has a diverse student body of approximately 1000 international students. It is renowned globally for its exceptional academic programs and groundbreaking research endeavors. MCPHS University has been ranked 1569th in the list of top universities by US News. The university offers a wide array of undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees in various fields, including Business, Humanities, Engineering, and more. With four intakes per year, students can enroll in the Fall (September) or Spring (January) semester.

The bachelor's degree programs at MCPHS University take around 3 years to complete, while the master's degree programs take 2 years. The university's average annual tuition fee is approximately $56,970 USD. However, for students seeking financial aid, there are several scholarships and grants available. Some notable scholarships at MCPHS University include the USC Associates Scholarships for undergraduate business programs, the Horace W. Goldsmith Fellowship, and the You Are Welcome Here Scholarship for students pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Kinesiology at Michigan State University.

MCPHS University boasts of a sprawling campus, complete with modern buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, well-equipped laboratories, and various centers and clubs for students. International students are drawn to the university not just for its academic excellence, but also for the post-study opportunities available in the United States. The university provides students with the necessary tools and guidance to excel in their chosen fields and make a positive impact on society.

To gain admission to MCPHS University, students must meet certain requirements, including providing proof of English language proficiency through IELTS or TOEFL scores, as well as standardized test scores such as GRE, SAT, or GMAT. Additionally, they must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, and official transcripts from their previous educational institutions. Valid passports and visas are also required for international students.

Name: Clark University
Overview: The Clark University located in Worcester, Massachusetts, is a private research university that was founded in 1887. Serving as one of the earliest modern research institutions in the country, it has established itself as an eminent presence, providing high-quality education with a focus on shaping the future of the world. The university strives to instil contemporary values such as innovation and critical thinking in its students, aiming to equip them as inspiring leaders. Its academic structure is divided into various schools, such as Clark College, Adam Institute for Urban Teaching and School Practice, Strassler Centre for Holocaust and Genocide Studies, Frances L. Hiatt School of Psychology, Graduate School of Management, and Graduate School of Geography, among others. With an acceptance rate of 53%, it is a sought-after choice among students. The university offers a wide array of courses, including over 30 undergraduate majors, 19 postgraduate programs, 12 interdisciplinary concentrations, and 8 doctorate degrees. Its physics, liberal arts, geography, psychology, biology, and entrepreneurship programs are highly ranked and popular among students. The university provides a rich academic and cultural atmosphere for thousands of students to immerse themselves in. The average yearly cost for tuition and accommodation is approximately $58K, but the university offers an array of scholarships and grants that can bring the cost down to $28K. Situated on a beautiful 50-acre campus, the university boasts 7 libraries, athletic centers, seminar halls, recreational facilities, and residence halls. Its prestigious alumni network includes eminent personalities such as Pulitzer recipients and Emmy winners, who have excelled in various industries, ensuring a promising job market for graduating students.

Name: New York Tech - Long Island (NYT)
Overview:
The New York Tech Long Island campus is a renowned private research university with a remarkable history tracing back to the year 1955. It has multiple campuses located in different cities and countries, including New York, Long Island, Jonesboro, China, and Vancouver. The Long Island campus, which is only an hour away from New York City, is well-known for its safe and secure environment.

The Long Island campus offers a diverse range of academic programs such as Adolescent Education (Master of Arts in Teaching), B.S. in Applied and Computational Mathematics, B.S.A.T. in Architectural Technology, etc. It boasts modern facilities like a fitness center, WIFI-enabled lounges and parklets, an on-campus café, library, bookstore, etc. Students can also avail of academic support services such as tutoring, Supplemental Instruction sessions, First-year Guide Program, etc. Financial assistance is also provided to eligible students through various scholarships and awards, including the New York State Scholarships and New York State Awards.

The Long Island campus has a dedicated healthcare center, named Riland Health Care Center, that offers healthcare services to students. In 2020, the New York Institute of Technology acceptance rate was around 75%, according to the U.S. News & World Report. In the United States, according to the Times Higher Education (2022), the New York Institute of Technology is ranked 253rd.

The institute has earned recognition for providing quality education and has been designated as one of the country's 'Colleges of Distinction' for the academic year 2021-22. It also ranks 6th for having the largest number of international students in the U.S. News & World Report 2022 and 4th for promoting ethnic diversity on campus. In addition, the New York Institute of Technology offers online programs in various fields, including M.S. in Clinical Nutrition and Energy Management.

According to statistics, 94% of graduates from this university have successfully secured jobs within a year of graduation. Apart from academic excellence, the Long Island campus also offers over 60 student clubs and organizations, which regularly hold various events throughout the academic year. This provides students with a well-rounded university experience.

Name: Musicians Institute

Grand Valley State University was established in 1960 as a public educational institution with a student population of 21,112 undergraduate students. Located just outside of Grand Rapids, Michigan's second-largest metropolitan area, the university is ranked 28th in the Regional Universities Midwest category according to US News and World Report 2021 rankings. Seidman College of Business, College of Community and Public Services, College of Education, College of Liberal Arts and Sciences, Seymour and Esther Padnos College of Engineering and Computing, College of Health Professions, Kirkhof College of Nursing, and Brooks College of Interdisciplinary Studies.

The total cost of attendance, including tuition fees, room and board, books and supplies, transportation, and personal expenses, is 24,460 USD for in-state students and 29,896 USD for out-state students. The university offers both need-based and merit-based scholarships and financial aid to help students cover their educational expenses. Name: University of Dallas
Overview:
The University of Dallas, established in 1965, is among the leading private Catholic universities in Texas. With an emphasis on interactive learning, it has gained global recognition for its undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs in Business, Liberal Arts, and Ministry. Furthermore, the University of Dallas holds the title of the youngest university to be bestowed with the prestigious Phi Beta Kappa chapter. Its academic offerings comprise of 50 undergraduate courses, 26 graduate programs, doctoral degrees, and continuing education options in varying fields such as business, arts, science, humanities, nursing, and education. Some of the renowned programs at the University of Dallas are B.A. in Biology, Economics, English Language Social Sciences, Psychology, M.S. Cyber intelligence, Business Analytics, M.A. in Theology, and MBA. 
Sprawled across 215 acres, the University of Dallas boasts exceptional campus facilities, which include the acclaimed Church of the Incarnation, the Cowan-Blakley Memorial Library, and the J.M. Haggar University Center. Moreover, students have access to over 50 clubs, 80 organizations, and an array of events ranging from arts, music, and cultural to athletics, social service, learning, and spirituality. 
Hostel facilities are available only for undergraduate students below the age of 21 or those with fewer than 90 credit hours. Unfortunately, no accommodation is provided for students above the age of 25. The traditional halls, equipped with lounges, shared bathrooms, showers, and laundry rooms, can house between 31 to 96 students. The annual expenses for hostel and meals amount to approximately USD 16,137. 
Tuition fees vary from USD 24,709 to 44,477 per year, depending on the course or program chosen. Furthermore, students have access to employment opportunities through Handshake, an online database with over 250,000 job postings. The University of Dallas has retained its focus on traditional teaching methods and ideologies for over 50 years, delivering a transformative experience to its students.

To receive undergraduate admission, applicants must have completed Grade 12 and possess a certificate of completion. Depending on their major, students may need to meet specific SAT and ACT score requirements. However, for the academic year 2021-2022, the university has waived the exam requirement. 
Any student seeking entrance to graduate programs must hold a bachelor's degree in any discipline (US equivalent). International applicants are required to have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0 from a regionally accredited institution or university (or US equivalent). Additionally, a minimum GPA of 3.0 is necessary for any graduate-level program, and all previous institutions attended must have good academic standing. Non-English speaking international applicants must provide proof of English proficiency.

Name: Mercy College
Overview:
Mercy College, situated in Dobbs Ferry, New York, was founded in the early 1950s by the Sisters of Mercy. It is a top private co-educational institution offering over 90 diverse undergraduate and postgraduate programs, including online courses across five reputable faculties. Business, Management, Marketing, Psychology, Health Professions, Social Sciences, Homeland Security, Law Enforcement, and Firefighting are some of the highly sought-after majors at Mercy College. The college comprises five schools, namely, the School of Liberal Arts, School of Business, School of Health & Natural Sciences, School of Social & Behavioral Sciences, and School of Education.

The average cost of pursuing an undergraduate degree at Mercy College is approximately $20,378 per year, without considering any additional expenses. However, the college provides generous financial aid to students, with an average scholarship amount of $10,698. As an added benefit, international students can work while studying to support their finances. The college offers a variety of work opportunities, including On-Campus Employment, Economic Hardship, Curriculum Practical Training (CPT), and Optional Practical Training (OPT).

Mercy College is known for its nationally recognized program, Personalized Achievement Contract. This program offers personalized mentorship and support to students throughout their academic journey and assists in achieving a smooth transition towards their desired career paths.
Eligibility Overview:
The following criteria must be met in order to be considered for admission into our university: 
- High school graduates must have a GPA of at least 2.0 or GED recipients must have a score of at least 500 (53 if taken prior to 2002). 
- Directly from high school students aged 24 and under are required to take the ACT or SAT and must achieve an ACT composite score of 21 or SAT combined score of 990 to be deemed "program ready". 
- Students aged 25 and over who have not attended college are not required to submit ACT or SAT scores, but must fulfill other prerequisites for admission. 
- Those who do not have an ACT or SAT score may be accepted into a pre-program or certificate program that does not require scores. 
- Students with low math scores on the ACT or SAT may take a math placement assessment to determine their course placement. 
- Applicants who do not meet the minimal criteria for admission into certain majors are encouraged to start as a pre-major and complete the necessary requirements.

Placement: When deciding on career goals and specializations, one of the most critical decisions a medical student will ever make is selecting a specialty. The Office of Career Advising at the Suny Downstate College of Medicine is dedicated to helping students explore medical career options throughout their academic journey, establish mentorship relationships with faculty members, pursue dual degrees, and navigate the residency application process successfully. All students in the College of Medicine have access to the centrally located Office of Career Advising. The office has developed a comprehensive four-year plan to guide students through every stage of their career development, including peer mentorship workshops, specialty-specific educational sessions, and class presentations. Additionally, the office assigns early career advisors, clinical advisory deans, and departmental specialty advisors to support students during the Foundation and clinical years. They provide guidance with the Electronic Residency Application Service (ERAS), review personal statements, and facilitate mock residency interviews to help students succeed in the highly competitive residency application process.

Name: Clarkson University
Overview:
Clarkson University located in Potsdam, New York, is a distinguished private national research university that was established in 1898. The university has a main campus spread over 540 acres in Potsdam, and offers a variety of undergraduate, masters, and Ph.D. programs. The university comprises of eight prestigious institutes and schools, including the School of Arts and Sciences, Reh School of Business, Lewis School of Health Sciences, Coulter School of Engineering, Beacon Institute for Rivers and Estuaries, and Institute for a Sustainable Environment. At Clarkson, students can earn degrees such as bachelor of science, master of business administration, master of engineering, master of science, bachelor of professional studies, master of arts in teaching, doctor of philosophy, and doctor of physical therapy. Furthermore, the university offers popular graduate programs in basic science, bioethics, computer science, and data analysis. The university is also known for its groundbreaking research and has a center for advanced research programs. The tuition fee for students at Clarkson is competitively priced at approximately USD 53,100 per annum. In addition to academics, the university also focuses on providing a well-rounded experience for students with a variety of sports teams, including baseball, basketball, skiing, hockey, and swimming. 

The distinguished faculty at Clarkson University are globally renowned for their interdisciplinary research that aims to solve real-world problems and bring about positive change for the future. The university also offers on-campus residence for students with nine halls providing four-year accommodation options. The residence halls are equipped with necessary amenities such as comfortable beds, study desks, televisions, and parking facilities. The cost of living on campus is estimated at around USD 17,614 per annum. Furthermore, Clarkson University boasts a thriving student life with over 200 clubs, professional societies, and 182 intramural teams, along with options for greek life, leadership programs, and student government. 

International students can also benefit from various forms of financial aid such as awards and scholarships, with amounts ranging from USD 5,000 to 30,000. With highly successful placement rates, Clarkson University has been consistently ranked as one of the top universities with the highest-paid graduates.

Below is some information about a university's admission requirements. Please note that these instructions must be followed very specifically.

- Applicants must have a high school diploma or its equivalent, and must also meet the foreign country equivalents.

- Some graduate programs may require GRE/GMAT scores, but this requirement can be waived for those with sufficient work experience.
- International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English through standardized tests, unless they come from an English-speaking country or have attended an English-medium institution for at least two years.

Accommodation:
Hood College offers top-notch housing facilities to 840 students through diverse on-campus communities. There are six residence halls available, each providing a unique living experience. These include Memorial Hall, Smith Hall, Coblentz Hall, Meyran Hall, Shriner Hall, and the New Residence Hall. It is important for students to note that seniors and select juniors may have a chance to secure a single room, depending on availability. However, first-year and sophomore students will require roommates. Exceptions can be made for older students and those with approved housing accommodations.

Students have access to four computers in each hall, including three PCs and one Mac. Additionally, wireless internet is available in all rooms. Snack and beverage vending machines are also conveniently located in every residence hall. A large flat-screen HDTV with cable is available for group viewing in the common lounge area. Laundry facilities are available on-site at no extra cost to students.

As part of our commitment to inclusivity, Hood College offers support to disabled students through the Office of Accessibility Services. Students diagnosed with a disability can request accommodations and services to aid them in their college experience. Please note that requests for non-disability housing are not handled by this office. For more information on disability accommodation services, please visit our website.

Accommodation:
Rephrased: Our university offers various housing options to accommodate students with different needs and preferences. We have prioritized accessibility and inclusivity for students with disabilities, providing them with personalized accommodation services through our Accessibility and Disability Services office.

On-campus accommodation includes apartments, suites, and traditional residence halls. Our apartment-style living is available in two communities – Leonardtown and South Hill – with a fully equipped kitchen, living/dining area, bathroom, and four bedrooms for up to six students. Our suites, located in the South Hill community, offer similar amenities but without a kitchen, and are suitable for groups of 4-8 students.

For graduate students, limited housing is available in our residence halls, with priority given to undergraduate students. Unfortunately, we do not have facilities for postgraduate students or families/spouses. Any acts of discrimination or harassment will not be tolerated, as we value the dignity and membership of every individual in our multicultural community.

Name: INTERLINK at Seattle Pacific University
Overview:
Seattle Pacific University (SPU) is a renowned small private university located in Seattle, Washington State, USA. It is located just a few minutes north of downtown Seattle and is nestled in a safe and secure residential area. Seattle, known to be the most educated city in the USA in 2006, is home to several prestigious organizations such as Boeing, Amazon, Microsoft, and Starbucks. The city is also famous for its vibrant shopping districts, thriving high-tech industries, eclectic coffee shops, and buzzing music scene. With an excellent public transportation system in place, students have no trouble navigating around Seattle. 

INTERLINK, situated on the university campus, offers a rigorous curriculum to its students. Its all-encompassing program includes class assignments and out-of-class activities such as library research, community involvement, interviews, group discussions, presentations, and writing projects. With a focus on non-native English speakers willing to pursue higher education in the USA, INTERLINK provides intensive English language training, academic preparedness, and cultural orientation. 

INTERLINK's state-of-the-art programs, offered both in-person and online, boast small class sizes of 8 to 12 students per class. The programs are conducted in 5-week sessions, with 10 to 20 hours of instruction per week. Accredited by the Commission on English Language Program Accreditation (CEA), INTERLINK is among the first 13 programs in the world to receive this recognition. 

Upon successful completion of the program, students are exempt from taking the IELTS or TOEFL exams for university admission. INTERLINK also meets the standards set by the Association of Teachers of English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL), English USA (Formerly American Association of Intensive English Programs (AAIEP)), and NAFSA: Association of International Education for intensive English language programs. 

At INTERLINK, students can avail numerous scholarships, catering to various groups. Scholarships are available for students who are either affiliated with the university's alumni or have received academic scholarships from its partner universities.
Eligibility Overview:
The following is the requisite English proficiency test score required for general admission to Seattle Pacific University for undergraduate studies: 
- 79 on TOEFL (internet-based)
- 550 on TOEFL (paper-based)
- Overall band score of 6.5 on IELTS
- Academic PTE score of 56 
- Pre-level 1 EIKEN
- 105 points on Duolingo 
- Completion of Level 6 with full recommendation from Interlink Language Center 

First-year applicants are required to submit official transcripts from all high schools or secondary schools attended for grades 9, 10, 11, and 12 (or equivalent). This includes grade 9, even if it was part of a middle school or junior high school education. Additionally, a final exam certificate or diploma reflecting all coursework and grades must be provided if secondary school examinations have been completed (e.g. A levels, HKCEE, WAEC, SMA, etc.).

Name: Valencia College - West Campus
Overview: Valencia College stands out as a top-notch establishment within Florida's college system, serving students from Orange and Osceola counties in Central Florida. The institute also offers various scholarships, including the Valencia Honors Scholarship, Valencia Advantage Scholarship, Valencia Foundation Scholarships, and more. Name: Johnson and Wales University
Overview:
Johnson and Wales University, located in Rhode Island, is a private university with a student enrollment of more than 13000 across its various campuses. The university offers graduate, undergraduate, and Ph.D. degrees. It was established in 1914 by Mary T. Wales and Gertrude I. Johnson. The university offers scholarships and financial aid to more than 95% of its students. There are over 15 scholarship programs available for undergraduate students, which are based on SAT scores, rank, and academic performance. The university has a diverse range of study programs, including Communication, Accounting, Business Management, Biology, and Criminal Justice. It is accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education. The cost of tuition fees can go up to 37,736 USD per year at Johnson and Wales University. 
Situated in an urban area, the campus spreads over 126 acres and includes academic and residential buildings. The university has more than 100 student clubs for extracurricular activities. Another significant feature of the university is the LEED-certified culinary lab, the first of its kind in the US. The campus provides modern facilities and amenities for a comfortable learning experience. About 50% of the university's population resides in on-campus accommodations, which are well-equipped with all necessary amenities and refreshment centers. 
Johnson and Wales University has a strong focus on Culinary Arts, Hospitality Management, Food Safety, Global Tourism, and Marketing Management programs, attracting students from all over the world. The total cost of attendance, including tuition, hostel fees, and other expenses, can amount up to 56,000 USD per year. The university also offers internship opportunities at prestigious companies like Disney, Compass Group, Hilton, Google, and Hyatt to its students upon graduation.

English Proficiency

I-20 Processing
Submission of the reservation deposit through the application portal. 
A copy of the biographical section of the applicant's current passport.
Proof of financial support for one academic year, in the form of a certified bank statement or a government sponsorship letter. Bank statements must not be more than three months old. Both the applicant and sponsor must sign a financial declaration. 
In the case of existing F-1 visa students, a transfer verification form is mandatory. This will be provided to students as required. 
For evaluation, all I-20 paperwork must be uploaded to the applicant's portal. 
All documents and information must be clear and legible. Failure to provide necessary information may delay the admissions process.

Name: Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) - Melbourne (CBD)
Overview:
The Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) focuses on elevating the careers of healthcare professionals through comprehensive training and education. With four modern campuses situated in the cosmopolitan cities of Melbourne, Sydney, Perth, and Cochin (India), IHNA prides itself on a faculty of 250+ highly qualified medical professionals. Since its establishment in 2007, IHNA has trained over 14,000 students, gaining international acclaim for its accredited programs.

IHNA's Melbourne (CBD) campus, conveniently located in the heart of the Central Business District, offers easy access to Australia's second-largest city and its many attractions. Melbourne Airport is a short 25-minute drive from the campus, allowing students to explore popular destinations such as the Great Ocean Road, Yarra Valley, Melbourne Zoo, and Crown Casino.

The institute consists of five specialized schools - Management, Community Services, Education, Allied Health, and Nursing, each equipped with state-of-the-art facilities and laboratories for practical, hands-on learning. This approach ensures that students receive career-focused training, preparing them for the ever-evolving healthcare industry.

In addition to providing high-quality education, IHNA is also committed to supporting its students by addressing their financial needs. As part of this mission, IHNA has launched the 50 over 50 initiative, allowing students to pursue their desired course at 50% of the tuition fee. This further solidifies IHNA's commitment to shaping the future of healthcare through education excellence.

The institute's dedication to its students and the healthcare industry has not gone unnoticed, with accolades such as being named a finalist in the Victorian Training Award 2016 and winning the McMillan Woods Global Award 2018 for "Nursing & Healthcare Training Excellence." IHNA was also recognized with the Victorian International Education Award in 2016.

In summary, IHNA stands out as a reputable and internationally recognized institute, providing students with competitive education and training in various areas of healthcare. With its advanced facilities, experienced faculty, and commitment to student support, IHNA continues to set new standards in the education sector.

Name: Yale University
Overview: Yale University, established in 1701, is the third oldest higher education institution in the United States. It was initially known as a collegiate school in Saybrook, Connecticut before being relocated to New Haven, Connecticut in 1716 where it was officially renamed as Yale College in 1718. As the first university in the country to award a Doctor of Philosophy in 1861, Yale is highly regarded and forms a part of the prestigious Ivy League which includes eight other leading universities in the country. With a diverse student body of over 5,200 undergraduates, of which 10% are international students, Yale offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and professional programs covering various fields of study. These include 50 bachelor's degree and certificate programs as well as online courses, non-degree programs, and opportunities for study abroad and university exchange programs for deserving candidates. This prestigious university boasts some notable alumni such as Indra Nooyi, Hillary Clinton, George H.W. Bush, and Alexei Navalny. The university's career placement services are known to attract prominent industries such as consulting, investment banking, private equity, venture capital, government, e-commerce, and media/entertainment, among others. One of Yale's most significant features is its commitment to meeting 100% of students' demonstrated financial need through extensive financial aid awards, without any loans. As per statistics published on the university's website, all students in the first-year class of 2023 from families with an annual income of less than $65,000 qualified for financial assistance.
Eligibility Overview: At Yale University, applicants must obtain test scores within the range of 25th to 75th percentiles in the following exams: SAT Reading & Writing Test (720 - 780) and SAT Mathematics Test (740 - 800), as well as the ACT Composite (33-35). While there are no set score cut-offs, the university values academic performance more than standardized testing. A solid performance in a rigorous college preparatory program can offset low standardized test scores, but excellent test scores alone may not compensate for a mediocre high school record. In addition, non-native English speakers who have not completed at least two years of secondary education in an English-language curriculum must take an English proficiency test. Yale accepts TOEFL scores of 100 or higher on the internet-based test, with at least 25 on each of the three sections of the paper-and-pencil TOEFL Paper-delivered Test. Alternatively, applicants can submit IELTS scores of 7 or higher, or PTE scores of 70 or higher, or DET scores of at least 120.
Placement: Yale University conducts placement examinations to ensure that students are placed in courses that best suit their academic and career goals. Of the total graduates, around 75% secure full-time, part-time, or temporary positions with an average starting salary of $76,359. The university also offers internship opportunities and hosts placement and career fairs to assist students in exploring potential career options. The MBA, English, management, history, economics, and law programs have a high success rate in securing placements. Renowned organizations actively seek employees from Yale University for various roles, and the university has a track record of placing students in prestigious companies. Name: Sterling College
Overview: Founded in 2001, Sterling College is an esteemed private college located in the bustling city of Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. With humble beginnings as Stewart College, this institution initially focused on providing ESL training to both international and domestic students looking to enhance their English skills. In 2016, the college underwent a remarkable transformation and became a part of Canadian Tourism College, expanding its offerings with a plethora of diverse courses across various departments. From Writing and Editing to Sports Management, Theatre Arts, Mathematics, Psychology, Music, and more, Sterling College aims to equip its students with a well-rounded education to prepare them for the world beyond academia. In fact, the college also offers two master's programs - M.S. in Athletic Training and M.A. in Sports Ministry, catering to students with different interests and career aspirations. The average cost of tuition per year at Sterling College is CAD 17,785, with an additional expense of CAD 12,960 for living costs. In 2021, the tuition for M.S. in Athletic Training is $495 per credit hour, while for M.A. in Sports Ministry, it is $400 per credit hour. As an institution that values its students, Sterling College provides various financial aid options, including scholarships, grants, employment opportunities, and loans. In fact, 100% of full-time on-campus students receive a Sterling College Scholarship, awarded based on their academic record, potential, and talent in fields like Academics, Arts, and Athletics. Additionally, students can also avail of other scholarship options, including Knight Family Scholarship, Park Presbyterian Grant, and more. Being a part of the Council for Christian Colleges and Universities, Sterling College provides its students with ample opportunities to travel to various parts of the world, such as Russia, Oxford, Latin America, and Australia. Moreover, the college is a wireless campus, ensuring internet access for students across all areas of the campus.

Name: Western Michigan University
Overview: Located in Kalamazoo, Michigan, Western Michigan University (WMU) is a leading public research university that was founded in 1903. The university boasts of five magnificent campuses, all strategically located in and around Kalamazoo. Committed to promoting the pursuit of knowledge, WMU strives to produce highly skilled and visionary graduates who can make a positive impact globally. The university is divided into nine schools - the Neon Colleges of Arts and Sciences, College of Aviation, Haworth College of Business, College of Education and Human Development, College of Engineering and Applied Sciences, College of Fine Arts, College of Health and Human Services, Lee Honors College, Graduate College, Thomas M. Cooley Law School, and the Homer Stryker M.D. School of Medicine. Featuring a favorable student to teacher ratio of 16:1, WMU boasts of excellent facilities in several departments. It offers more than 150 undergraduate, 73 postgraduate, and 30 doctorate programs. Some of WMU's top-ranked and popular courses include Aviation, Theatre, Art History, Cybersecurity, English, and Music. With an acceptance rate of 80%, WMU has become a widely accessible and sought-after institution. The average annual tuition and accommodation fee is approximately $32,000, but the university provides financial assistance in the form of scholarships and grants, which can bring the cost down to $23,000. Spanning across 1,200 acres, WMU's five campuses offer a dynamic and inclusive campus life, welcoming students from diverse backgrounds. The university is well-equipped with all essential resources to facilitate academic and cultural growth, such as libraries, residence halls, cultural halls, and athletic centers. WMU has an impressive alumni network, and the university guarantees a 93% placement rate for its graduating class.
Eligibility Overview:
Transcript is the most critical information required for evaluation. It provides a comprehensive record of your educational journey, featuring the courses you have taken and the corresponding grades obtained. This assists us in assessing your readiness for college-level studies. Our recommended guidelines are as follows*:- Four years of English courses- Three to four years of Math courses (including second-year algebra or pre-calculus)- Three years of Natural Science courses (with a minimum of two lab components)- At least two years of the same Foreign Language study 

GPA refers to Grade Point Average. 

Grading pattern refers to the grades achieved in your recent courses. 

Students whose high schools do not provide official transcripts for admission consideration may submit unofficial transcripts for review. However, to receive financial aid, official final high school transcripts must be submitted (as per federal regulations). Failure to do so may result in a registration hold on your account for the upcoming spring semester. 

WMU superscores both ACT and SAT scores, meaning we consider the highest scores achieved on each section across multiple test sittings. The testing information provided in your application will be taken into consideration during the decision-making process. In 2020, Western Michigan University announced a test-optional policy for both admission and scholarship consideration by the Office of Admissions. 

This implies that students are not required to report/submit their ACT or SAT test scores, and it will not affect their admission chances. However, if you wish for your scores to be incorporated in the admissions process, you may self-report them in your application. Please adhere to our testing guidelines accordingly.

Course Description:
Western Michigan University, established in 1903, is a renowned institution for higher education with a global presence. It is located in Kalamazoo, USA and has a diverse community of about 1700 international students. The university is highly regarded for its top-quality education and research achievements.

In Webometrics' Top Universities ranking, Western Michigan University is placed at 712th position. With various courses in Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others, the university offers bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees. Its program options include 6 undergraduate and 2 postgraduate programs, and there are 4 intakes in September, October, February, and August. Bachelor's degree courses typically last for 4 years, while master's degree courses are of 1 year duration.

The average cost of tuition per year at Western Michigan University ranges from $13,017 to $14,054. To assist students with financial aid, the university provides many scholarships and grants. Some prominent scholarships offered by Western Michigan University include USC Associates Scholarships for undergraduate Business programs, Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship, You Are Welcome Here Scholarship for undergraduate Kinesiology at Michigan State University, and Graduate Incentive Award for MS in Applied Economics.

The university boasts an extensive campus, comprising modern buildings, cutting-edge research facilities, libraries, laboratories, centers, clubs, hostels, and other amenities for students and faculty. In addition, the post-graduation work opportunities in the USA are a major factor that entices international students towards Western Michigan University. The university strives to guide and mentor students towards success in their careers and making a positive impact on society.

For admission to Western Michigan University, prospective students must meet certain requirements, such as achieving a minimum score in IELTS or TOEFL for English proficiency and getting standardised test scores of exams like GRE, SAT, GMAT, etc. In addition, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school/college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Southeast Missouri State University
Overview:
The Missouri State University was established in Cape Girardeau, Missouri, USA, in 1873 as a public institution. The main focus of the university is to provide high-quality education while incorporating modern technology, innovative teaching methods, and other advancements. Comprising of over 200 programs, including more than 75 graduate programs, 145 undergraduate majors, and 100 minors, Missouri State offers a diverse range of studies to its students. A key point to note is that the university has a strong collaboration with industry leaders, which helps it to prevent any potential cyberattacks. Additionally, the university partners with Apple to offer cutting-edge K-12 education. Missouri State University is well-known for its renowned courses such as business, biology, liberal arts, and humanities. The university also houses the River Campus, which primarily focuses on performing arts, including dance, music, visual arts, and theatre.

Nested in an urban area, the university spans over 400 acres. With approximately 12,000 students, Missouri State is a medium-sized institution providing both academic and extracurricular opportunities. Notably, most majors offer students hands-on learning experiences and internships to ensure practical knowledge. Further, students can opt for studying abroad for a period of two weeks to one year in any other country. The university boasts an impressive alumni list, consisting of Steven Tilley, Joe Tuineau, Peter Kinder, Linda Godwin, a NASA astronaut, Neal E. Boyd, the 2008 America's Got Talent winner, and Antonius Cleveland. Missouri State University is also a proud participant in the NCAA Division I, competing in sports like cross-country, football, basketball, and baseball for men, and soccer, tennis, basketball, cross-country, gymnastics, softball, track (indoor/outdoor), and volleyball for women.

Placement: The university has a dedicated Career Development Center that aids students in finding career and internship opportunities. The center uses REDHAWKjobs, an online recruitment system, to manage job and internship placements for both students and employers. It also provides resources for students to enhance their CV writing skills and prepares them for job interviews. The university conducts career fairs, both physically and virtually, to connect students with potential employers. Furthermore, the alumni network actively supports student recruitment and job placement. As a result, 93% of graduates secure employment within two years, with a median annual salary of 39,000 USD, which surpasses the national average of 34,000 USD.
Accommodation:
Southeast Missouri State University offers its students a variety of housing options, including both on-campus and off-campus options. The university requires full-time students to reside on campus for two academic years, but exemptions are available. Residence options include Towers East and Towers South, along with eight other residence halls. The university also offers ten dining halls for students to choose from. 

On-campus housing includes a variety of residence halls such as Towers East, Towers North, Towers West, Towers South, Vandiver, and LaFerla. Merick Hall offers a unique option with double occupancy suite-style rooms that share a bathroom and entryway, as well as common living spaces like a game room, laundry room, and fireplace room. Myers Hall offers four-person suites and a few triple rooms with attached bathrooms, as well as shared living spaces like a sitting room, kitchenette, and laundry facilities. All of the residence halls are pet-friendly and offer amenities like banking services, computer access, laundry facilities, vending machines, mail service, and cable TV. The university also provides a shuttle service for students. Students can access housing information and manage their housing preferences through the on-campus housing portal.

Off-campus options include fully furnished apartments with an average rent of $500-$700 per month. These apartments come in a variety of sizes, including studios, three-bedroom, four-bedroom, and communal apartments. Most units come equipped with standard appliances like stoves, refrigerators, dishwashers, and more. The apartments are conveniently located near bus stops and offer a wide range of shopping, dining, and entertainment options to suit every student's interests.

For more information on on-campus and off-campus housing options, please visit the university's housing portal or off-campus housing link.

Name: Pratt Institute
Overview: The Pratt Institute, established in 1887, is a prestigious private university situated in New York, offering programs in arts, culture, business, and design. Additionally, it holds accreditation from the Middle States Commission on Higher Education and is affiliated with the American Collegiate Athletic Association and the Hudson Valley Intercollegiate Athletic Conference. Some of the sought-after courses include AAS in Building and Construction, AOS in Illustration, BFA in Writing and Photography, BFA in Game Arts, and PLAB in Poetics Lab. It holds a notable position in the TIMES Higher Education University Ranking 2021, placed at #227. Its esteemed alumni network comprises 62,000 graduates spread across 83 countries. Excitingly, international students can access scholarships offered by the institute. Successful acceptance rate of 56% further strengthens its reputation. The total tuition fee extends up to CAD 46,000. Lush green campus facilities embrace the Library Rose Garden, Newman Mall, Canon Court, and the Engineering Quadrangle. The six residential houses provide students with student lounges and fitness centers, accommodating 1600 pupils.
Eligibility Overview: To apply for admission to the university, students must meet a variety of eligibility requirements. One of these is the submission of official proof of their performance on either the Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT 1) or the American College Testing Program (ACT). While the essay section of the SAT is optional, the ACT writing test can also be taken at the student's discretion. Students should note that taking either the SAT or ACT has no impact on their chances of being admitted. Furthermore, all international students and those whose first language is not English are required to demonstrate their English language proficiency through one of the following tests: TOEFL, TOEFL Home Edition, TOEFL ITP Plus, PTE, IELTS, IELTS Indicator, or Duolingo. If desired, students may choose to submit their SAT or ACT scores in place of one of these exams, with no minimum required score. For international students whose first language is English, they may take any of the aforementioned exams as well as the SAT or ACT. Official results should be sent directly from the testing company, and it is recommended that students review the international criteria prior to taking these exams.

Requirements for Undergraduate Applicants:
All students, including international freshmen and freshman transfers with less than 30 semester credit hours, are required to take the ACT or SAT. Applicants must also fulfill the following core curriculum requirements by the end of their high school education: 
- Four years of English courses 
- Three years of social sciences courses 
- Three years of math classes, with Algebra I and II, as well as Geometry, Trigonometry, Calculus, or Analysis included 
- Two years of Science courses, with Biology and Physical Sciences with a Laboratory Component 
PGA Bachelor's Degree:
Applicants must have a Bachelor's degree (or its equivalent) from an accredited college or university. 

GRE:
The GRE is optional for applicants to the Management, Finance, Master of Business Administration, and Master of Accountancy degrees. 

English Proficiency Requirements:
To demonstrate proficiency in English, applicants are required to obtain a certain score on one of the following tests: 
- TOEFL (internet-based): 79 
- TOEFL (computer-based): 213 
- TOEFL (paper-based): 550 
- PTE: 53 
- IELTS: 6.5 or higher.

Auburn University is a globally renowned institution known for its excellence in higher education. Established in 1856, the university is situated in Auburn, USA and boasts a diverse student body of 2955 international students. Auburn University prides itself on promoting inclusivity and diversity, making it an ideal choice for students from all over the world. Webometrics ranks Auburn University at 321st position in the list of top universities in the world. There are 8 intakes throughout the year for students to choose from - Fall (August), Spring (January), and Summer (May), to name a few. The bachelor's degree programs have a duration of 4 years, while the master's degrees are completed in 2 years.

Some of the prominent scholarships offered by Auburn University include the USC Associates Scholarships for undergraduate business programs, the Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship, the You Are Welcome Here Scholarship for students pursuing a bachelor's degree in Kinesiology at Michigan State University, and the Graduate Incentive Award for those studying MS Applied Economics.

The sprawling campus of Auburn University comprises top-notch buildings, modern research libraries, fully equipped laboratories, centers, clubs, and well-maintained hostels, among other facilities for the benefit of its students and faculty members. Another major draw for international students at Auburn University is the opportunity for post-study work in the USA. The university is dedicated to guiding its students towards a successful career and making a positive impact in society.

Auburn University has specific admission requirements, including minimum scores in exams such as IELTS and TOEFL, to assess English proficiency and standardised tests like GRE, SAT, GMAT, etc. Additionally, students are required to submit letters of recommendation, work experience certificates, personal statements, transcripts from previous schools/colleges, and valid passports and visas for admission.

Name: University of California, Davis
Overview:
The University of California, Davis, located in the city of Davis in the United States, is one of the most renowned educational institutions in the region. The university offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and certificate programs to students, including those enrolled in distance education programs. UC Davis provides programs in diverse disciplines such as engineering, agriculture, sciences, mathematics, anthropology, social sciences, media, design, computer science, arts, economics, languages, environment, pharmacy, philosophy, medicine, and psychology. Additionally, the university also offers online degree programs for students who prefer distance education.

UC Davis has a strong emphasis on international education and offers opportunities for its 1,300 students to participate in study abroad programs each year. The university has a remarkable track record of placing its students in highly reputed companies and organizations, making it a preferred choice for students seeking quality education and rewarding career prospects.

At the University of California, Davis, students can avail of various financial aids, including scholarships, work-study programs, and funding opportunities. The university also has a dedicated Career Planning Service team that assists students in building their resumes and finding suitable employment opportunities, be it after completing their degree or during their studies through part-time jobs, summer jobs, or internships. This holistic support system provided by UC Davis makes it an ideal choice for students looking for a successful and fulfilling academic journey.
Eligibility Overview:
Undergraduate Course Eligibility Guidelines: Candidates must meet the minimum requirements in academics for a bachelor's degree. The following criteria is based on different fields of study: 2 years of education in science and history, 4 years of education in English (or a language of instruction), 3 years of education in math (recommended to have 4 years), 2 years of education in a language other than English (recommended to have 3 years), and at least 1 year of education in Arts of Seeing and Acting. Students who have attended a preschool with options must have completed a full academic year. One must have a minimum GPA of 3.00 if they are a California resident, while non-California residents must have a minimum GPA of 3.40.

Qualifying Exams - SAT/ACT Scores: Effective for the Fall Semesters of 2021 to 2024, no standardized tests will be considered for freshmen applicants to UC Davis. This includes the selection process and awarding of scholarships. However, test scores may be used to fulfill the minimum eligibility requirements or for course placement after enrollment, if submitted with the application.

Graduate Course Eligibility Guidelines: As a basic requirement, applicants must have or will obtain a bachelor's degree with a GPA of 3.0 or equivalent. The degree obtained must be in alignment with the coursework and financial aid standards set by the University of California. Regional accreditation is necessary for US colleges, while foreign institutions must be approved by a national higher education body at the time the degree was earned. Indian students must meet specific national requirements, including having a postgraduate or master's degree and a four-year or three-year bachelor's degree from state or central boards that have been approved.

GMAT/GRE scores are mandatory for certain programs, along with results from other standardized exams.

The following information pertains to housing options at UC Davis, including both on-campus and off-campus accommodations. On-campus housing includes a variety of options such as residence halls, student apartments, campus apartments, and cooperatives. These facilities are managed by a collaboration between Student Housing and other private apartment complexes. All on-campus housing is conveniently located within the university campus to foster a sense of community among students. Additionally, there are a few off-campus options, including private residences and cooperative societies that are managed independently under contracts with UC Davis. Off-campus housing options may also be located near or within walking distance to the university.

On-campus housing consists of 23 residence halls spread across the Segundo, Tercero, and Cuarto neighborhoods. Segundo is positioned on the northwest corner of the central campus, while Tercero is located on the southwest corner, and Cuarto is a block north of the central campus. University Apartments, also managed by Student Housing and Dining Services, includes the Solano Park residence. For those seeking alternative options, there are several off-campus residences that work in partnership with the university, located both on and near the campus.

Off-campus housing typically costs between $600 and $700 per month, with options including studio apartments, three and four-bedroom apartments, and shared housing. Basic services such as electricity, central heating, and internet are included in the rental fee. The kitchen appliances are also energy-efficient, including a dishwasher, refrigerator, gas burner, and microwave, all to aid students in cost-efficient living. Johns Hopkins University, located in Maryland, is a prestigious private research institution that was founded in 1876. With a highly competitive acceptance rate of only 11%, the university has a student body of over 24,000 individuals enrolled in both full-time and part-time programs. The university consists of 9 schools, including the renowned schools of Business, Education, Arts & Sciences, Medicine, and Nursing, offering a wide range of more than 260 undergraduate, graduate, doctoral, certificate, and non-degree programs. Some of the most sought-after majors at Johns Hopkins University include Africana Studies, Biology, Computer Music, Anthropology, and Anatomy Education. 
With its main campus located in Baltimore, the university also has ten campus divisions across three continents. The Baltimore campus is divided into Homewood, East Baltimore, Harbor East, and Peabody, with additional satellite campuses in Montgomery County, Columbia, and Laurel, all within Maryland. Additionally, Johns Hopkins University has expanded globally, establishing a presence in Washington, D.C., Italy, and China. 
In addition to traditional on-campus programs, the university also offers online courses, some of which may count for credit. Furthermore, high school students can take advantage of the various summer programs offered. The university's study abroad program is also highly popular, with many undergraduates choosing to spend a semester or academic year in cities like Paris, Tokyo, or Barcelona. 
The estimated cost of attending Johns Hopkins University as an undergraduate student is around USD 57,000. However, the university is committed to providing need-blind financial aid to students in need. Among the financial aid programs available are the JHU Grant, Clark Scholarship, National Fellowships Program, Federal Pell Grant, Private Scholarships, and Federal Work-Study. 
For on-campus housing, students can opt for residence halls with double rooms (and a few singles) or suites with single, double, or triple rooms. Dining services are also available to students. There are plenty of extracurricular activities for students to engage in, with over 400 clubs and organizations, 24 varsity sports teams, and a myriad of events held throughout the academic year. According to placement surveys, 96% of Johns Hopkins University graduates are employed within a short time of graduation, with attractive salary packages.
Eligibility Overview:
Student eligibility requirements for university admission are as follows: Students must have a grade point average (GPA) ranging between 3.0-3.5 on a 4.0 scale in order to be considered for admission. Additionally, students must also meet the English language proficiency requirement.

English language proficiency is determined through a proficiency test. Students must demonstrate proficiency in the English language in order to gain admission. Generally, the English language proficiency required is at a level where students are able to effectively communicate and understand academic content.

Achieving a grade point average of 3.0-3.5 on a 4.0 scale is a crucial factor in determining a student's eligibility for university admission. This demonstrates a consistent level of academic performance and readiness for higher education.

Placement:
Johns Hopkins University offers an English graduate program that is highly effective in helping students find employment opportunities that fit their skills. By having a small class size, the university is able to provide individualized assistance to each student in their job search process. The department regularly organizes events where graduate students can engage and interact with professionals from various fields, both within and outside of academia. In addition, the university offers guidance and resources, such as workshops and alumni connections, to help students with publications, applications, and interviews. Students also have access to the well-facilitated Office of Integrative Learning and Life Design, which further aids them in their career preparation.

Out of all the PhD graduates since 2009, approximately 17% have found employment in fields such as publishing, speechwriting, law, and professional editing. The remaining 83% have successfully progressed into post-doctoral fellowships or academic positions at institutions like Stanford University, Cornell University, City College of New York, Case Western Reserve University, St. Mary's College of Calgary, and the University of Rochester. Notable job placements include tenure-track positions and roles in companies like the International Monetary Fund, Bates White Economic Consulting, Amazon, and Ernst & Young, among others. This showcases the diverse and promising career opportunities available to students of Josh Hopkins University's Economics Department.
Accommodation:
The Hopkins undergraduate experience is not complete without living on campus. Most undergraduates at the Homewood campus reside in on-campus housing for their first two years, with some choosing to continue living on campus. First-year students have two housing options: living in traditional residence halls, which mostly consist of shared rooms and bathrooms, or choosing to live in suite-style accommodations with private bathrooms, double, single, or triple occupancy options, and modern amenities such as central heating and air conditioning, and kitchenettes in some units. 

Off-campus housing is also an accessible option for students at the four Baltimore locations. There is a wide variety of rental homes and apartments within walking distance from the university. The Off-Campus Housing Office at JHU assists students in finding vacant properties through their postings. For more information on housing and dining at JHU, please visit our website.
Course Ranking: Johns Hopkins University offers a wide range of popular programs such as molecular biology, neuroscience, biomedical engineering, chemical engineering, and bioengineering. According to US News, the average freshman retention rate is an impressive 98%, indicating high student satisfaction with the quality of education at JHU. The university also has excellent rankings for specific subjects, most notably the master's degree in biomedical engineering which has held the top spot since 2018 in US News' rankings. In 2020, QS Rankings ranked the JHU Nursing program third among top universities. The JHU Computer Engineering program has also received recognition from prestigious ranking providers, consistently placing in the top 30 in US News' rankings and improving its position from 30 to 27 in 2021 according to THE. With its focus on research, JHU is an ideal choice for those seeking a top-tier university. However, admission to JHU is highly competitive with an acceptance rate of only 11.2% in 2020. Prospective students must possess outstanding academic records and strong test scores in order to be considered for admission at JHU. For more information on the admission process at John Hopkins University, please refer to the FAQs section on their official website.

Course Description:
Founded in 1876, Johns Hopkins University is a highly renowned institution of higher education globally. With a location in Baltimore, USA, the university has a diverse community of 5280 international students, promoting inclusivity. The university has gained recognition for its exceptional education and research opportunities.

Ranked 10th in Webometrics - World's Top Universities, Johns Hopkins University offers a wide range of bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees in various disciplines like Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university has three intakes - August, September, and January. The duration of bachelor's degrees is typically four years, and for master's degrees, it is one year. The annual tuition fee for international students at Johns Hopkins University is approximately $57,000 USD.

For students in need of financial assistance, the university provides numerous scholarships and grants. Some of the notable scholarships include USC Associates Scholarships for undergraduate Business programs, Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship, You Are Welcome Here Scholarship for Bs in Kinesiology at Michigan State University, and Graduate Incentive Award for MS in Applied Economics.

The university campus boasts of exceptional infrastructure with state-of-the-art research libraries, labs, centers, clubs, and dormitories for students and staff. Another significant draw for international students is the post-study work opportunities in the USA. The university is committed to supporting its students in achieving their career goals and making a positive impact in society.

To secure admission at Johns Hopkins University, students must meet certain criteria, including English proficiency scores like IELTS and TOEFL, and standardised test scores of exams like GRE, SAT, GMAT. They also need to submit letters of recommendation, work experience documents, statement of purpose, transcripts from their previous schools or colleges, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Chicago State University
Overview:
Chicago State University (CSU) in Illinois, USA, is a prestigious public university that was established in 1867. It is a proud member of the Thurgood Marshall College Fund and holds accreditation from the Higher Learning Commission. The university offers an extensive range of degree programs with over 56 options in various disciplines such as Business, Education, Health Science, Pharmacy, Arts, Sciences, Design, Psychology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Social Work, Languages, Engineering, Communication, and Philosophy. Additionally, CSU also boasts a diverse selection of graduate programs that include Master's degrees in Teaching, Fine Arts, Occupational Therapy, Public Health, and Science, as well as Doctoral degrees in Education (Ed.D) and Pharmacy. The university follows a semester system with sessions offered in Spring, Summer, and Fall, each with varying tuition fees and program-related expenses.

CSU's main campus houses all academic buildings and on-campus accommodation for students. The three-story coeducational residential hall can accommodate up to 330 students and provides a comfortable living space. Students can expect to incur an average of 6,028 USD per year for hostel and meal expenses. The cost for a hostel varies, but on average, a single room costs 3,000 USD per semester, while meals range from 1,256 to 2,453 USD (depending on the number of meals). Accommodation fees cover the 8-month academic period. The campus also offers a range of facilities, including a gym, fitness center, 3 swimming pools, a dance studio, an auxiliary gymnasium, and an athletic department. In addition, CSU, in partnership with the Chicago State Foundation, hosts an annual scholarship gala to raise funds for deserving students.

- An ACT score of 18.

Please keep in mind that submitting an ACT or SAT score is optional, but will be required starting Spring 2022.

Name: Pacific Lutheran University
Overview:
Resting in the heart of Tacoma, Washington lies Pacific Lutheran University, a private Christian institution established in 1890 by Norwegian immigrants. Proudly sponsored by the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America, this university offers a diverse range of programs including 54 minors and 44 majors, as well as professional and graduate studies in areas such as creative writing, finance, marketing analytics, and family therapy. With a total student body of approximately 3100, Pacific Lutheran University is home to a thriving community, with over 38% of its enrollment consisting of international students from 28 different countries and 38 states. At this university, students can expect a personalized learning experience with a student-to-teacher ratio of 13:1.

Earning acceptance into Pacific Lutheran University is a coveted achievement, as the institution has accepted over 80% of its applicants in the last five years. For the Class of 2024, the average GPA of accepted students stands at an impressive 3.0 on a scale of 4.0. Notable alumni of this prestigious university include accomplished American actor Connor Trinneer, renowned epidemiologist William Herbert Foege, and Olympic gold medalist swimmer Megan Jendrick. In fact, since 1975, Pacific Lutheran University has produced an impressive 100 Fulbright Scholars.

One of the key markers of success for any university is the employability of its graduates, and Pacific Lutheran University has exceeded expectations in this aspect. Within six months of graduation, 90% of Pacific Lutheran University students have secured employment or are pursuing further education. The total cost of tuition fees, meals, and rooms for the 2021-2022 academic year ranges between $55,000 to $60,000, with the university providing financial aid to 98% of its student body. In the previous academic year, the average financial assistance offered to students was an impressive $37,197. At Pacific Lutheran University, students not only receive an exceptional education, but also the support and resources they need to thrive and succeed in their future endeavors.

Name: Bowling Green State University
Overview:
Located in Bowling Green, Ohio, Bowling Green State University was founded in 1910 and is a well-known public university that offers a wide range of research programs and facilities. Along with its main campus in Bowling Green, the university also has several other campuses across the state, all of which provide high-quality education. The University’s oldest campus, which was established over 100 years ago, is situated in the southwest corner of the city. Covering an area of 1,338 acres, the main campus houses over 19,000 students, including 900 international students from various countries. The University comprises of 4 schools and 21 departments that offer diverse educational programs, including bachelor's, master's, doctoral, and short-term courses. With subjects like Musical Arts, Human Development, Engineering, Education, Business Management and more, Bowling Green State University offers exceptional learning opportunities and academic excellence. Additionally, the University also provides online courses for endorsements and offers graduate certificates programs that students can take advantage of. Name: Northern Illinois University
Overview:
Northern Illinois University (NIU) was established in 1895 by Governor John P. Altgeld, and its primary campus is located in Dekalb, Illinois. With multiple locations, including Chicago, Naperville, and Rockford, NIU has seven comprehensive colleges that cover areas such as business, education, law, health, human science, engineering, technology, liberal arts, and sciences, as well as visual and performing arts. Recognized as one of the top business colleges, NIU is ranked 298th in National Universities and 703rd in Global Universities by the US News and World Report 2021. 
NIU has earned the designation of a high research activity institution by the Carnegie Foundation, and it ranks 157th in undergraduate business by US News and World Report 2021. 
NIU's main campus in Dekalb spreads across an extensive 765 acres and offers over 100 undergraduate programs and 80 graduate programs, including minors, certificates, pre-professional studies, integrated programs, specialist degree programs, doctoral and research programs, as well as off-campus options. The university has 42 schools and departments across its seven degree-granting colleges. NIU is a proud member of the Association of Public and Land-Grant Universities and the Universities Research Association. With a student-faculty ratio of 13:1, NIU strives to provide a high-quality education to its students. 
For a well-rounded student experience, NIU offers over 300 student organizations, clubs, and active community service opportunities, as well as cultural resource centers and sports clubs. 
NIU also provides on-campus residential facilities for students, with options ranging from single rooms, suite rooms, and double rooms in six residence halls, including Gilbert Hall, Grant Hall, Neptune Hall, Stevenson Tower, Northern View Community, and Residence Hall. These facilities offer mixed co-ed floors, public workstations, in-hall laundry, and Wi-Fi access. The estimated cost of attendance for full-time undergraduate students ranges from USD 27,000 to USD 35,000.
Eligibility Overview:
The following are the necessary qualifications for international students who are planning to apply to Northern Illinois University's undergraduate and graduate programs:

Requirements for Undergraduates:

Students must have obtained a diploma or certificate from a recognized high school. The curriculum in high school should include:

- A minimum of four years of English
- Three years of mathematics
- Three years of science
- Three years of social studies
- At least two years of art, music, or a foreign language

In addition, a minimum GPA of 3.0 is required for admission. Some programs may also require submission of SAT or ACT scores, with an ACT score of 21 or above being mandatory.

To demonstrate English proficiency, undergraduate international students must provide one of the following scores:

- TOEFL iBT score of 71 or above
- TOEFL PBT score of 527 or above
- IELTS Academic score of 6.0 or higher
- Grade C or above in IGCSE/GCSE or GCE O-level English 
- English IB score of 4 or above in Standard level tests
- ELS score of 11 or above
- DET score of 105 or higher in Duolingo

Requirements for Graduates:

Students are required to hold a four-year bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university to be eligible for admission to graduate programs. A minimum GPA of 2.75, or an equivalent, is necessary.

Some programs may also require submission of GMAT or GRE scores.

To demonstrate English proficiency, international graduate students must provide one of the following scores:

- TOEFL score of 80 or above
- IELTS Academic score of 6.5 or higher
- PTE Academic score of 53 or above
- DET score of 105 or above

Name: Columbus State University

Name: Eastern Michigan University
Overview:
Eastern Michigan University (EMU) is a public university situated in Ypsilanti, Michigan. It was established in 1849 and offers over 200 major and minor programs through its 5 colleges. Each year, 42 study abroad programs are available to students. EMU's academic offerings span across a variety of fields such as business, health professions, psychology, marketing, social sciences, management, and education. The campus, occupying more than 800 acres, comprises of 122 buildings. These include the College of Arts & Science, College of Education, College of Business, College of Engineering & Technology, College of Health & Human Services, and the Graduate School and Honors College. Located near Ann Arbor and only a short 45-minute drive from Chicago, EMU is easily accessible to students. 

The university is renowned for its nationally recognized programs, including a Masters in Clinical Research, an MBA in International Business, a Teacher Education Program, and an Animation & Gaming Program. EMU places a strong emphasis on practical skill development, in addition to theoretical learning. The campus boasts modern facilities such as well-equipped smart classrooms, computer labs, and libraries to support students' learning journey. Students are presented with a plethora of career opportunities, including industrial workshops, participation in the State of Michigan Internship Programs, remote internships, and full-time and part-time employment opportunities. 

As a testament to its commitment to cater to a diverse student body, EMU also offers a broad range of online programs. Along with traditional degree programs, EMU also offers summer courses which span over a shorter duration. These courses cover a diverse range of topics such as Abnormal Psychology, Financial Markets & Institutions, Accounting Principles, and Adult Health Nursing. 

EMU understands the importance of providing a comfortable and convenient living environment for its students. As a result, it provides various housing options on campus, along with meal plans. With 18 on-campus dining locations, students have access to a wide variety of food options. Additionally, the highly experienced faculty at EMU is dedicated to helping students unlock their full potential and discover their ideal career paths.
Eligibility Overview:
The following are the minimum required scores for full admission at this university:
1. TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language): 79 for the Internet-based test (TOEFL Home Edition conducted remotely is also accepted).
2. TOEFL Essentials: A minimum score of 9 is required.
3. IELTS (International English Language Testing System): A minimum overall score of 6.5 is required (IELTS Indicator, the online test, is also accepted).
4. Pearson English Language Test (PTE): A score of 53 or higher is required.
5. Michigan English Test (MET): A score of 57 or higher is required.
6. Duolingo: A minimum score of 105 is required.

Name: Butler University
Overview: Founded in 1855, Butler University is a private college located in Indianapolis, Indiana that offers a diverse range of programs. These include 19 graduate programs, eight pre-professional programs, and over 60 major programs. The university consists of six colleges specializing in liberal arts and sciences, business, communication, pharmacy, and health sciences. Among its top master's programs are medical sciences, risk and insurance, an experiential program for preparing school principals (EPPSP), and English literature. Butler also offers unique three-year majors in subjects such as anthropology, biochemistry, communication sciences and disorders, computer science, criminology, English literature, German, and history. Additionally, students have access to more than 200 study abroad programs worldwide. The annual tuition fee is USD 42,410, and the estimated cost of living is USD 14,700. International students may be eligible for various financial awards, grants, and scholarships based on their academic achievements, potential, and skills. Butler offers scholarship programs ranging from USD 10,000 to 20,000 as part of its commitment to providing accessible education. Moreover, Butler provides its students with placement programs and employment services to help them kickstart their careers.
Eligibility Overview:
The following are the requirements for admission to Butler University as an international student:

- Submit a completed application, indicating a desired major and providing a foreign address as your "Home Country Address."
- Provide bank statements showing a minimum balance of $16,690 USD (scanned copies are acceptable).
- Each sponsor must submit a signed and dated Sponsor Letter/Financial Guarantee Form within six months of the semester start date (scanned copies are acceptable).
- Submit English transcripts from your high school (scanned copies are acceptable).
