Name: The University of Findlay
Overview:
The University of Findlay (UF) is a non-denominational Christian institution located in Findlay, Ohio. UF offers a diverse range of undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs, including 86 undergraduate courses of study, 11 Master's degrees, 5 Doctoral degrees, and Baccalaureate degrees through its various schools: the College of Education, the College of Business, the College of Health Professions, the College of Humanities and Social Sciences, the College of Arts, the College of Pharmacy, and the College of Sciences. Classes are offered on a part-time, full-time, and online basis to cater to the needs of students.

To be considered for admission, potential candidates must have a minimum score of 6.0 in the IELTS or 61 in the TOEFL exam. The top-ranked programs at UF include the MBA, with a tuition fee of 21,289 USD, the BS in Computer Science, which costs 32,343 USD, and the BS in Chemistry, with a tuition fee of 30,569 USD. The full-time tuition for 12-18 credit hours would amount to approximately 35,174 USD, and additional expenses, such as student fees and general service fees, would cost 1,310 USD.

Incoming first-year undergraduate students with outstanding academic records may be eligible for a merit scholarship of 8,000 to 15,000 USD annually, which is renewable for the entire four-year duration of their studies based on their GPA.

UF prides itself on producing top graduates in various fields, including Business Administration and Management (with an average salary of 43,000 USD), Pharmacy (with an average salary of 121,200 USD), and Animal Sciences (with an average salary of 30,300 USD). With its wide range of programs and excellent academic opportunities, UF is a top choice
Eligibility Overview:
The admission requirements for students who are unable to take the ACT or SAT due to COVID-19 closing testing centres will be reviewed based on the following criteria: high school academic performance (a minimum cumulative grade point average of 2.5 and class rank), American College Test (ACT) scores (a minimum composite score of 20), or Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT) scores (a minimum composite score of 950). In case of any difficulties in taking the ACT or SAT due to COVID-19 closures, the university will consider the following alternatives: a letter of recommendation from a professor, a written sample of previous academic work with grading, and an interview with our admissions office representative.

For international applicants, a minimum score of 61 in TOEFL (iBT), 6.0 in IELTS, 50 in Pearson Test of English (academic), or 3.5 in International Test of English Proficiency (iTEP) is required for undergraduate programmes. However, those who have completed their secondary and/or post-secondary education in English may request an exemption. Students who meet these language criteria but need further improvement can enrol in our Intensive English Program (IELP) before starting their academic studies. Those who successfully complete our IELP will have the TOEFL, IELTS, Pearson Test of English (academic), and/or iTEP requirements waived.

From scheduling appointments to resume help, hosting in-person and virtual job fairs and interviews, offering information sessions on campus, to hosting employers at the university's hall tables, students have ample opportunities to interact with potential employers. Accommodation: At UCM, students have several on-campus housing options, including five apartment complexes (Todd, Foster-Knox, and Nickerson) and near-campus options (Greenwood Park and Central Village). Campus-affiliated housing operates on a first-come, first-served basis, so it's important to prioritize choices.When living in campus dorms, students must pay a deposit, the amount of which depends on the chosen apartment. Name: Victory Institute
Overview: The Victory Institute was founded in 1993 by LGBTQ activists and philanthropists who saw a crucial need to equip and support LGBTQ candidates in government positions nationwide. With a bleak representation of less than 50 openly LGBTQ elected officials at any level of government in the United States, our founders recognized that increasing our numbers in public service was vital for advancing equality. This led to the establishment of the Victory Institute, which focuses on educating potential candidates and campaign workers, providing them with knowledge and resources to pursue careers in government. Additionally, the Foundation launched the Presidential Appointments Project, resulting in Roberta Achtenberg becoming the first openly LGBTQ presidential appointee to a Senate-confirmed position as Assistant Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.
Eligibility Overview: The Victory Congressional Internship offers opportunities for undergraduate students from diverse backgrounds to participate in a unique internship experience in Washington, D.C. All students, regardless of gender, orientation, ability, ethnicity, or political affiliation are encouraged to apply. We especially welcome women, people of colour, trans individuals, persons with disabilities, and individuals from low-income families to apply and bring their perspectives to the program. Eligibility for the internship requires applicants to be members of the LGBTQ+ community and must be U.S. citizens, legal permanent residents, or have work permits (Note: students with F-1 visas are not eligible). Eligible applicants must also be at least 18 years old before arriving in Washington, D.C. and have completed at least one year of an undergraduate program. For summer participants, at least one full semester must remain after the program ends (i.e., students who graduate before or during the summer program are not eligible). Spring and fall program participants must not graduate before the program ends. We welcome applicants from diverse fields of study. Active involvement in public and/or community service projects is highly valued. It is important to note that individuals who identify as "allies" of the LGBTQ+ community do not meet the eligibility requirements for this program.
Placement:
The Victory Institute's Victory Congressional Internship is dedicated to shaping the future generation of LGBTQ public leaders. This program offers exceptional LGBTQ college students the opportunity to intern in Washington, DC, for a semester and participate in an intensive leadership program. This includes: 
 - Working as an intern for eight to ten weeks with a member of Congress from the LGBTQ+ Equality Caucus or a pro-LGBTQ Congress member, gaining first-hand knowledge about the federal legislative process 
- An educational and leadership development program that exposes participants to potential careers in policymaking and allows them to network and learn from experts in various fields within the District of Columbia 
- Attendance at the biennial International LGBTQ Leaders Conference, where students can engage with over a hundred openly LGBTQ leaders in government, politics, activism, business, and community organizations 
Through the Victory Congressional Internship, young LGBTQ individuals will gain the skills and knowledge necessary to become well-informed decision-makers and influential leaders who can positively impact their communities and society as a whole.

Florida National University offers an open-door admissions policy which ensures that all qualified candidates are accepted, regardless of their ethnicity, gender, religion, national origin, age, or physical disability. The focus of open enrollment is to provide students with accessibility and opportunity, without any restrictions. This includes the lack of requirement for SAT or ACT test scores, although students will need to complete a diagnostic evaluation to assess their readiness for college-level courses. This test will identify if students require any remedial or developmental courses before they can enroll in their chosen curriculum.

Name: Valparaiso University
Overview:
Valparaiso University, located in Valparaiso, Indiana, was founded in 1859 and is considered one of the first institutions in the US to implement co-educational programs. Originally known as Valparaiso Male and Female College, it closed during the civil war and reopened in 1871 under its current name. The university spans 350 acres of scenic suburban land, just an hour away from Chicago, and offers both part-time and full-time academic programs. With a diverse student body of approximately 4,000, including international students, Valparaiso University offers a wide range of bachelors and masters degree programs in areas such as Physical Education, Engineering, Sports Media, Accounting, Business, Greek and Roman Studies, and Data Science. 

Valparaiso University boasts state-of-the-art research and computer facilities, a large library housing thousands of books, and an array of recreational amenities, including an indoor track, swimming pool, and gym. The university also has on-campus housing options, providing comfortable and well-furnished accommodation to approximately 2,000 students. The cost of studying at Valparaiso University averages around 40,500 USD per year, and this includes tuition fees, books, and other miscellaneous expenses. The estimated total cost of living, including on-campus facilities, is around 59,000 USD per year. The university offers scholarships and grants to eligible students, and also assists in finding off-campus housing options if needed. Considering these expenses, the total estimated cost of studying at Valparaiso University comes to an average of 50,000 USD per year.
Eligibility Overview:
Valparaiso University accepts applications from both domestic and international students for their graduate programs. Meeting the requirements for eligibility is necessary for admission to the university. International aspirants must have a valid English proficiency score from examinations such as ACT, SAT, IELTS, TOEFL, IGCSE A and O Levels, iTEP, or the International Baccalaureate (IB). However, due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, the university is also accepting Duolingo Test scores. The university does not require English proficiency test scores from students who are permanent residents of Australia or the United Kingdom.

To be eligible for postgraduate studies at Valparaiso University, aspirants must hold a valid undergraduate degree from an accredited institution. They should also have a GPA of 3.0 (equivalent to a B-Average) in both graduate and undergraduate studies to be considered for admission.

Indian students also need to meet the English proficiency requirements to be considered for admission to any undergraduate or graduate program at Valparaiso University. They can submit English proficiency test scores such as ACT, SAT, IELTS, TOEFL, IGCSE A and O Levels, iTEP, or the International Baccalaureate (IB). Along with this, they must also submit two professional recommendation letters online for their application to be considered.
Placement: The employment rate at Valparaiso University after graduation is an impressive 97%. The university has a dedicated career center that assists students and alumni in securing internships and jobs in the United States following graduation. Graduates from Valparaiso University are highly sought after in various industries, including healthcare, management, manufacturing, accounting, engineering, and marketing. Noteworthy internship opportunities have been offered at prominent companies such as NASA, Adidas, Caterpillar, and Paramount Studios, providing valuable experience for students.
Accommodation: On-campus housing is available for international students at Valparaiso University, allowing them to be conveniently located on campus. The university provides various housing options, including nine residence halls and apartment buildings, as well as six fraternity houses, for the majority of undergraduate students. This ensures that students are able to easily access campus facilities and have a sense of community within their living environment. Valparaiso University prioritizes the comfort and convenience of its students by providing them with numerous housing options on or near campus.

Name: University of Massachusetts Boston (UMass Boston)
Overview: University of Massachusetts Boston (UMass Boston) is a public university situated in the heart of Boston. It was established in 1964 and is the second university in the UMass system. Offering 207 undergraduate, graduate, and certificate programs, UMass Boston has 8 schools and colleges and over 50 interdisciplinary research centers. The university has a strong track record of producing successful graduates, with approximately 4000 students graduating in 2020. The total enrollment for Fall 2020 stands at 16,259, who are actively involved in academic programs, public service, and research endeavors. The excellence of its academic programs is reflected in its positions in the U.S. News and Report’s 2022 Graduate School list, with courses in Education, Nursing, Clinical Psychology, and Public Affairs ranking among the top 100 programs. Moreover, UMass Boston's Ph.D. program in Gerontology is recognized as a global leader, producing the highest number of gerontology PhDs in the world. In 2019, Forbes ranked UMass Boston at No. 247 in its 4th annual ranking of the 300 Best Value Colleges, solidifying its reputation as a top university.

Accommodation:
The housing options at Lycoming College can be divided into two categories, on campus accommodation and off campus accommodation. To request a housing accommodation, students must fill out a specific form and submit it to the Residential Life Office.

The Request for Housing Accommodation at Lycoming College covers two types of housing, namely on-campus and off-campus options. Students must complete a dedicated form and send it to the Residential Life Office to make a housing accommodation request. 

The form consists of two pages and should be printed for submission. If there are any difficulties in printing the form, we are happy to provide a mailed or emailed copy upon request. The form requires the student or their parent/guardian to complete the first page, while the certifying professional must complete the second page. 

After submission, the Housing Committee will review the request, which includes Residential Life staff, the Nurse Director of Student Health Services, Counseling Services, and the Coordinator of Accessibility Resources. Students will receive an email notification regarding the approval or denial of their request. The evaluation process may take up to one month to complete. 

For further information on how to request a housing accommodation, please visit the Lycoming College website or contact the Residential Life Office. We strive to provide the best housing options for our students' comfort and convenience.

Name: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
Overview:
The University of North Carolina at Charlotte is a public research institution located in North Carolina, United States. It was established in 1946 as the Charlotte Centre of the University of North Carolina and later became a full-fledged university after merging with the Consolidated University of North Carolina in 1965. Over the years, it has gained recognition for its outstanding research work and has become a highly respected academic institute. The university comprises nine colleges that offer a wide range of programs including 79 undergraduate, 66 graduate, and 24 doctoral programs in various fields. Some of the top-ranked courses at the University of North Carolina at Charlotte include MS in Mechanical Engineering, MS in Electrical Engineering, and Bachelors in Business Administration (BBA).

In addition to the main campus, the university also has a Center City Campus located in Uptown Charlotte, which offers a variety of programs, including the highly acclaimed MBA program. 

To provide students with a well-rounded college experience, the University of North Carolina at Charlotte offers a vibrant social scene through its various student organizations, fraternities and sororities. The university also has a strong alumni network that offers invaluable support to students in terms of career guidance and opportunities. The university's sports team, known as the Charlotte 49ers, competes in various intercollegiate tournaments, adding to the overall college experience.

Name: The Ohio State University
Overview: Columbus's renowned Ohio State University, established in 1870 as the Ohio Agricultural and Mechanical College, is a public research institution and flagship of the highly esteemed University System of Ohio. Recognized as one of the top public universities in the United States, with a strong emphasis on research, OSU offers a broad range of undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs across its 18 schools and colleges. Among its premier programs are the MS in Welding Engineering, Doctor of Philosophy in Political Science, and Masters of Business Administration (MBA). Boasting the largest number of Fulbright Scholars in the nation, and renowned for producing Nobel laureates, Rhodes scholars, Pulitzer winners, and Olympic medallists, Ohio State University truly stands out as a powerhouse of academic excellence.
Eligibility Overview: Ohio State University requires all applicants to demonstrate proficiency in English by providing official TOEFL or IELTS Academic test scores. This applies to individuals who do not have a first language in English, have received their education primarily outside of the United States, or have been a permanent resident, asylee, or refugee in the U.S. for less than a year before their first term of enrollment. To be considered official, test scores must be obtained directly from ETS or IELTS by the application deadline. Applicants must meet the minimum scores of 19 on each section of the paper-based TOEFL, 79 on the TOEFL iBT or TOEFL iBT Home Edition, 7.0 on the IELTS Academic test or IELTS Indicator (6.5 for Moritz College of Law applicants), or 105 on the Duolingo test. It is important to note that meeting these minimum scores may not be sufficient for all graduate programs, and in some cases, a higher score may be required. It should also be noted that an admitted student may still be required to take the English placement exam or the Oral Proficiency Assessment for Graduate Teaching Associates, regardless of their test scores.

- 49 on the PTE
- 95 on the Duolingo English test

Accommodation:
North Park University offers a variety of on-campus housing options for students to choose from. These include apartments and houses, providing a safe and supportive living environment for students. Regardless of where you live, you will have access to the university's amenities and community.

One of the on-campus housing options is Anderson Hall, which can house up to 228 female students, mainly freshmen and sophomores. This six-story building is located on the south side of the campus. Another option is Burgh Hall, a co-ed residence with a beautiful view of the river. This four-story building can accommodate up to 200 students, primarily first- and second-year students.

For those seeking a more independent living experience, Ohlson House offers a restored apartment building that can house 136 students, mainly sophomores. The apartments come in double, triple, and occasionally single formats, each with its unique style and personality. Here, you can also catch the CRUX show, a popular campus television program.

The Park North Apartments, a co-ed building, provides the best of both worlds - the comfort of an apartment and the benefits of living in a regular residence hall. Up to 70 students can live in this building, which is conveniently located near the core campus. For upperclassmen, Sawyer Court offers an inviting option with enough space for up to 100 students. This apartment building is situated in the neighborhood next to the university.

In addition to these options, the university also owns a variety of homes and apartment complexes close to campus that are used as student housing. These properties primarily house juniors and seniors. For more information on housing options, visit the North Park University residence life and housing page. For any general inquiries, please visit the same page.

Name: University of Utah
Overview: The esteemed University of Utah, founded in 1850, is a prominent hub in Salt Lake City known for its exceptional sports, academics, and research opportunities. It is commonly referred to as the U of U or simply The U. Accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities (NWCCU), the institute is home to 17 distinguished schools and colleges, including those for business, cultural and social transformation, architecture and planning, engineering, fine arts, dentistry, education, health, humanities, pharmacy, and more. As per the Milken Institute rankings, this university ranks first nationally for technology commercialization. According to U.S. News & World Report's 2022 ranking, the university secured the 99th spot among National Universities. It is also worth noting that the university has approximately 100 academic departments and several interdisciplinary programs. The student-to-faculty ratio here is 17:1, which is the lowest among public institutions in Utah. Additionally, the university boasts the highest graduation rate among all the public universities in the state, with about 70% of first-year students graduating in six years. Among its many impressive achievements, the university places a strong emphasis on the commercialization of its research. As of 2019, it has received 547 million dollars in research funding and recorded 69 start-ups, generating $212 million in licensing revenue. The median starting salary for University of Utah alumni ranges from $50,000 to $55,000.
Eligibility Overview:
The University of Utah requires applicants to have a minimum GPA of 3.66 and be ranked above average in their high school class. It is recommended to have a combination of A’s and B’s, with a higher number of A’s. Taking challenging courses, such as AP or IB, can compensate for a lower GPA.

Prospective students must have a transferable GPA of 2.6 or higher after completing 30 semester hours, or a GPA of 2.35 or higher after obtaining an Associate of Arts or Associate of Science degree.

Name: Drexel University
Overview:
Drexel University, founded in 1891, is a prestigious private research university located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Originally known as Drexel Institution of Art, Science, and Industry, it was later renamed Drexel Institute of Technology. The university offers over 120 online degree programs including doctoral, master's, and bachelor's degrees, as well as accredited certificate programs that have the same curriculum as on-campus equivalents. These online degrees are designed to provide convenience without compromising on the quality of education. 
Drexel University stands out for its exceptional cooperative education programs, which offer hands-on learning experiences for students in fields such as computer science, business analytics, information systems, quantitative finance, electrical engineering, and mechanical engineering. These programs are specifically tailored for professionals looking to further their education in a convenient online format. 
For international students, the annual course fee is USD 54,766 while on-campus housing is available and averages USD 16,488 for a full year including accommodation and meals. Financial aid is available through federal, state, and institutional scholarships for eligible students. Drexel University takes pride in providing professional employment opportunities for students, allowing them to gain up to 18 months of work experience through participating in up to three co-op rotations. 
Not only is Drexel a renowned research university with a yearly expenditure of over USD 110 million, but it also focuses on various research initiatives in fields like medical and health science, basic sciences, biotechnology, and information science. It has made significant strides in research on engineering cities, plasma medicine and biology, and neuro-engineering.
Eligibility Overview: Drexel University requires applicants to have a high school GPA of 3.73 or above and to be ranked above average in their graduating class. A mix of grades ranging from A to B is necessary for consideration, with an emphasis on earning A's. Students who have taken rigorous courses such as AP or IB can boost their weighted GPA, which demonstrates their preparedness for college. Aspiring Dragons with an average SAT score between 1190-1390 or an average ACT score between 25-31 are strongly encouraged to apply. To be considered above average in their graduating class, candidates should maintain a balance of A's and B's, with an emphasis on achieving A's.

Name: University of Albany, The State University of New York, Albany (SUNY Albany)
Overview: The University at Albany is a publicly funded research university founded in 1844. In 1905, it underwent a reorganization of its academic structure, making it the first higher education institution in New York City to offer a bachelor's degree. UAlbany earned the 172nd spot in the 2022 edition of U.S. News & World Report Best Colleges rankings, placing it among the top national universities. In the QS Global World Ranking 2020, it ranked #751-800 globally. The campus is divided into two sections - the Downtown Campus and the Uptown Campus. The former, established in 1909, houses the College of Information Technology, Rockefeller College of Policy and Public Affairs, School of Social Welfare and School of Criminal Justice, while the latter, situated at 1400 Washington Avenue in Albany, serves as the main campus and spans 610 acres. UAlbany follows a semester-based academic calendar and offers over 50 undergraduate majors and roughly 120 master's programs, including those in the business and education schools. Boasting highly-ranked graduate programs, such as social work, criminal justice, and specialties in Rockefeller College of Public Affairs and Policy, UAlbany's in-state tuition and fees range from $10,000 to $10,500, while out-of-state students can expect to pay around $28,000 to $28,500. Enrollment numbers for the fall 2020 semester reveal a total of 13,182 undergraduate students. Notable alumni of UAlbany include Nobel Prize winner in Chemistry, Joachim Frank, Turing Award recipient, Richard E. Stearns, Wolf Prize winner, Omar Yaghi, renowned chemist, Alanna Schepartz, famous actress, Carolee Carmello, gay rights pioneer, Harvey Milk, and Pulitzer Prize winner, William Kennedy.

Name: University of Massachusetts Lowell (UMass Lowell)
Overview: Founded in 1894, the University of Massachusetts Lowell is a prestigious research institution located in the historic city of Lowell, situated along the Merrimack River. It has been accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education (NECHE) and is a member of various higher education associations, including the American Association of Colleges of Nursing, Council of Colleges of Arts and Sciences, National University Continuing Education Association, and the College Entrance Examination Board. According to U.S. News & World Report's 2022 rankings, the university was ranked 179th in the National Universities category and 112th in the Best Colleges for Veterans category. Additionally, the institute has a fall 2020 acceptance rate of 75%. Approximately 50% of admitted students hold an ACT score between 23 and 29 and an SAT score ranging from 1150 to 1320. Graduate students at UMass Lowell are given the opportunity to transition to master's programs from their undergraduate majors, with over 100 fields of study available. These include Applied Biomedical Sciences, American Studies, Biochemistry Option: Chemistry, Bioinformatics: Interdisciplinary, Clinical Option: Exercise Science, and Art History, among others. Financial aid is also available for students pursuing undergraduate degrees, with the total annual cost for in-state students ranging between $29,000 and $29,300 and for out-of-state students, between $47,000 and $47,300. The university awards over $192 million in total aid to its students. Upon graduation, alumni of UMass Lowell can expect an average mid-career salary ranging from $109,000 to $109,500. 95% of graduates either secure employment in their chosen fields or pursue further advanced studies within six months of receiving their degrees. According to Payscale.com, the university offers one of the highest returns on investment for its alumni nationally.
Eligibility Overview:
Transcripts from high school, along with either SAT or ACT scores, are required for admission to UMass Lowell. The average SAT range is 1150-1320, while the average ACT range is 24-29. Additionally, applicants must have completed the UG application and submitted documents to prove their financial support. The university also requires scores from either the TOEFL or IELTS tests to demonstrate English proficiency, with the following minimum scores: 
- TOEFL: 0-120 
- IELTS: 0-9.

Name: Oklahoma State University
Overview: Oklahoma State University, located in Stillwater, is a prestigious public university founded in 1890 by the state to increase access to higher education. With a main campus in Stillwater and four additional locations, the university offers a wide range of academic programs consisting of 200 undergraduate programs, 79 master's programs, and 45 doctoral programs. Students have access to both on-campus and off-campus libraries. The undergraduate programs offered include agriculture, engineering & technology, veterinary medicine, and business. Some of the top courses at the university are MSc Management, M.Sc. Computer Science, MS Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering, and MS Business Analytics & Data Science. Tuition fees are $28,220 for undergraduate courses and $18,903 for post-graduate courses. The university provides on-campus housing in 31 residential halls with various room options and amenities. Housing fees range from $9,340 to $11,310, depending on the chosen residence and room type. The university's scenic central campus spans 700 acres and includes recreational facilities such as training areas, basketball and volleyball courts. Students can get involved in over 500 student clubs and organizations, and participate in community engagement and extension service programs to enhance their leadership and management skills. Financial aid is available in the form of grants, loans, and scholarships, which are awarded based on factors such as GPA, leadership experiences, community service, written essays, and interviews. The university offers career services to help students find internships and job placements in their chosen field.
Eligibility Overview:
1. Below are the qualifications needed for admission in various undergraduate and postgraduate programs at OSU:
- For undergraduate programs, a minimum GPA of 3.0 and high school ranking in the top 33.3 percent are required.
- SAT scores between 1060 and 1280 or ACT scores between 22 and 28 are also required. Students can submit either SAT or ACT scores.
- Candidates must have an IELTS academic score of at least 5.5 or a Duolingo English Test score of at least 85. The university currently accepts the Duolingo English Test due to the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic.

2. The eligibility requirements for postgraduate programs at OSU are as follows:
- Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree from a recognized college or university.
- Transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities must be submitted.
- Applicants are required to take either the GMAT or GRE test.
- International students whose first language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency through one of the following tests:
  - IELTS: minimum score of 5.5
  - TOEFL: minimum score of 71 on the internet-based test
  - Duolingo English Test: minimum score of 85

Placement: At GMU, preparing students for a successful career in an ever-changing global landscape is top priority. Through internships, students gain valuable experience in their desired field while applying classroom theories to real-world challenges. Accommodation:
The university offers a secure and tranquil environment for students to enjoy their best years. With a wide selection of 40 residence halls, including standard rooms, suites, and apartments, you can find a home that suits your needs. While some students may reside in suites, the majority of freshmen opt for standard rooms. Upperclassmen have the option to live in suite-style or apartment-style halls. These halls are divided into three neighborhoods, namely Aquia, Rappahannock, and Shenandoah, and are managed by professional and student personnel who strive to provide you with the resources you need for a comfortable stay. Each neighborhood, along with the Mason Global Center, has a service desk that operates 24/7. Housing also provides various amenities, such as free laundry, Wi-Fi, and TV.

Suite-style halls come in eight different floor plans, with some suites having bedrooms accessible from the main corridor and sharing a bathroom with other rooms. Others have hallway entrances and feature two to four bedrooms, accommodating up to four individuals per bathroom. Bedrooms can be doubles, singles, or triples, and a few units offer kitchenettes. However, a meal plan is mandatory for those living in suites.

The five apartment-style buildings are home to around half of the upperclassmen. These fully furnished flats come in various floor configurations, with complete kitchens, dining spaces, living rooms, and baths. Bedrooms range from two singles to two doubles and two singles, accommodating four individuals in most units. Some apartments can house two, five, or six people. Students residing in these apartments have the option to purchase a voluntary meal plan.

The townhouses offer a unique living experience, and their details can be explored further on the housing website.
Course Description: George Mason University, a prestigious institution for higher education, dates back to 1949. The university, located in Fairfax, USA, has a diverse community of 3318 international students, showcasing its commitment to inclusivity. George Mason University is renowned globally for its excellent academic programs and research output. It ranks 225th on the list of Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees in various fields like Business, Humanities, and Engineering. There are 4 intake sessions in Fall (August), Spring (January), and two more intakes in August and January for students' convenience. The duration of bachelor's programs is typically 4 years, and for master's degree courses, it is 2 years. The tuition fee for studying at George Mason University depends on the chosen program and can be obtained by contacting the university. Fortunately, George Mason University offers several scholarships and grants to help students financially. Some well-known scholarships provided by the university are USC Associates Scholarships for undergraduate business programs, Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship, You Are Welcome Here Scholarship for Bachelor's in Kinesiology at Michigan State University, and Graduate Incentive Award for an MS in Applied Economics. The sprawling campus includes modern buildings, advanced research libraries, well-equipped laboratories, centers, clubs, hostels, and various other facilities for the students and faculty. Apart from quality education, one significant factor that attracts international students to George Mason University is the wide range of post-study work opportunities in the United States. The university also provides guidance to students to excel in their careers and become contributing members of society. Like any other university, George Mason University also has specific admission requirements concerning English proficiency, which can be fulfilled by providing IELTS or TOEFL scores. Apart from that, the university also considers standardized test scores of exams like GRE, SAT, GMAT, etc. Along with these, students must also submit letters of recommendation, work experience certificates, statements of purpose, transcripts from their previous schools or colleges, and valid passports and visas to be eligible for admission.

Name: University of Toledo
Overview: The University of Toledo is a public research institution located in Toledo, Ohio. It was founded in 1872 and is the northernmost campus of the University System of Ohio. The university has a strong focus on guiding students towards success in their future endeavors. It is organized into Aon College of Adult and Lifelong Learning, College of Arts and Letters, College of Business and Innovation, School of Healthcare Business Enterprise and Innovation, College of Health and Human Services, Judith Herb College of Education, College of Engineering, College of Graduate Studies, College of Health Sciences, College of Law, and College of Medicine and Life Sciences. With an acceptance rate of 96%, the university offers over 300 undergraduate and graduate degree programs that are highly ranked in fields such as Occupational Therapy, Engineering, Business, and Law. The university provides a dynamic academic and cultural environment for its students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The average annual tuition and accommodation fee is approximately $29,000, but the university offers various scholarships that can bring down the cost to $16,000. The campus covers 1,423 acres of stunning land and includes facilities such as libraries, visual art centers, museums, parks, athletic centers, health centers, recreation centers, and residence halls. The university has a strong alumni network, with notable alumni in leading industries, providing promising placement opportunities for graduating students.
Eligibility Overview:
Unconditional admission requirements include a minimum GPA of 2.5 and a score of 15 on the ACT or 830-870 on the SAT. Applicants with a minimum GPA of 2.0 and an ACT score of 16 or a SAT score of 880-910 are also eligible for unconditional admission. 
For those who choose not to submit test scores, a GPA of 3.0 is required. 
Conditional admission may be granted to applicants with a score of 15 on the ACT or 830-870 on the SAT and a GPA of 2.75 or above, or those with a GPA between 2.0 and 2.49. 
Applicants with a score of 16 on the ACT or 889-910 on the SAT but a GPA lower than 2.0 will also be considered. 
Test-optional applicants with a GPA between 2.0 and 2.99 will be reviewed for conditional admission.

Accommodation: The information presented here pertains to residence requirements for students at The University of Toledo. Unless a request for exemption from residency has been submitted and approved by the Office of Residence Life, students arriving at UToledo directly after completing high school are required to live in a university residence hall and participate in the food plan program. This mandate applies for the first two years of their academic career at UToledo, during which time they must reside on campus. Both domestic and international students are housed in the Horton International House, a seven-story building that is centrally located and equipped with various amenities such as climate control, lounge rooms with glass-enclosures, a computer lab, laundry facilities, a multipurpose room, and cultural presentation spaces. Additionally, a ceremonial washroom is available for students with specific religious traditions. For further details on housing, please refer to the link provided-https://www.utoledo.edu/admission/international/housing.html.

Name: Bryant University
Overview:
Bryant University, formerly known as Bryant College, is an illustrious private institution established in 1863. Located in Smithfield, Rhode Island, USA, it spans over 428 acres. The university comprises of two renowned colleges - The College of Arts and Sciences and The College of Business. Known for its exceptional business programs, Bryant University offers an array of undergraduate and postgraduate courses in fields like Finance, Accounting, and Marketing. It also provides a range of certificate programs to enhance student success. Accredited by prestigious organizations like the New England Association of Schools and Colleges and the AACSB International, Bryant University is associated with the Space Grant.

The university has a fee structure of USD 46,885 per year. With a commendable student-faculty ratio of 13:1, Bryant University strives to provide affordable education. Plus, the university offers various financial aids and need-based scholarships for students. The campus is buzzing with numerous club sports and intramural teams, providing ample opportunities for students to stay active. Bryant University is a proud member of the Northeast Conference and boasts a staggering 22 intercollegiate varsity athletic programs, with equal representation for both men and women.

Apart from sports, the university houses an array of student clubs to enhance the overall college experience. Additionally, Bryant University provides on-campus housing facilities throughout the academic year, including dormitories, suites, and townhouse apartments, equipped with all basic amenities and a reliable wireless internet connection. At the end of each academic year, students can participate in the housing selection process to secure accommodation for the upcoming year. Bryant University is home to a diverse student community, with pupils hailing from over 60 countries, including India and China.

The institution's Office of International Students and Scholars offers assistance to students for immigration and visa-related issues. By collaborating with the Amica Centre for Career Education, Bryant University boasts an impressive record of 99% of students securing employment within six months of graduation, with a starting salary of USD 57,600. The university also provides internship opportunities with various global firms like BBC Worldwide and Coca-Cola, offering students valuable exposure in the professional world.
Eligibility Overview:
The following are the minimum requirements for international students applying to Bryant University:

- A completed online application form with all necessary personal and academic information filled out.
- A non-refundable application fee of $50.
- Official scores from standardized tests like ACT and SAT.
- Official transcripts of academic qualifications in English.
- Verified documentation of financial aid, such as student loans.
- A photocopy of the ID pages of your passport.
- For post-graduate students, documentation of relevant job experience and other pertinent information.

It is crucial for international students to demonstrate excellent English proficiency in order to be admitted to Bryant University. The minimum accepted scores for English proficiency tests are as follows:

- TOEFL iBT: 80
- IELTS: 6.5

After two years of graduating, a staggering 97% of graduates were employed, and even after six years, the employment rate remained high at 95%. The university boasts a strong alumni network, and the Career Center plays a crucial role in assisting graduates in finding suitable job opportunities and internships. The Career Center offers a wide range of services, including mentoring, training sessions, mock interviews, and more, to guide students in their job search process and career development.

It is known as one of the most esteemed universities in New York, boasting a student body of about 4,870 undergraduate students and around 387 graduate students. This respected university offers both undergraduate and graduate programs, providing a diverse range of approximately 60 bachelor degrees and various minor programs. All courses are taught by experienced professors holding prestigious post-doctoral degrees. Previously known as Plattsburgh State Normal and Training School, it has since attracted students from over 70 countries. The university's diverse courses include music, nutrition, environmental studies, expeditionary studies, human development and family relations, biology, broadcast journalism, criminal justice, and medical technology. It also offers various internship opportunities at prominent organizations in the United States and abroad. In order to help international students improve their English language skills and prepare for full-time academic study, the State University of New York at Plattsburgh offers an English Bridge Program. Interested students must submit an application fee of $50, and international undergraduate and graduate students should expect to pay between $35,979.28 and $42,099.28 in tuition fees, respectively. The university also offers a range of scholarships for international students, varying from $2,000 to $1,000. According to the US News& World Report 2021 rankings, this university holds the 75th position in Regional Universities and has been ranked between 501-600th in the Times Higher Education ranking.

Name: Babson College
Overview: Established in 1919, Babson College is a prestigious private business institution located in Wellesley, Massachusetts. With four campuses in Wellesley, Boston, San Francisco, and Miami, the college offers a diverse learning experience to its students. The main residential campus in Wellesley boasts modern facilities including a student center, dining hall, library, gym, and art center. The Boston campus, situated on High Street, provides ample classroom space, event venues, and essential resources. It also houses a graduate center which offers career development programs. The San Francisco campus focuses on MBA programs, while the Miami campus in Florida offers MBA, MSBA, and CAM programs. Babson College caters to undergraduate students, offering a wide range of courses such as accounting & law, economics, entrepreneurship, finance, history & society, management, marketing, math & science, and operations and information management. Master's programs available at Babson College include full-time and part-time courses in business analytics, finance, and entrepreneurial leadership. The institution is known for its top-rated programs in business and management, applied and pure science, humanities, creative arts, and design, and MBA. The college boosts its students' skills and interests with over 100 student clubs and organizations on campus. From sports teams to community service groups, these clubs provide students with an array of opportunities to pursue their passions and hobbies. The tuition fees range from USD 54,600 to 89,550 per annum, while living expenses are approximately USD 13,788. Babson College houses 18 residence halls on campus, equipped with facilities such as Wi-fi, electricity, cleaning services, and more. The college also offers off-campus housing options. Babson College is proud of its faculty's research work, which includes projects, curriculum development, and case writing. The institution's career services focus on instilling an entrepreneurial mindset in students, preparing them for their future careers. With an impressive record of successful placements, Babson College ensures that its students have ample opportunities for employment upon graduation.

The academic programmes at this university are available to applicants who have successfully completed a minimum of 12 years of secondary education. For those interested in pursuing graduate programmes, a bachelor's degree or equivalent certification is required. This university also requires international students to provide their SAT or ACT scores in addition to meeting the standard academic requirements. Non-native English speakers must also obtain a satisfactory score on English proficiency tests such as TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE.

Name: Princeton University
Overview:
Princeton University, located in New Jersey, is a prestigious private research institution belonging to the Ivy League. Founded in 1746, it holds the distinction of being the fourth oldest higher education institution in the United States. With an impressively competitive admission rate of 6%, the university is home to an average of 5,267 undergraduate students, 2,946 graduate students, and 1,100 faculty members. It boasts of 42 departments offering a diverse range of degrees, including Bachelor of Arts (A.B.) and Bachelor of Science in Engineering (B.S.E.) with 37 concentrations to choose from. Students here can pursue fields like Anthropology, Molecular Biology, Economics, Politics, and more.

Spread over 600 acres, the Princeton University campus is situated in the heart of metropolitan New Jersey and accommodates 96% of its students. All first-year students are required to reside in residential colleges. The six residential colleges at Princeton University - Forbes, Rockefeller, First College, Mathey, Butler, and Whitman - are well-known for organizing various activities like freshman seminars, excursions, dances, movie nights, barbecues, and inter-college sports competitions.

With a comprehensive price tag of USD 77,690, the cost of attendance at Princeton University covers tuition, room charges, board rates, and miscellaneous expenses for undergraduate students. On the other hand, graduate students are charged a tuition fee of USD 56,470.

Princeton University takes a unique approach to financial aid - only need-based financial assistance is offered, with no merit-based scholarships available. However, international students are eligible for reduced tuition fees of USD 13,450 through financial aid.

The university boasts over 300 student organizations, 17 chaplaincies, and 37 sports clubs, providing a plethora of opportunities for extracurricular engagement. For students seeking support and empowerment, Princeton University offers various campus resources, such as The Pace Center for Civic Engagement, Davis International Center, and the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender (LGBT) Center.
Eligibility Overview:
In order to be eligible for enrollment in the desired courses at Princeton University, applicants must meet certain academic and English language proficiency requirements. These requirements include: 
- Academic Requirements: There is no minimum GPA requirement, but the average GPA of admitted students is 3.9 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants must also achieve a math score of 730-790 and a reading and writing score of 700-770 on the SAT, or a score of 32-35 on the ACT. Official transcripts and academic letters of recommendation (2 for undergraduate programs and 3 for graduate programs) must be submitted for consideration. Additionally, there is no minimum required score for the English language proficiency test, but those who do not meet the minimum requirement will be required to take an English placement test.
- English Requirements: Applicants must demonstrate proficiency in the English language, but there is no specific score required. This will be assessed through the English placement test administered by the university for those who do not meet the minimum requirement.

Princeton University offers a range of on-campus and off-campus accommodation options for its students. On-campus housing options include six residential colleges for undergraduates - Butler, Forbes, Mathey, Rockefeller, Whitman, and Wilson, along with eight hostels for postgraduate students. These accommodations offer amenities such as laundry, TV lounges, kitchens, and furnished rooms.

For those looking for housing options outside the campus, Princeton University's location as the only university in the city offers convenient access to various off-campus housing options. Students can rent apartments, typically shared by multiple occupants, with options of two, three, or more bedrooms. The average monthly cost of these apartments ranges from $1200 to $1600. These apartments come equipped with amenities like laundry, furnished rooms, kitchens, security, and various shared spaces such as a pool and a TV.

Name: Clayton State University
Overview:
Clayton State University, located in Morrow, Georgia, is a public institution that was founded in 1969. It is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commissions and the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. Spread across a 214-acre campus in Clayton County, South Metro Atlanta, the university is ranked 13th among the top universities in Atlanta. It offers 35 undergraduate, eight postgraduate, six associate, and 40 baccalaureate degrees through its College of Arts and Sciences, College of Business, College of Health, College of Information and Mathematical Sciences, and School of Graduate Studies. Some popular courses at the university include Arts, Humanities, Psychology, Nursing, Hospital Management, Business, Engineering, Paralegal, Health Sciences, Accounting, Finance, and Communications.
 
CSU has a 54% acceptance rate, and prospective students are invited to apply through the university's website. The university has a focus on workforce development, with two exceptional programs - PACE and EDGE - aimed at preparing students for successful careers. Additionally, CSU offers an online study abroad program and a dedicated program for veterans. 

For students looking for on-campus housing, CSU provides accommodation in Laker Hall and Laker Village. These residential halls offer fully furnished single occupancy rooms, as well as kitchen facilities, social spaces, Wi-Fi, dining areas, refrigerators, washing machines, dishwashers, lounges, study rooms, on-site shops, gaming zones, and recreational activities. 

With affordable tuition fees, CSU aims to make education accessible for all students. The undergraduate tuition fee is 6,312 USD, while the graduate tuition fee is 16,744 USD. International students can also benefit from various scholarships and financial aid opportunities.

The university of Bridgeport, situated in Bridgeport, Connecticut, USA, is an esteemed private institution that operates under the non-profit model. It was founded in 1927 and has been continuously accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education as well as the Connecticut Department of Higher Education Board of Governors.

The campus comprises of three colleges - namely, the College of Health Sciences, Engineering, Business and Education, and the College of Arts and Sciences. High in demand among students are undergraduate majors such as Business, Education, and Engineering, while graduate programs such as Acupuncture and Nutrition are also highly sought after. Other highly regarded doctorate programs offered by the university include Education, Naturopathic Medicine, and Chiropractic. Like most other institutions, the University of Bridgeport follows a semester-based academic calendar. 

Tuition fees at the University of Bridgeport come to approximately 35,000 USD. Room and boarding expenses are additional and add up to roughly 17,000 USD. However, the university also provides financial aid to most students, ranging from academic scholarships to need-based awards, with additional scholarship opportunities available for outstanding performance in academics, offering up to 20,000 USD. Overview:
Aurora University was founded in Aurora, Illinois in 1893 and has since established itself as a reputable educational institution. The university operates four campuses, with its main campus located in Illinois while its other three campuses are known as Orchard Center, George William College, and Woodstock Center. George William College boasts a selection of 16 bachelor's and master's programs, and also offers doctoral degrees in leadership in educational administration and leadership in curriculum and instruction. With over 50 majors and minors to choose from, the university caters to a diverse range of academic interests. Some popular courses include business administration, accounting, communication, finance, and nursing. 

Accommodation options are available to students through the university's six residential halls. These halls come equipped with modern amenities such as fitness rooms, laundry facilities, common areas, vending machines, and elevators. With around-the-clock security services, students can feel safe and secure in their co-ed, fully furnished rooms. 

Aurora University prides itself on providing students with a well-rounded college experience. This includes over 60 student-run organizations and clubs, offering opportunities for involvement in musical, literary, religious, social, and service-based activities. Students also have a say in campus governance through the various organizations and clubs. Additionally, students can participate in athletic teams, 22 intramural sports, and recreational activities, promoting a healthy and active lifestyle. 

Part-time employment opportunities are available for students on campus, and the university also offers excellent resources such as career services to aid students in their professional development. These services include career advising, resume and cover letter resources, interview assistance, and career-related resources. 

With a course fee of approximately $12,800 per semester and an average cost of living of $13,738 per year, Aurora University offers a quality education at an affordable price. To further assist students, the university provides financial aid options, including grants, loans, scholarships, and federal work-study programs. International students are also eligible for scholarships of up to $1
Eligibility Overview:
Here is a list of requirements for admission to our university. These guidelines are applicable to both undergraduate and graduate applicants.

1. Minimum GPA Requirement
To be eligible for admission, applicants must have a minimum grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale in their previous academic studies. This applies to students from all countries.

2. High School Diploma or Equivalent
Applicants must have completed their high school education or have an equivalent degree from a recognized institution. This diploma must be submitted with the admission application.

3. Entrance Exam
All undergraduate applicants are required to take an entrance exam. The results of this exam will be used in the selection process and will be taken into consideration along with the other requirements.

4. English Competency
For non-English speaking countries and all graduate applicants, results of an official English proficiency test must be submitted to the Office of Admission. The minimum requirements for admission are as follows:

Course Description:
Aurora University stands out as a prestigious institution for higher education, acknowledged worldwide. Its establishment dates back to 1893, making it one of the oldest universities. Located in Aurora, USA, it boasts a diverse community of 930 international students, promoting inclusivity and cultural diversity. The university is renowned for its exceptional quality of education and significant contributions to research.

Aurora University secure its place as the 6703rd top university in the world, according to Webometrics - World rankings. Its wide range of programs include bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees in various fields such as Business, Humanities, and Engineering. With three intakes available in January, September, and October, students have ample opportunities to enroll at the university. Depending on the program of study, bachelor's degrees take an average of four years, while master's degrees take one year to complete.

The university's yearly tuition fee of approximately $26,400 is a meager amount compared to the multitude of scholarships and grants available for students. These include prestigious scholarships like the USC Associates Scholarships for undergraduate Business Programs, Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship, You Are Welcome Here Scholarship for Bs in Kinesiology at Michigan State University, and Graduate Incentive Award for MS in Applied Economics.

Aurora University boasts an impressive campus, complete with state-of-the-art buildings, advanced research libraries, well-equipped laboratories, and other essential facilities for students and staff. The campus also boasts student clubs, centers, and comfortable hostels that cater to the students' diverse needs.

One of the significant advantages of studying at Aurora University for international students is the opportunity for post-study work in the USA. The university prioritizes mentorship programs that prepare students for a successful career and enable them to contribute positively to society.

To be admitted to Aurora University, students need to meet specific requirements. These include demonstrating proficiency in English by submitting IELTS or TOEFL scores, as well as submitting their standardised test scores like the GRE, SAT, or GMAT. Other requirements include letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, transcripts from previous schools or colleges, valid passports, and visas.

Name: Seattle Pacific University
Overview:
Seattle Pacific University, situated in Seattle, USA, offers a diverse range of undergraduate, postgraduate, certificate, and online degree programs. These programs encompass more than 120 bachelor's programs, 31 master's programs, 5 doctoral programs, and 8 certificate courses. With over 3,601 students, the university consists of a multicultural community, including 150+ international students from over 50 countries. As a requirement for admission, a minimum IELTS score of 6.5 overall is mandatory for prospective students.

The estimated cost of tuition, excluding additional expenses, is approximately INR 38,00,820 for international students. Seattle Pacific University provides a plethora of scholarships, work-study programs, and various grants to aid students in their education funding. Moreover, the university boasts an impressive track record, with 93% of alumni either securing employment or enrolling in graduate school within a year of completing their undergraduate degree. The average salary of these graduates within a year of graduation is $44,763.

In addition to academic excellence, the university also offers a dedicated Career Planning Service team, which assists students in building their resumes and finding employment opportunities, such as part-time jobs, summer jobs, or internships. At Seattle Pacific University, students are equipped with the necessary tools and support to excel in their education and achieve their career goals.
Eligibility Overview:
Listed below are the required English language proficiency scores for admission to our university. It is crucial to meet these requirements in order to be considered for acceptance.

- TOEFL internet-based: A minimum score of 79 is required.
- TOEFL paper-based: A minimum score of 550 is required.
- IELTS: A minimum overall band score of 6.5 is required.
- PTE Academic: A minimum score of 56 is required.
- EIKEN: A level of at least Pre-level 1 is required.
- Duolingo: A minimum score of 105 is required.

We value the potential of all applicants, regardless of their language background. That is why we have set these specific language proficiency standards

Seattle Pacific University is a globally renowned organization for advanced education and is recognized as one of the best institutions of higher learning in the world. It was established in the year 1891 and is situated in Seattle, USA. The university has 8 intakes each year in Fall (September), Winter (January), Spring (March), and their respective repeats. A significant factor that draws international students to Seattle Pacific University is the abundance of post-study work opportunities in the USA. They must also possess a valid passport and visa for applying for admission.

Name: Western New England University

The university boasts a beautiful 215-acre campus, attracting 3,825 students from 26 different countries, to create a diverse and enriching learning environment.

International and domestic students may have varying costs of attendance, depending on the program they choose. With five colleges to choose from, the university offers a total of 50 majors and 30 minors, ensuring that students can find the perfect fit for their academic interests.

For international applicants, a minimum IELTS score of 6 is required for undergraduate programs and 6.5 for postgraduate programs. To assist students in financing their education, Western New England University offers a variety of scholarships, work-study opportunities, and other funding options.

Moreover, the university has a dedicated Career Planning Service team, helping students build their resume and secure employment, whether it be after graduation, during their studies, or through internships and part-time jobs. With its comprehensive approach to education, Western New England University is a top choice for students seeking both academic excellence and career development.

Placement: The connection between Western New England University and its students, alumni, and employers is highly valued. The Kevin S. and Sandra E. Delbridge Career Center offers an array of resources and support to aid students and businesses alike in their search for career opportunities. A few of our esteemed partners include Clean Water Action, The Hangover Insurance Group, Monsoon Savings, ISO New England, Autism Care Partners, and more. Accommodation:
This section contains information regarding residence options available at Western New England University (WNE). On-campus living provides opportunities to foster lifelong connections and create memorable experiences with peers. WNE offers various types of housing options that cater to students' changing needs as they progress in their academic journey, ranging from traditional double occupancy halls to suites, flats, and townhouses. Graduate, law, pharmacy, and doctoral students also have the opportunity to continue living in Gateway Village Apartments, provided there is space available.

1. First-Year Students
Quad Halls
The Quad, consisting of Berkshire, Franklin, and Hampden Halls, serves as the primary residential option for first-year students. For freshmen interested in learning interest communities (LICs) or with specific housing requirements, Commonwealth Hall may also be available. Premium single rooms are offered on a limited basis, on a first-come, first-served basis. Each residence hall features a shared bathroom on each floor, a building-wide laundry facility, and a lounge area equipped with a TV, kitchenette, and recreational activities. The buildings are furnished with movable furnishings and tiled floors, with air conditioning available.

Windham Hall
Windham Hall offers a limited number of triple rooms for first-year students who prefer to live in groups of three. Each hallway has a common lounge area with a TV, and amenities such as laundry facilities, study areas, and recreational spaces are available for students to use. The carpeted rooms are furnished with movable pieces and are air-conditioned.

2. Sophomore Year
Commonwealth Hall
Second-year students can opt to live in Commonwealth Hall, which also houses sophomores, juniors, seniors, and transfer students. First-year students can request to reside in a Commonwealth LIC. Each corridor features a kitchenette, a laundry room, and semi-private restrooms for individual use. The central portion of the building consists of multipurpose lounges and a conference room, as well as academic classrooms and a computer lab.

LaRiviere Center
LaRiviere Center is a suite-style accommodation option for juniors, sophomores, and seniors. The building houses four suites, each with four double rooms, which can accommodate six to eight people. Each suite has two private bathrooms, a living area with couches, a table, and chairs, and built-in cabinets, along with a full-size refrigerator and countertop. A study room, recreational equipment, and laundry facilities are available for all residents of the floor. Common areas also feature additional seating and recreational options.

3. Junior & Senior Years
Gateway Village Apartments, Evergreen Village Townhouses, and Southwood Hall provide upper-class students with full living spaces to prepare for their post-graduation lives, complete with bedrooms, kitchens, living rooms, and bathrooms.

Gateway Village
Gateway Village offers apartment living for two to six students, primarily for juniors, seniors, and a limited number of sophomores, depending on availability. The apartments are configured as efficiency units, one to three-bedroom options, and feature a private bathroom and a furnished living room. Residents are responsible for the maintenance of their living space. Additional amenities include outdoor entertainment areas and communal laundry facilities. A section of the apartments is reserved for graduate students, and all units are air-conditioned.

Evergreen Village
Evergreen Village features two-story townhouse apartments with three bedrooms, allowing for a total of six residents. The townhouse units primarily house seniors and are equipped with a living room, kitchen, full bathroom, and half bathroom. The carpeted units are furnished with movable pieces, with residents being responsible for maintaining their living space. A multifunctional building within Evergreen Village houses study areas, recreation spaces, social areas, and washers and dryers. The building has air conditioning.

Southwood Hall
Southwood Hall is the newest residence hall and offers apartment-style living for four students. Each apartment features a bathroom, kitchen, living room, and two double or four single-occupancy bedrooms. The tiled units are equipped with freestanding furniture, and the residents are responsible for maintaining their living space. An ample first-floor lounge, recreational area, and laundry facilities are also available. Most junior and senior residents live in Southwood Hall.

Graduate Housing
Graduate students have the option to reside in Gateway Village Apartments, which can accommodate one to three occupants per apartment. Each resident has a separate bedroom within the shared living space. The cost of residency covers utilities, including heat, hot water, and electricity, as well as wireless internet service.

(Note: Altogether, these residence options provide graduate, law, pharmacy, and doctoral students with the best possible living arrangements on campus. Visit our website for more information on the various housing areas: https://www1.wne.edu/residence-life/housing/residence-areas.cfm.)
Course Description: Western New England University stands out as a prestigious institution for higher education all over the world, with its establishment dating back to the year 1919. The university secures a spot of #2300 out of the top universities worldwide, according to Webometrics rankings. Offering a diverse range of undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs in a myriad of disciplines, including business, humanities, and engineering, Western New England University provides opportunities for around 7 undergraduate programs and 1 postgraduate program per academic year. Fall (August), Spring (January), and Summer (May) are the three principal intakes for the university. With its expansive campus, Western New England University boasts of remarkable facilities including state-of-the-art buildings, well-resourced research libraries, advanced laboratory spaces, numerous student-centred clubs and organizations, and comfortable on-campus accommodations for both students and staff members. The university is also famous for its career mentoring programs that aid students in reaching their life goals and positively impacting the society. International students are especially attracted to Western New England University due to the post-study work opportunities available in the USA. In terms of admission, the university requires test scores such as IELTS and TOEFL for English proficiency and standardized tests like GRE, SAT, and GMAT, and a submission of letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statement of purpose, academic transcripts, and valid passport and visa.

Name: University of the Incarnate Word
Overview: The University of the Incarnate Word is a private and Catholic institution, offering 20 graduate and 90 undergraduate programs as well as doctoral degrees. It was founded in 1881 by the "Sisters of Charity of the Incarnate Word" and is located in San Antonio, Texas. Its campus spans 154 acres and is home to over 5,827 students, with the option for distance learning through online programs. The university has a faculty-student ratio of 11:1 and requires GMAT or GRE scores for admissions, along with English language proficiency. Its main areas of study include business, music therapy, criminal justice, nursing, medicine, and psychology, among others. The campus features a pharmacy school, research labs, and writing and learning centers. It also boasts a strong sports program with 23 teams for various sports. Graduates of the university have a high chance of gaining employment at multinational companies. The University of the Incarnate Word offers special discounts to its alumni for suites, hotels, and facilities. The total cost of living for one year is approximately $49,000 and over 94% of students receive financial aid and scholarships. Academic scholarships range from $5,000 to $20,000 for students maintaining a GPA of 3.0.

Name: University of California - Berkeley Campus
Overview: The University of California - Berkeley Campus, located in Berkeley, USA, offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various fields of study. Additionally, it provides online degree programs for distance education students. It is renowned for its engineering programs and is home to multiple schools and departments. The main campus is situated in Berkeley, with over ten undergraduate programs and 20 postgraduate programs. The university's cost of attendance may vary for international and domestic students based on their chosen course. On an average, international students can expect to pay around 57,64,976 excluding miscellaneous expenditure towards tuition and fees. However, the university offers various scholarships, work-study options, and other forms of financial assistance to its students. Furthermore, UC Berkeley has a dedicated Career Planning Service team that assists students with building their resumes and finding job opportunities, including part-time jobs, summer jobs, internships, or full-time positions after graduation. For a more in-depth look at the University of California - Berkeley Campus, visit Leap Scholar and discover the perfect course to fulfill your academic and career goals. In terms of rankings, UC Berkeley excels in multiple categories, including first in chemistry and environment/ecology, third in physics and space science, fourth in economics and business, fifth in biology and biochemistry, and seventh in engineering and the arts and humanities.
Eligibility Overview:
Academic Criteria: For undergraduate admissions, a minimum average of 70% is required, with no individual marks falling below 60%, in both X and XII state board or CBSE examinations. As for postgraduate programs, applicants must submit their scores for standardized tests such as GMAT, GRE Subject Test, GRE General, or MCAT. On average, applicants have scored 1415 out of 1600 on the SAT scale at UC Berkeley. Along with these, academic transcripts indicating a GPA of 3.4 or above must be provided.

English Language Requirements: Meeting the English proficiency requirement is crucial for admission. The university accepts scores from tests such as TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE. In addition, a minimum GPA of 3.4 is expected in English language courses during previous studies. Alternatively, applicants who have completed their high school in an English medium school can also meet this requirement.

Name: University of Louisiana
Overview: The University of Louisiana, located in Lafayette, USA, offers a range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs to both domestic and international students. For distance education students, the university also provides online degree programs. With its main campus situated in Lafayette, the university boasts a diverse academic environment and opportunities for students. The cost of attendance may vary for different courses, and international students can expect to pay an estimated average of INR 2854808, which covers tuition and fees, excluding additional expenses. Scholarships, work-study programs, and other forms of financial assistance are available to enrolled students. Furthermore, the university's Career Planning Service team aids students in developing their CV and finding suitable employment opportunities, whether it be after graduation, part-time work, summer jobs, or internships.
Eligibility Overview:
The University of Louisiana offers a wide range of undergraduate programs including Business, Computer Sciences, Agriculture Business, Biology, Arts, and Psychology. In order to apply for admission, students must meet the following requirements: submit original transcripts, provide proof of high school completion or diploma, have a minimum GPA of 2.35, and submit scores for either the ACT (code 1598) or SAT (code 6482). Additionally, students must also provide proof of immunization and meet the required score on an English proficiency exam.

The University of Louisiana also offers graduate degree programs in over 20 fields such as Business, Biology, Music, Criminal Justice, Nursing, and Psychology. Interested students can contact gradadmissions@ulm.edu for more information. The admission requirements for graduate programs at ULM include submitting a complete ULM proposal, holding a bachelor's degree from a reputable institution, providing original transcripts and GRE/GMAT scores, having a minimum GPA of 2.75, and submitting a statement of financial position and valid visa.

International students whose first language is not English must also submit scores from an English proficiency test. This requirement is waived for students who speak English as a first language, score 100 on the TOEFL IBT, 600 on the TOEFL PBT, 250 on the TOEFL CBT, or 7.0 on the IELTS, or have completed a four-year college diploma in the United States.
