Eligibility Overview:
Here are the requirements for admission to our university:

1. A score of at least 500 on the paper-based or 61 on the internet-based (iBT) Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) taken within the past two years is necessary for admission. However, students applying for post-baccalaureate programs must have a minimum score of 550 on the paper-based exam or 79 on the iBT.

2. Non-native English speakers must provide documentation showing successful completion of freshman-level English writing at a regionally accredited American college or university within the United States, with an overall acceptable GPA. If it has been an extended period of time since the student took English classes or has returned to school, they may still be required to take the TOEFL.

3. A good verbal score on the ACT or SAT taken within the last two years is also accepted. An ACT score of 18 or an SAT score of 430 (until 3/15/16) or 25 (effective 3/16/16) is necessary for consideration.

4. International students must provide an official and satisfactory result from the International English Language Testing Service (IELTS) within the past two years. A minimum score of 5.5 on the IELTS is required, with sub-scores of 5.0 or better in reading and writing. For post-baccalaureate programs, a score of 6.5 or above is necessary.

5. Students who have completed the American English Language Program (AELP) at our university with an average grade of 80% or higher in each class are also eligible for consideration.

Name: East Carolina University
Overview:
East Carolina University (ECU) is a public university established in 1907. Located in Greenville, North Carolina, it boasts a spacious campus of 1600 acres. ECU is ranked #28 among the Best Medical Schools by US News and World Report and has an acceptance rate of 79%. The university offers a variety of programs including undergraduate courses, master's programs, 15 doctoral programs, 50 graduate certificates, and 6 first-professional programs, making it an optimal choice for aspiring students. In addition, ECU is one of the top 5% of business schools worldwide to receive accreditation from AACSB, a prestigious recognition. The flexibility of the university is evident in its provision of online courses in diverse fields such as business, healthcare, education, technology, and more.

The university provides on-campus accommodation to its students, with residence life being taken care of by the Division of Student Affairs. There are 15 different residence halls and the College Hill Suites, exclusively for upper-division students. Equipped with essential amenities like bunkable beds, air conditioning, and a small fridge, the residence halls offer a comfortable living experience. ECU is committed to maintaining a tobacco-free environment on campus.

ECU has a bustling student life with over 500 student organizations that cater to different interests such as tourism, hospitality, and sports management. These organizations provide ample opportunities for students to engage in extracurricular activities and enhance their skills. Adventure trips, fitness classes, and sports events are also organized for students to participate in and develop healthy habits.

The total fees, including tuition, room and board, books and supplies, personal expenses, transportation, and loan fees, amount to $39,592 for undergraduate programs and $34,758 for graduate programs. However, the university offers various scholarships to ease the financial burden on students, such as the Gamma Iota Sigma Scholarship, The Daniel Gluckman Scholarship, and The Page Family Scholarship. With its top-notch education and wide range of opportunities, ECU is a prime choice for students seeking a comprehensive university experience.
Eligibility Overview:
Eligibility for admission as a freshman requires successful completion of the following courses at the time of high school graduation:
- Four English courses with emphasis on grammar, composition, and literature. 
- Algebra I, Geometry, Algebra II, and a higher level mathematics course that has Algebra II as a prerequisite. 
- Three courses in natural sciences, including one in a living/biological science, a physical science, and a laboratory science. 
- Two courses in social studies, with one focused on US history. 
- Two courses in a foreign language, both in the same language (e.g. Spanish 1 & 2). American Sign Language and Latin are accepted at ECU. 

It is recommended to take additional courses in foreign language, mathematics, and natural sciences during the senior year to better prepare for the freshman curriculum.

If you do not meet the above minimum requirements, please refer to the Transfer Admission Guidelines for alternative admission options. Graduates from Cooperative Innovative High Schools (Early Colleges) should also review the Supplemental Notices for relevant information on the application process.

Students who reside on campus have a higher rate of returning for their next year of school and also maintain a higher GPA than students who live off campus during their first year. Additionally, they will be mandated to purchase a Gold 450 meal plan (or a greater plan) for each semester they are enrolled while living at home. This will allow them to better engage with the school and other freshmen. For more details, please visit the campus living website - https://campusliving.ecu.edu/.

Name: SUNY Polytechnic Institute - Albany
Overview: SUNY Polytechnic Institute, also known as State University of New York, was established in 1966 and is a public university with campuses located in New York, Marcy, and Albany. As a vital part of the SUNY system, it is accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education. Previously part of the University of Albany in 2003, the Albany campus offers a variety of programs for students. SUNY Polytechnic Institute holds the distinction of being the first amongst five Polytechnic institutions to offer educational programs in nanotechnology. In addition to being recognized by the Board of Regents of the State of New York, all academic programs at this institution are certified by the State of Education Department. Offering a diverse range of degree programs, the college has five separate colleges and provides 25 bachelor’s degrees, 18 graduate, and 5 doctoral degrees. Apart from students from across the United States, SUNY Polytechnic Institute also attracts international students from 20 other countries. The institution boasts programs in business, communication and behavioral sciences, computer science, engineering, arts and sciences, nursing, as well as nanoscale engineering and nanoscale science. With a focus on providing a rich classroom experience, SUNY Polytechnic Institute also provides students with access to internships and employment opportunities through its partnerships with various corporate organizations located on-site at its campuses. In addition, the Albany campus is home to a pilot-scale semiconductor research and development center. Students, staff, and faculty from different campuses also conduct research in areas such as nanoscale science and engineering, industrialization efforts and development, as well as other extensive research efforts. The institution maintains a student-to-faculty ratio of 13:1 and an average class size of 18, allowing for highly interactive sessions between students and esteemed faculty members. SUNY Polytechnic Institute follows a moderately selective admission procedure with an acceptance rate of approximately 69%. According to the QS-World University Rankings, the institution ranks between 751-800.

Placement:
Are you a SUNY Poly student looking to gain valuable experience through an internship? Whether it's for course credit, pay, or simply to broaden your skills and network, we have several options available for you. Here is some information on internships and how we can assist you in finding and succeeding in one.

Types of Internships
There are several types of internships offered at SUNY Poly. These include credit-bearing, non-credit, paid, unpaid, online, and traditional on-site internships.
• Credit-bearing internships: These internships allow you to earn academic credit for your experience. By adding the internship to your academic transcript, you can validate the significance of the experience.
• Non-credit internships: These internships do not provide academic credit but are still valuable for gaining experience and networking.
• Paid internships: These internships provide financial compensation for your work.
• Unpaid internships: Though these internships do not offer monetary compensation, they can still be beneficial for your skill development and career prospects.
• Online internships: These internships are completed remotely, allowing you to gain experience without being on-site.
• On-site internships: These internships require you to work at a job site to complete your internship.

Finding an Internship
To find an internship, you can use our Handshake system to search and apply for opportunities. You can also find internships on your own, by reaching out to organizations and companies that interest you.

Credit-bearing Internship Process
If you are interested in earning credit for your internship, here is the process you need to follow:
• Choose a faculty member from your program to act as your internship course instructor.
• Collaborate with your instructor to complete the Internship Learning Contract. This document outlines the academic significance of your work and serves as your course curriculum.
• Determine the frequency of interaction with your instructor and the academic coursework required for the credits you are seeking.
• Keep your instructor and the Office of Career Services informed of any changes in your internship status.
• Your site supervisor will also provide guidance on your responsibilities as an intern.

Evaluating Your Internship
To receive a grade for your internship course, you will need to submit three documents:
• Internship Learning Contract: This document outlines the academic significance of your internship and will be completed with your instructor.
• Site Supervisor Questionnaire: Your internship site supervisor will fill out this questionnaire to evaluate your performance at the job site.
• Student Internship Employer Evaluation: You will also be evaluated by your employer through this form.
• Student Internship Evaluation: To provide your own insights on the value of your internship experience, you will also need to complete this evaluation.

Parker Dewey: Non-credit, Paid Microinternships
If you are interested in project-based work experiences, consider applying for a microinternship through our collaboration site launchpad with Parker Dewey. These paid, short-term opportunities

Name: University of North Carolina Wilmington
Overview: The University of North Carolina Wilmington, situated in Wilmington, USA, is an eminent university offering a diverse range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs. The university also provides online courses for students pursuing distance education. Its main campus is located in Wilmington, offering students a vibrant and enriching academic experience. The estimated average cost of attendance for both international and domestic students may vary, depending on the chosen course. For international students, the estimated average tuition fee, excluding miscellaneous expenses, is approximately INR 2606507. The university offers various scholarships and work-study options to its students, along with other funding opportunities. Additionally, the university has a dedicated Career Planning Service team that assists students in creating an impressive CV and finding suitable job opportunities, be it upon graduation or during their academic journey, like part-time jobs, summer jobs, or internships.
Eligibility Overview:
UNCW accepts students from a wide range of academic backgrounds. As a result, our admissions process places emphasis on various factors that we believe contribute to a student's potential for academic success. Some of these factors include grade point average (GPA), test scores, extracurricular activities, and personal statements.

For admitted seniors, the middle 50% of weighted GPA falls between 3.80 and 4.43. This means that the majority of our students have consistently achieved A or B grades, with very few or no C grades, and no D or F grades. It is important to note that the UNC System's minimum GPA requirement is 2.5, but it is highly unlikely that a GPA within this range will be considered for admission at UNCW.

It is worth mentioning that we do not recalculate GPAs submitted by applicants. However, we do evaluate them in the context of the grading scheme used by their high school. This information is readily available to your regional counselor, who plays a crucial role in your admissions process. Even if your high school does not assign a GPA, your transcript must include a version of your GPA for us to consider you for admission.

Name: University of San Francisco
Overview: Founded in 1855, the prestigious University of San Francisco is a renowned private Jesuit institution situated in the lively city of San Francisco, California, USA. Fully accredited by the WASC Senior College and University Commission, the university boasts a diverse student population of over 10,636 individuals, who pursue degrees in fields such as Nursing, Marketing Management, Business Administration and Management, and Finance. Within its three esteemed colleges and schools - the School of Management, College of Arts and Sciences, and School of Nursing and Health Professions - the University of San Francisco offers a robust selection of more than 40 majors and 70 minors. Additionally, students can also take advantage of its vast array of over 60 doctoral, master's, and credential programs, which include highly coveted degrees such as M.B.A and Executive Business Administration (EMBA). Furthermore, the university boasts two notable online programs and 34 graduate certificates, providing students with unparalleled flexibility and opportunities for career advancement. Seeking to broaden students' horizons and global perspectives, the university also offers study abroad options in over 40 countries. Among its top courses are M.Sc. in Data Science, M.Sc. in Computer Science, E.M.B.A, M.Sc. in Information Systems, and M.B.A in Organizational Development. Not only does the University of San Francisco provide a top-tier education, but it also facilitates outstanding job prospects upon graduation, with impressive placement opportunities. Moreover, the university offers various scholarships and financial aid for students, including the School of Management International Merit Scholarship, Academic Merit Scholarship Awards, and Athletic Scholarships, making education accessible and affordable for all who seek it.
Eligibility Overview:
The criteria for enrollment vary for international candidates aspiring to attend USF. The following regulations must be met prior to applying:

Requirements in Academia
Prospective undergraduate students must possess a high school diploma, whereas those applying for graduate courses should hold a bachelor's degree. The following criteria must be met:

Applicants must have completed four years of English study in high school.
Mathematics study for a period of three years (Engineering students require completion of precalculus)
Three years of Social Science study.
Two years of laboratory science and two years of a foreign language (Nursing applicants must have taken Physics or Biology in their senior years).

Standardized Exams that Fulfill Requirements
The GRE/GMAT is accepted for graduate and postgraduate courses.
For undergraduate courses, the SAT/ACT is accepted for admission.

English Proficiency
Undergraduate and graduate applicants must meet the following minimum English language proficiency criteria:

TOEFL IBT 80, with a minimum of 65.
For master's students, a TOEFL PBT 580 is required.
A minimum of 6.5 bands on the IELTS Academic, with a mandatory 6 bands.
A PTE Academic score of 62 for master's enrollment.
A 95 on the 105th Duolingo English Test.

Name: Silicon Valley Intensive English Program at San Mateo Colleges
Overview:
Silicon Valley Intensive English Program at San Mateo Colleges is a premier English language course designed for students who desire to acquire proficiency in the language for college enrollment. The institute is situated in the bustling city of Redwood City, California in the United States. After successfully completing the SVIEP Level 4, students have the opportunity to secure admissions at the esteemed San Mateo Colleges of Silicon Valley - namely Skyline College, College of San Mateo, and Cañada College. SVIEP also offers various workshops and events to assist students with their transition into college. One of the notable features of this program is that it does not require TOEFL or IELTS scores for admissions and students can take these tests upon arrival. The program also accepts EIKEN scores below 2A. With 10 admission dates and multiple modules, students have a flexible study schedule to suit their individual needs. 

SVIEP provides 15 to 20 hours of comprehensive instruction per week which covers all aspects of the English language including reading, speaking, grammar, writing, and American culture. The course is divided into four levels - ESL Level 1 for High Beginner, ESL Level 2 for Low-Intermediate, ESL Level 3 for Intermediate, and ESL Level 4 for Advanced learners. 

The fees for Silicon Valley Intensive English Program at San Mateo Colleges vary according to the course duration. A full-time 4-week course costs $900 while a part-time course costs $500. Similarly, the fees for an 8-week full-time course is $1695 and for part-time, it is $900. Any additional costs incurred by accompanying dependents of the applicant would be charged separately. In addition to its traditional on-campus learning, SVIEP also offers virtual courses. The Online SVIEP program costs $900 for 4 weeks and $1695 for 8 weeks. For students in need of accommodation, the institute provides information on private or independently owned housing options.
Eligibility Overview:
As per federal regulations, the Silicon Valley Intensive English Program (SVIEP) has authorization to accept non-immigrant students under the F-1 visa category. Meeting the entrance criteria of the Silicon Valley Intensive English Program is crucial for obtaining F-1 student status in the United States. By following the guidelines mentioned below, you can fulfill the requirements set by the US Department of Homeland Security for obtaining a SEVIS Form I-20 Certificate of Eligibility for Non-immigrant Student. This form enables you to apply for an F-1 Student Visa at a US Embassy and enter the country as an F-1 student.

Placement:
The following information pertains to internships and employment opportunities for students at the university. These opportunities are designed to provide students with hands-on experience in their respective fields. It is important for students to familiarize themselves with the guidelines and requirements outlined below in order to make the most out of these opportunities.

Internships are an integral part of the university experience and offer a unique chance for students to gain practical skills and knowledge. As such, all students interested in pursuing a for-credit internship must have a completed Student Placement Agreement on file with the Career Center by the fifth day of the semester. Failure to do so may result in administrative dismissal from the internship course. To assist students, the Career Center has provided a range of resources including a comprehensive Internship Handbook, Summer Internship Guidance, and Frequently Asked Questions. Students are also required to have a completed Host Site Agreement on file with the Career Center before beginning their internship. A step-by-step guide is available for students to complete this agreement, along with an Incident Form should any issues arise during the internship.

As a potential hosting site for an intern, your organization can play a crucial role in students' professional development. By providing a learning environment and meaningful tasks, employers have the opportunity to shape the future workforce. To host an intern, you must have a completed Host Site Agreement on file with the Career Center. Once submitted, the Career Center will review and approve the agreement, thus enabling the intern to begin their placement.

To assist students in finding internships, the university has established partnerships with several organizations. These include Handshake, Indiana INTERNnet, Internships.com, LinkedIn, Parker Dewey, Disney College Program, and various Internship Scholarship Programs. Handshake provides students with access to job postings, career coaching, and assistance in creating a resume and cover letter. Indiana INTERNnet offers micro-internships, which involve short-term, project-based assignments to help students gain experience and build their professional network. Internship.com is another useful resource for students to find internship opportunities. Additionally, LinkedIn can provide students with networking and career opportunities, while Parker Dewey offers a unique chance to gain experience and create a professional portfolio. The Disney College Program is open to all majors and provides students with the opportunity to network with executives, live in protected housing, and have unlimited access to Disney parks. Lastly, the university offers a range of internship scholarship programs with specific requirements to help students gain valuable experiences and explore potential career paths.

For students seeking employment opportunities, the university is proud to have companies such as Amazon, Apple, Barclays, Disney, PepsiCo, and Coca-Cola recruit from our student body. Other notable employers include Rolls Royce, Chicago Cubs, FedEx, Hershey, NCAA, Toyota, Southwest Airlines, Infosys, Chicago Police, Seattle Mariners, and Nestle. By preparing students for the workforce and providing them with access to top employers, the university is committed to helping our students succeed in their chosen fields.
Accommodation:
Indiana State University is committed to ensuring that all students and employees, regardless of disabilities, have equal opportunities to participate in and benefit from University programs and activities. This includes providing reasonable accommodations, academic adjustments, and policy or procedure changes to individuals with disabilities, as long as these changes do not fundamentally alter the nature of the program or activity. Accommodations will be implemented in a timely manner, tailored to each individual's needs, and determined through an interactive process between the individual and a designated University official. Indiana State University is also committed to promoting a campus environment that is barrier-free, both physically and mentally. Our goal is to make all University websites accessible to individuals with disabilities.

If you require an accommodation, adjustment, or modification, it is important to disclose your disability and provide documentation from a licensed professional explaining how the disability impairs your ability to participate in University activities or services. Medical records will remain confidential, in accordance with legal requirements and University policy.

For more information on our Americans with Disabilities Policy, please visit: https://www.indstate.edu/policy-library/americans-disabilities-policy.

Name: University of Virginia
Overview: The University of Virginia, founded in 1819, is a renowned public research institution located in Charlottesville, Virginia. Spanning across a vast area of 1,682 acres, it boasts a satellite campus in Southwest Virginia at Wise and has been ranked 26th nationally. The University comprises 12 highly esteemed schools and research centers, offering a diverse range of 121 undergraduate majors, 69 postgraduate degrees, and 55 Doctoral programs. A few of the popular majors at UVA include Liberal Arts, Humanities, Business, Economics, Health Sciences, International Relations, and Psychology. Along with these, the College of Arts and Sciences is renowned for its exceptional programs in music, theatre, art, dance, and creative writing, while the School of Architecture excels in Urban Planning and Environmental Design. UVA's prestigious law school ranks among the top 10 in the country. With an acceptance rate of only 26%, admissions at UVA are highly competitive. Prospective undergraduate students can apply through the Common Application, whereas for postgraduate degrees, they must access the specific program page, each with an application fee of $70 and $85, respectively. The university requires applicants to submit their academic transcripts, along with other program-specific documents and scores of English Language Proficiency tests, SAT, ACT, etc. The tuition fees for domestic students at UVA amount to approximately $17,891 per year, while for international students, it ranges from $50,000 to $62,000 annually. UVA doesn't offer scholarships, but it does provide need-based loans worth $7,000 per year for international students, along with work-study facilities. On-campus housing is available in three residential colleges: Brown Residential College, International Residential College, and Hereford Residential College. These colleges offer single, double, and triple occupancy rooms, and all first-year students must reside on campus. With over 800 clubs and secret societies, 17 sports fields and grounds, and a variety of recreational activities, such as hiking expeditions on the Appalachian Trail, students at UVA are spoilt for choice. With an impressive 95% graduation rate, UVA graduates are sought after by top companies, with an average annual salary of $64,000.

Name: Illinois State University
Overview: Founded in 1857, Illinois State University is a prestigious public research university and one of the oldest institutions in Illinois. Ranked as the 91st best public national university by U.S. News and World Report, Illinois State University was initially established as a teacher training school known as Illinois State Normal University before changing its name to Illinois State University in 1964. With a strong commitment to providing quality education, this university has an annual enrollment of over 20,000 students, with an impressive 78% receiving financial assistance. Additionally, Illinois State University boasts a prime location in one of the top 40 college towns in America, offering a high standard of living for its students. Comprising of seven academic colleges, this university offers a diverse range of 165 undergraduate degrees, 10 doctoral degrees, more than 90 master's degrees, and various interdisciplinary programs. Popular majors at ISU include business, marketing, management, and education. For non-resident students, the average cost of attendance for on-campus housing is $43,377, and for off-campus housing is $43,115. With its excellent academic reputation, Illinois State University is a popular choice for students seeking a well-rounded education.
Eligibility Overview:
For prospective international undergraduate students, proof of high school grade point average (GPA) transcripts within the range of 3.20 to 3.90 is a mandatory requirement. Similarly, international postgraduate students need to have completed their undergraduate studies with a minimum GPA of 2.8 out of a possible 4.0, considering their last 60 credit hours. In addition, all international applicants must demonstrate proficiency in the English language.

As part of the application process for undergraduates, international students are expected to provide academic transcripts with a GPA between 3.20 and 3.90. For graduate students, a GPA of at least 2.8 in the final 60 credit hours of their undergraduate coursework is required. It is mandatory for all international applicants to prove their fluency in the English language.

Sofia University is a highly prestigious institution for higher education worldwide, having been established in 1975. One of the striking features of the university is its sprawling campus, which comprises modern structures, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratories, centers, clubs, dormitories, and other facilities for students and faculty. It's worth noting that as a bonus to international students, the university also equips them to excel in their careers and make a positive impact on society, in line with their goals and dreams. As far as admissions are concerned, the university mandates proficiency in English, demonstrated through IELTS or TOEFL scores, and standardised test scores like GRE, SAT, GMAT, etc. Furthermore, students must furnish letters of recommendation, relevant work experience certificates, statements of purpose, academic transcripts, and valid passports and visas to gain admission at Sofia University.

Name: University of Missouri
Overview: The University of Missouri is a renowned public research university located in Columbia, Missouri. Founded in 1839, it holds the distinction of being the first public university in the west of the Mississippi River. The institution takes immense pride in its motto of promoting the well-being of all individuals. It strives to shape students as compassionate, knowledgeable, and responsible citizens of the global community. The university is divided into 14 colleges, each specializing in diverse fields of study such as Agriculture, Arts, Business, Education, Engineering, Health Professions, Environmental Sciences, Journalism, Medicines, Law, Veterinary Medicines, and Nursing. The Honors College and Graduate School also offer top-quality academic programs to students. With a high acceptance rate of 81%, the university provides over 400 graduate, undergraduate, and doctorate degrees. It has gained immense popularity among students seeking diverse areas of study. The university boasts highly ranked programs in Engineering, Business, Education, Law, and Medicine, with notable alumni such as Tennessee Williams and Sheryl Crow. The annual cost of tuition and accommodation may amount to around $39K. However, the university offers generous funding through scholarships and grants, which can reduce the cost to approximately $30K. Spread across a sprawling campus of 1,262 acres, the University of Missouri features a stunning botanical garden with more than 40,000 plants. The nurturing environment on campus fosters students' all-round growth, ensuring a promising future. The university offers a wide range of facilities, including residence halls, libraries, cultural centers, recreation halls, athletic centers, conference halls, and a vast alumni network. It provides excellent placement opportunities for its graduating batch.
Eligibility Overview: In order to be considered for admission, students must meet the specified eligibility criteria. These include having a minimum GPA of 2.5 or 3.5 on a 4.0 or 5.0 scale respectively, or an average grade of 80 or 8 (on a 100 and 10-point scale), or achieving C or higher in at least five IGCSE subjects and three A-level certificates. Additionally, students must fulfill the English language proficiency requirements by providing acceptable scores from an approved language proficiency test. It is imperative that applicants meet these criteria for admission consideration to this university.

After commencement, a significant number of graduates select gainful employment, while others secure fellowship appointments. For recent residential MHA alumni in the United States, typical fellowship salaries typically range from $45,000 to $70,000 annually, though this figure may fluctuate depending on factors such as geographic location, organizational size, and level of responsibilities.
Accommodation:
The university offers safe and comfortable on-campus accommodation to students, providing them with a conducive environment to study, form friendships and create lasting memories. The accommodation options available at the university are listed below:

Bluford Hall: Named after renowned journalist, publisher and civil rights advocate Lucile Bluford, this residence hall pays tribute to her legacy. Bluford Hall is a mixed-gender hallway, with some rooms specially designed for students with disabilities.

Brooks Hall: This hallway is dedicated to George C. Brooks, the first African-American administrator at the University of Missouri. It houses both men and women and has ADA-compliant rooms.

Center Hall: Exclusively for female students in the 2019-20 academic year, Center Hall is named after one of the university's core principles. Some rooms in this hallway are ADA-accessible.

College Avenue Hall: This hallway is open to both men and women and has a few ADA-compliant rooms.

Defoe-Graham Hall: Located near MizzouRec, Defoe-Graham Hall is home to both male and female students and has ADA-accessible rooms.

Discovery Hall: Named after one of the university's core values, Discovery Hall accommodates both men and women. A few rooms in this hallway are ADA-compliant.

Dogwood Hall: This hallway is named after the state tree of Missouri and houses both men and women. Some rooms are ADA-accessible.

Excellence Hall: With its name reflecting one of the university's values, Excellence Hall is home to both men and women. A few rooms are ADA-compliant.

Galena Hall: Named after the state mineral of Missouri, Galena Hall accommodates both men and women, with some ADA-accessible rooms.

Gateway Hall: This hallway pays tribute to the University of Missouri's historical significance as the first public university west of the Mississippi River. Both men and women reside here, with some ADA-accessible rooms.

Gillett Hall: Named after the university's first female graduate, Eva Johnston, Gillett Hall is home to both men and women, with some ADA-compliant rooms.

Hatch Hall: This hallway is named after William Hatch, a former US president who sponsored the Hatch Act of 1887, establishing Agricultural Experiment Stations nationwide. It houses both men and women, with some ADA-accessible rooms.

Hawthorn Hall: Named after the state flower of Missouri, this hallway has a few ADA-compliant rooms and accommodates both men and women.

Hudson Hall: Named after the university's third president, William Hudson, this hallway has some ADA-accessible rooms and is home to both men and women.

Johnston Hall: Dedicated to Professor Eva Johnston, MU's first female student dean, this hallway is exclusively reserved for women and has a few ADA-compliant rooms.

Mark Twain Hall: Consisting of students from the Honors College, this hallway is named after the famed Missouri author and accommodates both men and women, with some ADA-accessible rooms.

McDavid Hall: Honoring former Board of Curators member Frank Mitchell McDavid, this hallway is open to both men and women, with ADA-accessible rooms.

North Hall: With a few ADA-compliant rooms, North Hall is home to both men and women.

Schurz Hall: This hallway is named after Carl Schurz, a former Missouri senator and US secretary of the interior, and accommodates both men and women, with some ADA-accessible rooms.

South Hall: Open to both men and women, South Hall has a few ADA-compliant rooms.

Tara Apartments: These apartments cater to the needs of students and their families, offering a variety of floor plans. Situated in a peaceful location, they are only a short walk from the campus hub.

Wolpers Hall: Named after former Board of Curators leader John Wolpers, this hallway is conveniently located across from the MU Student Center and MizzouRec. It houses both men and women, with some ADA-accessible rooms.

For any general inquiries, please visit the university's housing website.

Name: New York University
Overview:
New York University, established in 1831, is a prestigious institution in the United States. It offers a wide range of courses through its 19 schools and colleges that are divided into ten undergraduate and 15 graduate schools. Living in the residence halls is vital for a student's academic growth as it combines living and learning. Some of the halls available are Clark Street, Othmer hall, Brittany Hall, Founder's hall, and more in Brooklyn and Manhattan.
On-campus housing promotes a community-focused environment. The residential experience is significant for students in their academic pursuits. Residents gain a sense of belonging and the opportunity to develop meaningful relationships. Students are responsible for maintaining their living spaces with the help of their Resident Advisors and support staff.
When it comes to off-campus accommodation, finding an apartment in New York City can be a challenging task. Whether you're a current NYU housing resident, relocating from abroad, or looking for a change, navigating the apartment hunting process can be confusing. While the university does not offer off-campus housing, the Center for Student Life provides helpful resources to aid in the search process. It is divided into ten essential steps which include finding a roommate, setting up a budget, considering location, transportation, apartment requirements, searching online and in-person, utilizing brokers and lease guarantors, understanding the rental process, and assistance with moving, storage, and furniture.
NYU is committed to providing students with suitable accommodation options, whether on or off-campus, to ensure a comfortable living and learning experience.

The sprawling NYU campus features state-of-the-art buildings, research libraries, laboratory spaces, centers, clubs, hostels, and other facilities, providing a conducive environment for learning and growth. Name: University of Northern Iowa
Overview:
The University of Northern Iowa is situated in Cedar Falls, Iowa. It was established in 1876 and is recognized for providing quality education at an affordable price. In fact, it has been ranked 7th on Kiplinger's Personal Finance list of the Top 25 universities and colleges in the United States under a budget of $30,000. This prestigious university has also been included in the "Top 100 Values in Public Schools" in the country. The campus is home to several notable buildings such as Baker Hall, Bartlett Hall, Campbell Hall, Bender Hall, Begeman Hall, and the Biology Research Complex. Other notable structures include the Communication Arts Center and the Campanile Clocktower. 
The University of Iowa offers a diverse range of degree programs in nursing, health sciences, pre-professional studies, biology, communication sciences, family services, gerontology, interior design, art and graphic design, counselling, and more.  International students can expect to pay an estimated amount of $20,565 in tuition and fees, excluding incidental expenses. However, the university offers several scholarships, work-study programs, and financial aid options to help students fund their education. For instance, the International Excel Award provides a grant of $1,000-$6,000 per year, while the International Scholars Award offers $5,000-$66,000. In addition, the UNI Business Scholars Awards offers up to $1,000 per year to deserving students with exceptional academic records. 
To learn more about the University of Northern Iowa, visit Leap Scholar and discover the perfect course that aligns with your educational goals.
Eligibility Overview:
The University of Northern Iowa is open to admitting international students based on the following criteria: a completed senior secondary or high school education, meeting minimum grade point requirements, and submission of official academic records and transcripts. It is also necessary for international students to show proof of adequate finances to cover tuition for the academic year by the given deadline.

Undergraduate programs are available in various fields including Business, Communication & Media, Education and Training, Health, Medical & Social Services, Human Behavior and Culture, Art, Music, Design and Theatre, Literature and Writing. Interested candidates must submit their transcripts which will then be evaluated, verified and sent in a sealed envelope from the institution where the documents were originally obtained.

To apply for undergraduate programs, candidates must submit their high school transcript and certificate, along with a score on the SAT/ACT. International students are also required to take an English Proficiency Test.

Graduate programs at the University of Northern Iowa are offered in Arts & Humanities, Behavioral & Health Sciences, Education, Business, Government & Non-Profit, and Science & Technology. Aspiring graduate students must have a General GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. To be considered for admission, a three-year bachelor's degree is also required for international students.
Placement:
At the University of Northern Iowa, students have the opportunity to attend various job and internship fairs, organized by the career services office. The University also has an internship coordinator who helps students find suitable positions in their desired location. Additionally, students are equipped with essential skills such as resume writing and interview preparation, to ensure their success in securing employment.

The University of Northern Iowa offers internships, either paid or unpaid, to its students. The current hourly rate for interns ranges from $12 to $13. Upon graduation, students can expect to earn an impressive starting salary of $45,000 to $70,000, based on their field of study.

From an authorized secondary school, graduates are required to meet the following criteria to be automatically admitted:
They must have a minimum of 2.25 GPA on a 4.0 scale to qualify for graduation.
OR They must achieve a composite ACT score of 21 or higher (SAT score of 1060 or higher).
Additionally, they must have completed the Kansas precollege curriculum (or the appropriate state precollege curriculum for non-residents) with a minimum 2.0 GPA (2.5 for non-residents).
Alternatively, they can fulfill one of the following requirements:
- Obtaining a composite ACT score of 21 or higher (or SAT score of 1060 or higher)
OR
- Ranking in the top one-third of their graduating class (if applicable)
Also, they must have a minimum 2.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale on all transferable college credits.
The precollege curriculum in Kansas consists of:
- 4 English classes
- 4 units of Math (no less than Algebra I will be accepted)
OR
- 3 units of Math and a minimum score of 22 on the ACT Math test
OR
- 1 unit of Math by earning 3 college credits in College Algebra
- 3 units of Natural Science (including 1 unit of Chemistry or Physics).

Name: University of North Florida
Overview:
The University of North Florida was founded in the year 1969 and is a public institution located in Jacksonville, Florida. This sprawling campus spans 1,318 acres and consists of 18 buildings. The university comprises six colleges that offer a wide range of degree programs, including one year certificate, associate degree, bachelor's degree, master's degree, and five doctoral degrees. These colleges are Brooks College of Health, Coggin College of Business, College of Arts and Science, College of Computing, Engineering and Construction, College of Education and Human Services, Hicks, and Honors College. The courses offered cover various areas of study, including liberal arts, science, and commerce.

One of the most sought-after programs at this university is international business, which is taught in the flagship programs. Other popular majors include liberal arts & humanities, research & experimental psychology, communications, nursing, and health service preparatory services. The average tuition fee for these courses amounts to USD 21,379, making it an affordable option for students.

The University of North Florida provides convenient on-campus residence services for students. These residences are equipped with modern amenities such as television, kitchen, laundry, internet services, and relaxation areas. The university also has special housing facilities for students with disabilities. The cost per semester, which includes accommodation and meals, comes to USD 13,869.

Apart from academic excellence, the university also has a vibrant campus life with over 200 student clubs and organizations. These clubs cater to various interests and activities, providing students with a well-rounded college experience. The university also offers numerous amenities and services like career counseling, a counseling center, an LGBTQ center, a military and veterans resource center, student accessibility services, student health service, a wellness complex, and the Taylor Leadership Institute.

The university also hosts sports summer camps for students interested in baseball and basketball. These camps offer an excellent opportunity for students to hone their skills and develop their athletic abilities. The university galleries, namely the University Gallery and the Intercultural Gallery, showcase a variety of exhibitions that promote cultural awareness and intercultural exchanges.

At the University of North Florida, financial aid is available in the form of grants, loans, and merit-based scholarships to help students cover their education costs. These funds are allocated based on the student's individual needs, program costs, and available funds. Upon graduation, students also have access to placement services provided by the university.
Eligibility Overview:
The following information pertains to applications from non-citizens and non-permanent residents of the United States for admission to a university. These applicants will be considered equally to citizens and permanent residents, but it is recommended that they submit their materials as soon as possible due to potential processing delays and distance constraints. It is important to note that most students in the United States apply for university admission at least a year in advance.

For international applicants, UNF will accept a limited number of transcripts without requiring a foreign evaluation if they meet certain criteria. However, for all other transcripts, a course-by-course evaluation or document-by-document GPA calculation is required by an approved third-party credential evaluation firm, as stated by the Florida Department of Education.

Proficiency in the English language is a necessary requirement for all applicants, unless English is the only official language in their country. Please refer to "Indicators of Required English Language Proficiency for Foreign Applicants" for a list of acceptable methods for meeting this standard.

During the admissions process, students must submit official test scores that correspond to their desired level of study: undergraduate or graduate.

Undergraduate applicants must take either the ACT or SAT, with the required score determined by their high school grade point average. For the SAT, a minimum score of 460 in Critical Reading and Math is necessary, while for the rSAT, a minimum score of 500 in Evidence-based Reading and Writing and Math is required. In comparison, a minimum score of 18 in English, 19 in Reading, and 19 in Math is necessary for the ACT.

For graduate applicants, GMAT or GRE scores are required, depending on the specific program they are applying to. A minimum score of 20 for the verbal component and 22 for the quantitative component is necessary for the GMAT. Applicants to the Master of Accountancy and Master of Business Administration programs must have a minimum score of 500. As for the GRE, scores must be provided for any graduate degree other than Business or Health Administration. The required score varies by department, but having a total score above 1000 (verbal and quantitative components combined) will increase competitiveness.

Accommodation: The university offers both on-campus and off-campus housing options for students. On-campus, there are six residence halls: Osprey Cove, Osprey Crossings, Osprey Fountains, Osprey Hall, Osprey Landing, and Osprey Village. These halls provide carpeted rooms with large windows, showcasing the surrounding lake and woodlands. The rooms are 180 square feet in size, and students have access to various recreational activities, such as intramural sports, outdoor hikes, running, and picnics. Off-campus housing is also available for those who prefer to live independently. However, all students have the option to reside in on-campus housing if desired. For more information, visit the university's website for on-campus housing at https://www.unf.edu/housing/.

Accommodation:
The following is imperative data regarding on-campus and off-campus accommodation options for undergraduate and graduate students at Chapman University.

On-Campus Accommodation: For incoming first-year students at Chapman University, on-campus housing is mandatory. Typically, each room in the residence hall houses three students. Deadline for housing applications is mid-May. On-campus housing options for incoming first-year students are Henley Hall, Morlan Hall, Pralle-Sodaro Hall, Glass Hall, and the Sandhu Residence Center.

Graduate students have limited options for on-campus housing at Chapman University. Interested students are required to fill out a Graduate and Law Student Housing Request Form. However, the university cannot guarantee housing for these students. Final decisions are usually announced in late May or early June.

Off-Campus Accommodation: There are various off-campus housing options available within short distance from Chapman University's main campus. Students can choose from apartment complexes, rented rooms, guest suites, or entire houses. Any off-campus housing options must undergo a security check before being approved. Students should also account for additional costs and amenities provided by off-campus housing. It is advised to carefully research and inspect off-campus accommodations before making a significant investment.

Name: American University
Overview:
Located in Washington, D.C., American University is a prestigious private research institute established under Methodist affiliation in 1893. Its admittance rate is 36% and it boasts an enrollment of more than 14,000 students. With eight schools and colleges offering a total of 79 Bachelor's, 89 Master's, and 11 Doctoral degrees, AU provides a diverse range of academic programs in areas such as Accounting, Business, Entertainment, French Studies, Journalism, and Literature. The university's 90-acre campus is situated in the residential district of Washington and is home to various schools including the Kogod School of Business, Washington College of Law, School of Education, and more.

At AU, students can benefit from a variety of educational opportunities, ranging from 1200+ Key Executive Leadership Programs to over 20 online professional certificate and degree programs, such as Tableau Data Analytics, Healthcare Management, and International Relations and Business. The university also offers a Pre-college program, the AU Gap Program, and the Discover the World of Communication Program, which allow high school students to engage in internships, field trips, seminars, and other academic activities.

International students can take advantage of AU's study abroad program, which allows them to study at the university while overseas students can attend AU's international centers in Nairobi and Madrid, as well as participate in summer study programs and internships. The estimated cost of attending AU for undergraduate students is USD 26,855, while graduate students can expect to pay USD 1,812 per credit hour. Financial aid options such as scholarships, loans, and grants, including the Federal Pell Grant, Southern Management Scholarship, and Federal Direct Parent PLUS Loan are available to assist students with their education expenses.

For students looking for on-campus accommodation, Anderson Hall, Centennial Hall, and Nebraska Hall offer a variety of options including doubles, triples, traditional rooms, suites, and apartments. AU also boasts a vibrant campus life with over 200 clubs and organizations to join, as well as intramural and club sports like baseball, golf, and equestrian. With a 93% employment rate within six months of graduating, American University is committed to preparing its students for successful careers in their chosen fields.

Overview:
The University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB), located in the USA, was founded in 1969 as a distinguished public research institution. With origins dating back to a small academic extension center in 1936, UAB has grown into a four-year university in 1966, and eventually gained full autonomy in 1969. Accredited by the respected Southern Association of Colleges and Schools, UAB boasts a wide range of academic programs, including bachelor's, master's, doctoral, and professional degrees across its 12 academic divisions. These include the School of Engineering, Business, Medicine, Education, Dentistry, Nursing, Health Professions, Optometry, and Public Health, as well as the College of Arts and Sciences and the Honors College, both established in the past decade. To support its academic excellence, UAB has eight well-equipped libraries situated around its campus. 

Offering a top-ranked Master of Science in Health Administration program, UAB also partners with the University of Alabama Health Services Foundation to create the UAB Health System (UABHS), a notable private not-for-profit organization comprising of esteemed School of Medicine faculty. Students at UAB can enjoy a variety of on-campus facilities, from a 150,000-square-foot recreational center with sports courts, aerobics studios, and gym equipment, to residence halls that accommodate over 130 student organizations that provide scholarships and financial aid. The cost of living in campus housing is 7,612 USD on average per semester, with an additional 1,660 USD for meals.

UAB requires all students to complete two writing courses and one math course to graduate. To determine a student's understanding of a subject and provide them with the best chance of success, they must take placement exams in English and Math. If they have registered with Disability Support Services, they may be eligible for testing accommodations. International students who meet certain requirements can enroll in English Composition I (EH 101) or English Composition for Second Language Writers (EH 108). They must also take the ALEKS Math Placement Assessment if they have no math credit or no credit above the remedial level (MPA) to register for a math course. Students waiting for alternative credit reports must still take the MPA and enroll in the highest math course until alternative credits are received. If a student wants to take a world language placement test, they must have studied the language for at least one year within the last two years and want to take French, Spanish, German, or Chinese classes. Internship placements are made months in advance, and student teachers must contact the School of Education to arrange their placement; contacting school officials or personnel is not permitted. Factors such as availability, criteria, and partnerships play a role in determining placement sites, and all placements are within a 50-mile radius of UAB. Some exceptions may be allowed, but changes in address and name must be reported to the Office of Clinical Experiences immediately.

Name: California State University, Bakersfield
Overview:
CSU Bakersfield (CSUB) was founded in 1970 and is located on a 375-acre site in the heart of the southern San Joaquin Valley. This university is fully accredited by WSCUC (Western Association of Schools and Colleges, Senior College and University Commission). Its four schools - Natural Sciences, Mathematics, and Engineering (NSME), Social Sciences and Education (SSE), Business and Public Administration (BPA), and Arts & Humanities (AH) offer 57 graduate and undergraduate programs. Additionally, CSUB Extended Education provides a wide range of certificate programmes, degree programs, and professional development opportunities to the community. The in-state tuition fees at this university range from $7500-$8000, while for out-of-state students, it is around $17,000 to $18,000.

CSUB takes pride in being a part of the NCAA Division I and has 16 athletics teams that compete in the Big West Conference, giving students and faculty members the opportunity to excel in a highly competitive environment. With its affordable tuition fees and a variety of academic options, CSU Bakersfield is a great choice for both in-state and out-of-state students looking to enhance their education and individual growth.

Name: Northern Arizona University
Overview: North Arizona University, commonly known as NAU, is a research institution that was founded in 1899. It is a public, non-profit university governed by the Arizona Board of Regents and situated in Flagstaff, Arizona. The Flagstaff Campus stands out for being one of the highest-elevation 4-year college campuses in the country. With a student-faculty ratio of 19:1, the university has an acceptance rate of 84.9%. It has 8 schools and departments, including the School of Music, School of Art, Department of Comparative Cultural Studies, Department of Theatre, Department of English, Department of History, Department of Global Languages and Cultures, and Philosophy Department. NAU offers a wide range of academic programs with 95 undergraduate degrees, 76 graduate degrees, 47 undergraduate certificates, and 30 graduate certificates. Popular fields of study at the university include Business, Education, Engineering, Health and Nursing, IT and Computing, Law and Criminal Justice, Math and Science, and Communications. For students living on campus, residential housing options are available in 8 different colleges, based on the student's chosen major. These accommodations provide essential utilities such as electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash, and high-speed wired and wireless internet. To enhance students' overall experience, NAU offers over 400 student organizations, including Abaya Yala University Association, Achieving Sustainable Communities, and African Students Association (NAU). The university also hosts various athletic and sports events for its students. The total cost of attendance for NAU students, including tuition, books and supplies, room and board, and other expenses, is $28,150 for Arizona residents and $42,770 for out-of-state residents.

Name: Central Queensland University (CQU) - Melbourne
Overview:
In the year 1967, CQU was founded as QIT (Queensland Institute of Technology). It gained university status in 1992 and became CQ University, catering to over 30,000 students globally. The institution believes that higher education should be accessible to all, regardless of location or educational background. CQ University offers diverse courses in education, humanities, accounting, law, psychology, and health, making it the largest regional university in Australia.

It prides itself on being a forerunner in online learning, with a ranking among the top 600 universities worldwide. The university's active and diverse environment enables students to pursue their ambitions. With a range of on-campus and online programs, CQU empowers students to achieve their goals.

CQU provides a range of programs, including graduation, post-graduation, short-term, certificate, and research programs. The university has 16 campuses across Australia in Rockhampton, Melbourne, Adelaide, Noosa, Sydney, Mackay, Townsville, Gladstone, Perth, Cairns, Bundaberg, Brisbane, and Emerald.

The university is renowned for its research, with collaborations with national and international researchers and research networks. CQU is committed to making a positive impact through its research initiatives.
Eligibility Overview:
For admission to the undergraduate program, a qualification equivalent to Year 12 in Australia is required. However, this requirement can also be satisfied by completing an approved university foundation program or obtaining a recognized Australian Certificate IV qualification. Students who have successfully completed a certificate, diploma, or advanced diploma (or equivalent) may also be eligible for exemptions in their chosen course at CQUniversity.

For admission to the postgraduate program, applicants must hold a bachelor's degree from a recognized higher education institution, with a minimum overall average equivalent to an Australian pass grade in the final two terms.

Applicants whose first language is not English must demonstrate proficiency in the English language through a recognized test. Alternatively, applicants can provide evidence of having completed a bachelor's degree taught in English at a recognized institution to satisfy the English language requirement.

Name: The Kings University
Overview: The inception of The King's University dates back to 1979 when it was known as King's College. In 2015, the institution was renamed as The King's University. With a diverse student body consisting of 934 students, including 102 international students representing over 24 nations, the university has gained significant recognition over the years. In terms of sustainability, the university received a STARS silver rating and was ranked #52 in the Regional Universities South category by US News World Rankings 2022. The campus, situated in Alberta's capital city, is in proximity to Treaty Six territory. The private university offers a wide range of more than 650 courses in various disciplines, including Liberal Arts, Natural Sciences, Fine Arts, etc. While the cost of education differs for different programs, the average cost remains around 27,000 USD. To make education affordable for international students, the university offers several scholarships ranging between 1,000 USD and 3,000 USD. The university has set certain admission criteria, such as an overall grade of 60% or higher, standard 12 courses, etc. Additionally, strong English language skills are also considered while evaluating international student applications. Apart from academic support, international students also have access to various on-campus facilities such as the Annual Globe Awareness Week festival, the International Students Assistants Program, and personal development workshops. The student-to-faculty ratio at The King's University is 22:1, and the retention rate is 77.6%. The university offers international students on-campus accommodation options, including tower rooms, tower suites, and apartments. With a strong alumni network of over 6,500 graduates, the university boasts a remarkable 98% employability rate. The career prospects of students are enhanced through the Centre for Career and Calling and career fairs organized by the university.

Eligibility Overview:
Academic Eligibility Standards
Applicants must have completed at least three years of high school in California, whether it be in a public or private institution. If this is not the case, they must have obtained credit equivalent to three or more years of full-time coursework at a California high school through a combination of attendance at elementary, middle, and/or high schools within the state. Prior to the start of the term, candidates must have received a high school diploma from a California institution or have an equivalent qualification, such as passing the state's GED exam or California High School Proficiency test. It is also necessary for them to submit a signed declaration to the college or university stating that they have applied for legalization of their immigration status, or will do so once they become eligible. These criteria are applicable for all students seeking admission, regardless of their immigration status.

Accommodation:
The following information pertains to on-campus and off-campus housing options for students at MSOE (Milwaukee School of Engineering). 

On-campus living is offered at three residence halls: Hermann Viets Tower, Margaret Loock Residence Hall (MLH), and Regents Hall. Upperclassmen have the opportunity to reside in the Grohmann Tower apartment building, where studio, 1- and 2-bedroom flats are available. These apartments are allocated on a first-come, first-served basis to juniors, seniors, international students, graduate students, and married students. Students may select their preferred hall to live in. However, Regents Hall is exclusively for first-year female students. Each hall offers single and double room options. On-campus housing is in high demand as MSOE provides a fulfilling student experience.

Alternatively, off-campus housing is also available with an average monthly rent ranging between $500 and $700. Students may opt for studio flats, 3-bedroom, 4-bedroom, and shared apartments. Moreover, every accommodation comes with a technology package including high-speed internet and DISH TV with a DVR. Off-campus housing is conveniently located near the public transportation system of Milwaukee, enabling students to travel easily to and from campus.

For more information and to apply for on-campus housing, please visit the official MSOE website. To explore off-campus housing options, please refer to the provided link. We strive to provide the best living experience for our students at MSOE, both on and off campus.

Name: University of Idaho
Overview: The University of Idaho is a land-grant University located in Moscow, Idaho, established in 1889. The campus occupies an area of 1,585 acres and is situated amidst the picturesque Palouse hills. Apart from its main campus in Moscow, U of I also has branch campuses in Boise, Coeur d'Alene, and Idaho Falls. The university offers a wide range of academic programs, including over 300 majors, minors, Master's degrees, Certified programs, and Doctorate Professional courses across its eight educational campuses. Popular fields of study at the University of Idaho include psychology, marketing, business, mechanical engineering, finance, sociology, liberal arts and humanities, and accounting. Students at U of I can choose from a variety of career options, including on-campus, off-campus, work-study, and internships. The student-faculty ratio at the university is approximately 16:1, ensuring personalized attention and guidance for students. The average tuition fees for undergraduate programs at the university is $31,608 per year. U of I also offers scholarships and financial aids to both domestic and international students. With a sprawling campus of 1,585 acres and 253 buildings, the University of Idaho includes several noteworthy facilities such as Memorial Gymnasium, Student Recreation Centre, and the Administration building. Additionally, U of I provides various student services, including the Women's Center, Non-remedial tutoring, Daycare, Placement Cell, Health services, and Health insurance. Accommodation options at the university include four residence halls, ten sororities, and eighteen fraternities, mainly catering to freshman students. With its emphasis on community engagement and providing a transformative education on a global scale, the University of Idaho is one of Idaho's most prestigious institutions.

Additionally, a minimum composite score of 18 on the American College Test (ACT) or 960 on the Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT) is necessary. Name: Dakota State University
Overview:
Dakota State University, located in Madison, USA, offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs to its students both on campus and online. The university boasts a diverse student body, with students from different backgrounds and countries. Students can choose from the 11 undergraduate and six postgraduate programs offered at this prestigious institution. The cost of attendance for international and domestic students may vary depending on the course they select, with an estimated average tuition and fees of INR 1492579 for international students.

At Dakota State University, students have access to various financial aid options, including scholarships, work-study programs, and alternative funding sources. The university also has a dedicated Career Planning Service team that helps students with CV building and finding employment opportunities, whether they are seeking full-time jobs after graduation, part-time jobs, summer jobs, or internships. This added support and guidance make Dakota State University an attractive choice for students looking to build a successful career.
Eligibility Overview:
The essential qualifications for admission
As an international graduate student, there are specific prerequisites that must be met, just like any other student accepted to Dakota State University. To prove your intellectual capability, you must fulfill the following requirements:

- Hold a four-year undergraduate degree from a recognized institution in the United States.
- In certain cases, international transcripts may be required to be evaluated by an approved DSU transcript review agency.
- Have a minimum GPA of 2.70 on a 4.0 scale or equivalent (based on your institution's grading system).
- Take the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) within the last five years.

Note: The GRE may be waived if any of the following conditions are met:

- Cumulative GPA of 3.25 or higher on a 4.0 scale in a bachelor's program from a regionally accredited college or university in the United States.
- Successfully completed graduate level studies at a regionally accredited institution in the United States with grades of "A" or "B" in at least nine hours of coursework.
- Graduated from a regionally accredited college or university in the United States at least 15 years ago.

Impressive command over English communication
To demonstrate your proficiency in the English language, one of the following methods must be used:

- Achieve a score of 76 on the TOEFL iBT.
- Score 550 on the TOEFL PBT.
- Attain a minimum score of 6.0 on the IELTS, with no sub-score lower than 5.5.
- Secure a grade of at least 53 on the Academic PTE.
- Complete Level 112 at ELS within two years of the test date.

Note: It is mandatory to submit official TOEFL or PTE Academic scores within two years of the exam date. Please note that the testing agency must send the scores for validation.

One important aspect of this experience is on-campus accommodation, which plays a significant role in shaping your college life. Please make sure to fill out your Housing Application through the WCSU Housing Portal, if you have not done so already. In case you are under 18 years of age, please make sure to provide a signature from your parent or guardian. Other necessary documentation includes letters of recommendation, work experience letters, a statement of purpose, transcripts from previous education, and a valid passport and visa.

Name: Kutztown University
Overview:
Located in the beautiful Pennsylvania countryside, Kutztown University is a public college and part of the Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education. The institution was established in 1866 as Keystone Normal School and earned university status in 1983. Accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, Kutztown University offers a total enrollment of 8310 students, which includes 7391 undergraduate students and 918 postgraduate students.

With a student-faculty ratio of 17:1, Kutztown University has a dedicated team of 552 academic members and 563 administrative staff. The college has four academic colleges - the College of Business, College of Education, College of Liberal Arts and Sciences, and College of Visual and Performing Arts, offering a wide range of programs. Some of the popular majors at Kutztown University are Business Administration and Management, Psychology, Communication and Media Studies, Criminal Justice/Safety Studies, and Parks, Recreation, and Leisure Studies.

Kutztown University boasts 21 varsity teams, 8 for men and 13 for women, and is a proud member of NCAA Division II. The university is also a part of the Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference and offers various intramural and club sports programs to students. Around 49% of undergraduate students live on-campus, creating a strong sense of community within the university. The campus spans over 326 acres and provides modern facilities for students' academic and personal development.

To support the students financially, Kutztown University offers need-based scholarships. However, the total expenses, including tuition fees, room and board, books and supplies, and miscellaneous expenses, amount to around 35,366 USD. The college also houses a Career Development Center, which assists students in exploring various career options and opportunities. They also provide internships and job offers to prepare students for a successful future. With a 54% graduation rate, Kutztown University is dedicated to providing a well-rounded education to its students.

Name: Arizona State University
Overview:
Arizona State University was established in 1885 as a prominent public research institute situated in the urban region of Phoenix. Recognized as a leading innovative institution, ASU has five distinct academically divided campuses and four learning centers. The Tempe campus primarily focuses on research-oriented studies while the Polytechnic campus offers professional and technological programs. The West campus specializes in interdisciplinary courses, and the Downtown Phoenix campus teaches diverse fields such as nursing, criminal justice and mass communication. The ASU-Mayo Medical School campus is dedicated to health-related disciplines.

With 17 distinguished colleges, ASU provides a wide range of over 350 undergraduate programs, 100 graduate programs, and various certification courses. Chemistry, Psychology, Communications, Political Science, Anthropology, Sociology, Biology, Business, Economics, and Law are among the highly ranked courses here. The ASU law school, Sandra Day O'Connor College of Law, has bagged the 25th spot nationally. Additionally, the university's college of honors, Barrett, is ranked among the topmost colleges in the country for undertaking honors courses.

ASU's library is also noted among the top 40 research libraries in North America. The university attracts thousands of applicants annually, boasting of an exceptional acceptance rate of 86.5%. Undergraduate tuition and fees here cost an average of 31200 USD, while postgraduate programs cost approximately 25200 USD. International students can also avail themselves of merit-based scholarships apart from college and departmental scholarships.

Living on campus is compulsory for first-year students, who are accommodated in residential colleges provided by the university. Apart from that, all other students can choose from various on-campus housing options such as suite-style rooms and shared apartments, all of which come with meal plans and proximity to classes. The placement rate for business and engineering courses is impressively high, with an average of 89% of graduates finding employment within six months of graduation, with a median salary of 54,000 USD.
Eligibility Overview:
The university has certain requirements for the TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE scores for students applying for the undergraduate program, in addition to evaluating their grades in 10th, 11th, and 12th grade. The scores of ACT or SAT may vary depending on the chosen major. Advanced Placement (AP), International Baccalaureate (IB), and College-Level Examination Program (CLEP) credits are accepted. Applicants under conditional admission must provide valid scores of TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE within three semesters or successfully complete ASU Global Launch.

The graduate program has specific requirements based on the course or major of study. Some courses may require a higher level of English proficiency. The usual English proficiency standards are as follows: Applicants must have completed four-year or three-year undergraduate degree and one year of master's study with a minimum of 3.0 GPA (out of 4.00). For certain programs, GRE, MCAT, and LSAT scores are also considered as per the course requirements.
