The Career and Professional Development Services at the university offer extensive support for students' career development. These include career interest communities, assessments of individual career goals, preparation for the job market, networking opportunities, professional growth workshops, resume writing and application review services, and guidance for further education or career paths. 
The university also has a strong track record of producing highly employable graduates, with notable employers such as the United States Federal Government, American Express, Intel, and Amazon. Within just 90 days of graduation, an impressive 90% of job-seeking graduates receive at least one job offer. By the six-month mark, 89% of undergraduates and 93% of graduate students who were actively searching for employment are either employed, have started their own businesses, or have received multiple job offers.
Accommodation:
At this university, students have the option to either stay on-campus or find off-campus accommodation. On-campus housing is available to both undergraduate and graduate students. First-year students are required to live in a residential college with other students who share similar academic interests. Upper-division students can choose from various housing options, including suite-style rooms and communal flats with kitchens. The residences are fully furnished and come with essential amenities such as utilities, internet, and on-site staff available 24/7. Plus, their convenient location provides easy access to academic buildings, student services, and food options. To find on-campus housing, visit the university's website.
For those who prefer off-campus accommodation, the average monthly rent ranges from 750 to 950 USD. Options include studio flats, 3 and 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartments. Each apartment comes with central air conditioning, free high-speed WiFi, and a washer and dryer. They are also fully furnished and offer ample storage space and walk-in closets in the bedrooms. Most leases are for 12 months. To explore off-campus housing options, click on the link provided.
Course Ranking: Arizona State University (ASU) has a variety of noteworthy undergraduate programmes including journalism, business and finance, and agriculture, which have been acknowledged as outstanding colleges by The Princeton Review in 2021. Additionally, ASU's Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication has earned the prestigious title of best journalism school in the country from the same source. In terms of business schools, ASU has significantly improved its rankings on Bloomberg's list, jumping up from 49th place in 2016 to an impressive 2nd place in 2020. However, its progress on US News' annual rankings for their MBA programme in supply chain management has been more stagnant, consistently placing in the bottom five spots since 2018. Despite this, ASU continues to be a viable option for those seeking reputable business schools in the US. However, it should be noted that ASU's global rankings on QS (Top Universities) have seen a decline since 2018, when it ranked 74th. As of 2021, it has fallen to the 111-120th spot, but has shown improvement in 2022, settling between 101 and 110th place.
University Ranking: Arizona State University (ASU) has a long history of excellence in teaching and research. It can trace its roots back to the Territorial Normal School, which was established in 1885. ASU officially became a university in 1958 and has since continued to improve its academic standards. It has consistently ranked highly in global university ratings, with a strong focus on instruction, research, and citation metrics. In 2021, the Times Higher Education (THE) ranking system dropped ASU from 126th to 184th place, but it rebounded in 2022 with a ranking of 132nd. Similarly, the Academic Ranking of World Universities (ARWU), also known as the Shanghai Ranking, consistently placed ASU between 101 and 150th place from 2016 to 2021, highlighting the university's dedication to faculty quality and research output. In the broader US rankings, ASU has consistently improved, currently placed at 103rd among national institutions according to US News. However, the university saw a slight decline in 2022, dropping to 117th place. On the global stage, ASU has maintained its position in previous years, but in 2022 it slipped to number 165 from its previous spot at 146. Despite a dip in THE's 2021 ranking, ASU regained its standing with a rank of 132nd in 2022. This consistent track record of excellence in both teaching and research sets ASU apart as a premier institution of higher learning.

Name: Governors State University
Overview:
Governors State University is located in University Park, Illinois and was founded in 1969. It is a public university with a student enrollment of 6,000 and an acceptance rate of 46%. The university has four colleges - the College of Business, College of Education, College of Arts & Sciences and College of Health & Human Services. It offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and certificate programs, with some of the popular ones being Accounting, Media Studies, Physical Therapy, Criminal Justice, and Public Administration. GSU also offers over 85 undergraduate and graduate certificate programs, including Chemistry Education, Digital Forensics, Addictions Screening, and Data Analytics. 
Through its Dual Degree Program, in partnership with 17 community colleges in the Chicagoland area, students can pursue associate and bachelor's degree programs. The university also offers online classes, with over 120 courses available every semester in various degrees and certificate programs such as Business and Applied Science, Teaching, and Nursing. To prepare students for their professional journey, GSU offers Pre-Professional Pathway programs for fields like Clinical Psychology, Chemistry, and Accounting.
GSU also has a School of Extended Learning, providing students with opportunities for continuing education in fields like Career Training, Teacher Training, and English Language Learning. On-campus housing is offered at Prairie Place, with comfortable apartments and suites available for students.
There are more than 70 student clubs and organizations at GSU, such as Alpha Iota Sigma, ArtForum, and Black Student Union. The university also has both men's and women's sports teams, including golf, soccer, cross country, and basketball. Graduates of Governors State University have a median starting salary of $43,900.
The estimated undergraduate tuition fee is $313 per credit hour. Financial assistance is available to students, such as the Freshman Presidential Scholarship, Federal Pell Grant, State of Illinois Monetary Award Program, and GSU Graduate Assistantship.

Name: Loyola Marymount University
Overview: Loyola Marymount University is a prestigious research institution located in California, United States. It was founded in 1973 as a result of the merger between two local colleges, Loyola College and Marymount College. The university embraces the Jesuit and Marymount traditions, focusing on nurturing leaders who uphold the core values and principles of these traditions. It consists of six graduate colleges that offer a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs. The top-rated courses at Loyola Marymount University include MFA in Film and TV Production, BSE in Mechanical Engineering, and BSE in Electrical Engineering. The university's scenic campus is situated in the beautiful Rey Hills of Westchester, Los Angeles, renowned as one of the most stunning campuses in the nation. It boasts impressive historic architecture and stunning views of the nearby beach. The William H. Hannon Library is a state-of-the-art facility that offers students access to the latest publications and research papers in various fields of study. The campus also houses 17 research centers that are committed to advancing research and development in different disciplines. Loyola Marymount University is committed to promoting sustainable practices on campus, and its buildings have been LEED certified. The annual cost of attending the university is approximately USD 70,500, making it a popular choice for students from diverse backgrounds. The university strives to cater to the needs of its diverse student population and has a campus ministry that encourages Christian values and ethics among students. With over 200 student clubs and organizations, students have the opportunity to engage in various extracurricular activities and build a strong social network. Loyola Marymount's sports team, known as the Loyola Marymount Lions, has achieved great success in national-level competitions, particularly in sports such as softball and basketball.

They also provide a variety of graduate programs, including business, public policy, education, and nursing, as well as a nursing practice doctoral program. For admission, international students are required to have a minimum score of 6.0 in IELTS or 79 in TOEFL, with possible additional requirements depending on the selected course. The cost of attendance for both domestic and international students may differ based on the program of study. On average, excluding miscellaneous expenses, the estimated tuition and fees for an international student are approximately 28,17,225 rupees. York College of Pennsylvania also offers various forms of financial aid, including scholarships, work-study opportunities, and other funding options, to assist students. Moreover, the university's Career Planning Service team assists students in creating resumes and securing employment, whether it be for their degree, a part-time job, summer employment or an internship upon graduation.

Placement:
This information pertains to a college or university and contains guidelines for academic credit requirements, graduate programmes, and internships.

Academic Credit Requirements
Students must complete a minimum of 120 credit hours to graduate and earn their degree. This includes general education courses, major courses, and electives. In some cases, students may be required to complete a capstone project or thesis to demonstrate their understanding of their chosen field.

Graduate Programmes
Graduate programmes are designed for students who have already completed an undergraduate degree. These programmes may include master's degrees, doctoral degrees, or professional certifications. The specific requirements for each programme may vary, but students must have a bachelor's degree and a minimum GPA of 2.5 to be considered.

Internships
Internships provide students with the opportunity to gain real-world experience in their chosen field. To earn academic credit for an internship, students must have a specific learning goal in mind and complete a minimum of 120 hours of work at an approved location with a structured learning experience. Students can earn up to 6 credit hours through internships, but must have completed at least 60 credit hours and maintain a minimum GPA of 2.5 to participate. An Internship Application must be completed and approved by the school's Dean before the Add/Drop deadline for the corresponding semester.
Accommodation: To promote academic success, personal growth, and responsible citizenship, the Office of Residence Life and Campus Housing at York Institution offers secure, comfortable, and inclusive residential communities. Living on-campus, students have the opportunity to engage in academic pursuits, bond with new friends, and enjoy themselves into the late hours of the evening. Most first-year students are housed in traditional halls, while upper-level students have a variety of options such as classic halls, suites, apartments, and houses to encourage personal development and independence. In accordance with the university's four-year residential college program, juniors, sophomores, and seniors are required to reside on campus during their first year, including transfer or returning students. Commuters, or those living within a 35-mile radius of their parent or guardian's home, are exempt from this requirement. The residential halls provided by the university are Arnold House, Beard Hall, Brockie Commons, Country Club Manor, Curry House, Keiffer House, Little Run Lodge, Manor Hall East, Manor Hall South, Manor Hall North, Manor Hall Northeast, Manor Hall West, Newberry House, Northside Commons, Penn Hall, Pershing House, Richland Hall, Spring Garden, Springettsbury Apartments, Springettsbury Hall, Susquehanna Hall, and Tyler Run I, II, and III, as well as Wenger House. For more information, please visit the Office of Residence Life and Housing website for on-campus housing options. If you have any further inquiries, please do not hesitate to contact the Office of Student Development and Campus Life.
Course Description: York College of Pennsylvania, a renowned institute for higher education, dates back to 1770. Located in York, USA, the university has over 50 international students, promoting diversity and inclusivity. It is well-known for providing exceptional education and producing impactful research. York College of Pennsylvania ranks 6248th among top universities in the world according to Webometrics. The university offers a wide range of bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degree programs in various areas such as Business, Humanities, Engineering, etc. There are three intakes in August, September, and January. This will demonstrate the student's capability to excel in rigorous academic settings.

Name: Santa Clara University
Overview: Santa Clara University is a renowned private Jesuit institution, established in 1851 by a Jesuit priest named John Nobili. Situated in the heart of Silicon Valley, it is the oldest functioning higher education institute in California. The university combines advanced technology with traditional Jesuit values, emphasizing on social responsibility. Encompassing over 106 acres of land, Santa Clara University has a student population of more than 10,000. It takes pride in its experienced faculty of 500+ members and esteemed alumni. The campus is strategically located in Silicon Valley, bordering San Jose and beautiful San Francisco Bay. The university offers a diverse range of courses, including M.S. in Online Marketing, B.S. in Mechanical Engineering, M.A. in Counseling Leadership, Ed.D in Social Justice Leadership, etc. The campus houses six prestigious colleges and schools, along with state-of-the-art libraries, research centers, laboratories, and information resources. The Malley Fitness Centre and the Kenna Hall are highly renowned among students. Apart from academics, Santa Clara University is dedicated to promoting arts and culture, with more than 125 student organizations, such as the Society of Women Engineers and The Redwood. It provides on-campus housing facilities, with eight residential learning communities, each centered around a unique theme, and ten residence halls. Santa Clara University places great emphasis on a global approach to education, offering students internship opportunities for practical exposure. The average tuition fees at this institute are approximately CAD 37k. International students can avail themselves of various merit-based scholarships and grants.
Eligibility Overview: The ideal candidate for admission to Santa Clara University must have a GPA of 3.69 or higher and must be considered above average in their high school class. To meet these requirements, it is important to earn a balance of A's and B's, with a higher number of A's than B's. It may also be beneficial to take more challenging courses, such as AP or IB. Maintaining a GPA of 3.68 is crucial, even when taking the most difficult classes offered. At Santa Clara University, the rigor of courses and GPA are highly regarded. The average GPA for the Class of 2025 at SCU is 3.68, with 5% of students graduating with a perfect 4.0, and 40% graduating with a GPA between 3.75 and 3.99. This data pertains to admission to the university.

Name: Virginia Commonwealth University
Overview:
The rephrased output should be such that it instills trust, confidence from the student's point of view.
Founded in 1838, Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU) is a well-renowned public research university located in Richmond, Virginia. It boasts a rich history as one of the oldest universities in the city, with a current enrollment of over 30,000 students. The university comprises two main campuses - the Monroe Park Campus and the MCV Campus - as well as various local research centers and a satellite campus in Doha, Qatar.  Offering a robust academic portfolio, VCU consists of 20 schools and colleges, providing students with 68 undergraduate courses, 70 postgraduate programs, 46 online certificate courses, as well as numerous doctoral and professional programs in diverse fields such as Business, Management, Psychology, Physical Education, Nursing, Health Sciences, Marketing, Engineering, Political Science, Mass Communication, Journalism and Social Work. In addition, VCU also offers unique, one-of-a-kind programs in areas like Homeland Security, Real Estate, Urban Land Development, and Emergency Preparedness. 

Consistently ranked among the top institutions nationally, VCU is renowned for its exceptional academic offerings. Its Neuroscience Research program ranks 32nd, while its Addiction Studies Research program holds the 14th position nationally. Admissions at VCU are moderately selective, with an impressive acceptance rate of 87%. Students can apply for the Fall, Spring or Summer semesters through the Common Application or the VCU Graduate Online Application. Apart from the application form, students also need to submit NACES evaluated academic transcripts, letters of recommendation, and standardized test scores like TOEFL, SAT, ACT, etc. along with an application fee of 70 USD.

The average tuition fee for undergraduate programs at VCU is 32,742 USD, while for postgraduate programs, it is 25,956 USD. VCU recognizes and rewards academic excellence through various merit-based scholarships such as the Presidential Scholarship and the Provost Scholarship, both worth 16,000 USD, and the Dean's Scholarship, worth 8,000 USD. Moreover, VCU also provides on-campus housing options for over 6000 students through its 12 residential halls. Students can choose from traditional, suite-style, and apartment-style living arrangements, and also have access to convenient facilities like Swipes and Dining Dollars.

With over 500 clubs and organizations managed by two student unions, VCU provides a vibrant and enriching campus life. Additionally, the university boasts one of the largest research libraries in Virginia, providing students with valuable resources to support their academic
Eligibility Overview: For freshmen applicants, a minimum GPA of 3.5 (on a 4.0 scale) is required along with a combined SAT score of at least 1330 on the critical reading and math parts of the test or an ACT composite score of at least 29 to be considered for admission to the Honors College at VCU. In order to have a competitive profile, it is expected that students maintain a 3.65 GPA and perform above average in their high school classes, with an emphasis on earning A's and B's. Taking advanced courses, such as AP or IB, will not only improve your weighted GPA, but also showcase your potential for college-level coursework.

Accommodation:
On-Campus Residential Options
From forming lasting connections to participating in various on-campus social activities and academic programs, living on campus is the ideal way to experience the full "Lumberjack" life. It has been found that students who reside on campus have higher GPAs and graduation rates, according to research. SFA offers a diverse range of housing options to cater to the unique needs and preferences of students. One such option is Griffith Hall. This co-ed residence hall is known for its active hall association and its numerous events, including community service initiatives, leadership workshops, and fun activities like axe handle decorating and Grocery BINGO. Griffith Hall provides the perfect environment for students who want to make the most of the college experience.

Another popular choice is Hall 14, which offers students the convenience of being in close proximity to the library, Student Recreation Center, and East College Cafeteria. Students can study in the well-equipped study rooms, cook in the community kitchen, or relax and play Ping-Pong in the lobby. Hall 14 also organizes various activities like intramural sports, study groups, and the exciting Floor Wars, making it a favorite among students.

Hall 20 is another co-ed residence hall known for its strong sense of community and an eventful calendar of activities. Here, students can participate in self-defense classes, join a game of Ultimate Frisbee, or engage in a friendly match of volleyball or video games. The hall also organizes a variety of events, such as Holler at Homer, to keep students engaged throughout the year. Plus, residents of Hall 20 have the added advantage of being close to Lumberjack and Ladyjack sports games and other special events.

Kerr Hall is the perfect choice for those seeking a welcoming and supportive environment. Part of SFA's First Year Commons, this all-female residence hall fosters a close-knit community, where many first-year students choose to reside till they graduate.

Lumberjack Landing, a four-story co-ed residential hall, provides everything students need to make a seamless transition to college life. With 16 study rooms, students can have ample opportunities to study, while also participating in the monthly program of entertaining events. The hall also offers academic assistance through educational programs organized by the staff and community assistants. Additionally, the hall is conveniently located near the Ed and Gwen Cole Student Success Center, which provides further resources for academic success.

Suitable for both first and upper-year students, Lumberjack Lodge offers two and four-bedroom suites with fully equipped kitchenettes and furnished living areas. The hall boasts of various amenities, including coinless laundry, TV lounges, and a game area with a pool table, making it an ideal place for students to relax and unwind. Lumberjack Lodge is also conveniently located in the heart of the SFA campus, next to the East College Cafeteria, R.W. Steen Library, and Homer Bryce Stadium.

Lumberjack Village has something for everyone. With three buildings offering a variety of room options, students can choose from apartment-style living with private rooms and a communal bath or a more communal living situation with quad rooms. The village also offers amenities like a community center with a fully equipped shared kitchen, a sand volleyball court, and is home to SFA's Residence Hall Association, providing ample opportunities to get involved with the community.

South Hall, a co-ed residence hall, is located within walking distance of the Baker Pattillo Student Center, R.W. Steen Library, and the Student Recreation Center. With a capacity of only 90 students, it offers a quiet and low-key atmosphere, perfect for summer course students. The hall features a lobby with a flat-screen TV, a community kitchen, and coinless laundry facilities.

Steen Hall is the largest on-campus residence hall and offers a wide range of amenities to its residents. With a capacity of over 100 exciting events throughout the year, students can participate in activities ranging from karaoke nights in the lobby to community outreach programs. The hall also offers study rooms with dry erase boards, providing students with a conducive environment to study. If you're looking for a residence hall with a true "college feel," Steen Hall is the place to be.

For students interested in academic pursuits, Wisely Hall, a co-ed honors residence hall, is the perfect fit. With a small capacity of only 77 students and 24-hour quiet hours, Wisely Hall provides a peaceful environment for studying. The hall organizes numerous activities and programs like Friends and Family Weekend, Stay at Home Weekend, and the popular Pancakes and Pajamas study break breakfast-at-night, promoting both academic excellence and community engagement. Admission to Wisely Hall is based on acceptance into the School of Honors and a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.25 or above.

Off-Campus Living Options
While living on campus immerses students in the full college experience, upperclassmen with at least 60 semester hours or those above 21 years of age can choose to live off campus. However, students without a suitable accommodation option need to apply for off-campus permission, which is subject to availability.

For further information, visit the SFA Housing and Dining website for general inquiries and brochures, and explore the various on-campus and off-campus accommodation options available to SFA students.
Course Description:
One of the most renowned institutions for higher education is Stephen F Austin State University, established in 1923. It is located in Nacogdoches, USA and prides itself on its diverse and inclusive community, with 119 international students. The university is widely recognized for its exceptional academic programs and groundbreaking research.

According to Webometrics - World, Stephen F Austin State University is ranked 2904th in the list of top universities. The university offers a wide range of bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees in various disciplines such as Business, Humanities, and Engineering. There are two intakes each year, in September and January, and the typical duration of a bachelor's degree is 3 years while a master's degree takes 1 year to complete. The average yearly tuition fee at this university is approximately $27,520 USD.

To help students financially, Stephen F Austin State University offers a variety of scholarships and grants, such as the USC Associates Scholarships for undergraduates in the Business program, the Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship, the You Are Welcome Here Scholarship for a Bachelor's in Kinesiology at Michigan State University, and the Graduate Incentive Award for an MS in Applied Economics.

In addition to its outstanding academic programs, the university boasts a sprawling campus with excellent facilities such as state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centers, clubs, and hostels for students and staff.

Another key aspect attracting international students to Stephen F Austin State University is the post-study work opportunities available in the USA. The university prepares students for success in their chosen careers and encourages them to make a positive impact on society.

For admission, potential students must meet certain requirements, including achieving a minimum score on English proficiency tests such as IELTS or TOEFL, as well as standardized tests like GRE, SAT, GMAT, and others. They must also submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, personal statements, transcripts from previous schools or colleges, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Villanova University36
Overview:
Named after Saint Thomas of Villanova, Villanova University is a private Catholic research institution located in Pennsylvania. Originally established in 1842, it is one of the oldest Catholic universities in the United States. The university's mission is to develop ethical and intellectually-driven leaders who are capable of making a positive impact on the world. Villanova has six colleges, four of which offer both undergraduate and graduate programs. In total, the university provides over 50 bachelor's programs and 40 master's programs, as well as doctoral programs. Villanova is classified as a highly research-focused university.

Villanova University offers a variety of top-rated courses such as bachelor's degrees in Management and International Business, as well as master's degrees in Computer Engineering and Mechanical Engineering. The university's campus covers a vast area of 254 acres and is divided into four sections. The Main Campus houses many historical buildings, including the renowned St. Thomas of Villanova Church. West Campus is home to various performing arts groups and residences, while South Campus and The Commons offer housing options for students.

The approximate cost of attending Villanova University is USD 74,000. The fees may vary depending on the program and duration of study. The university has a vibrant student community with numerous sororities, fraternities, and clubs. Representing the university in various collegiate tournaments, the Villanova Wildcats are well known for their achievements in sports such as football and basketball. Another noteworthy event hosted by the university is the largest Special Olympics, organized and run by students. Villanova also promotes Augustinian values through its Campus Ministry. Some notable alumni of the university include Jill Biden, the First Lady of the United States, Olympic athlete Sonia O'Sullivan, and former Pennsylvania Governor, Ed Rendell.
Eligibility Overview:
In order to apply for the Master's in Accounting program at Villanova University, all non-native English speakers must take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). A minimum score of 90 on the internet-based test (IBT) is required. This score must be obtained within the past two years. The TOEFL is administered by the Educational Testing Service, and information regarding test dates, location, and fees can be found on their website, www.toefl.org.

To qualify for the Master's in Accounting program at Villanova University, it is necessary for all applicants whose first language is not English to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). A minimum of 90 on the IBT is mandatory, and the results must be no more than two years old. Administered by the Educational Testing Service, the TOEFL can be taken at various centers and information regarding dates and fees can be accessed on their website, www.toefl.org.
Placement: Villanova University boasts a high employment rate for its graduates, with a successful placement rate of 97.8%. This statistic speaks to the success of the university in preparing its students for the workforce. Out of the graduating class, 70.6% have secured employment, while 23.2% have chosen to pursue higher education. Only 4% have taken a different path, while 2.2% are actively seeking opportunities. These impressive numbers demonstrate the university's dedication to helping students achieve their career goals.
Accommodation:
Rephrased Output:

There are 32 buildings within the housing system at Villanova University, including 18 traditional residence halls and 14 apartment-style halls. These buildings vary in size, accommodating anywhere from 30 to 540 residents. The residences are strategically located throughout the campus in three main areas: Main, South, and West. For more information on Villanova University housing, please visit the Residence Life webpage at www1.villanova.edu/university/student-life/residence-life.html.

Name: American English College - Main Campus
Overview:
American English College is an institution that has been approved by the Saudi Arabia Cultural Mission (SACM) and accredited by the Accrediting Council for Continuing Education and Training (ACCET). The primary goal of this institute is to provide students with English as a Second Language (ESL) education. It offers a SEVIS-approved ESL program that focuses on language learning and test preparation. Supporting students for the past thirty years, AEC has the authorization to issue Form I-20s to F-1 international students.

This institution provides private tutoring and group classes at its two campuses located in Los Angeles. The Main Campus, situated in Monterey Park, is known for its safety and affordability. It is easily accessible via public transportation and is considered the most convenient location to live in Los Angeles. The American English College Monterey Park is strategically placed, with quick access to popular cities like Pasadena, Irvine, Hollywood, Downtown Los Angeles, and famous beaches, all within a 30 to 45-minute ride.

Interested students can choose from a wide range of more than thirty partnering educational institutions. They can also take advantage of TOEFL waivers, which guarantee admission. AEC offers three English programs for TOEFL preparation, including semi-intensive and intensive English courses. The semi-intensive and intensive English programs are a perfect fit for working professionals or students pursuing higher education. The maximum student-to-teacher ratio for both programs is 15:1.

The intensive English program has a duration of 28 hours per week, while the semi-intensive program is for 18 hours per week. The TOEFL preparation program is 20 hours per week. AEC has established mutual agreements with various educational establishments. Students who have completed Level 6 at AEC can attend several community colleges, universities, private specialty schools, and other institutes without having to provide a TOEFL score. This allows for a smooth transition into higher education.

Name: Southern New Hampshire University
Overview:
Located in the state of New Hampshire, Southern New Hampshire University (SNHU) is a renowned private university that has been serving the educational needs of students in Manchester and Hooksett since 1932. Recognized by the New England Commission of Higher Education, SNHU boasts a sprawling 300-acre campus and has emerged as one of the fastest-growing universities in the country. The institution offers over 200 academic programs, catering to a diverse range of students seeking to excel in fields like hospitality, health, business, and education. Some of the most sought-after programs at SNHU include Data Analytics, Marketing, Anthropology, Human Services, and Criminal Justice. The university is strategically situated along the Merrimack River, providing a picturesque backdrop for students. Boasting an esteemed faculty comprising Daniel Webster College's teaching staff and renowned aviation programs, SNHU is home to the impressive Gustafson Center and the Monadnock Hall. 
Committed to empowering its students and challenging the status quo, SNHU also places a strong emphasis on learning outside the classroom. This includes internship opportunities, summer research jobs, and a unique spring break trip to Florida. Students are encouraged to get involved with the local community and develop their skills. The average tuition cost at SNHU is CAD 40,000; however, international students can avail themselves of a number of merit scholarships and grants. The university offers all the facilities necessary to promote learning and a well-rounded campus life. Student organizations, such as The Penmen Press and Radio SNHU, are actively involved in enriching student life. On-campus accommodation is available at SNHU, ranging from residence halls to fully-equipped apartment complexes with student lounges, fitness centers, and entertainment facilities. SNHU even has its own student-run restaurants, The Last Chapter Pub and The Quill, adding to the unique campus experience it offers.

Name: Georgetown University
Overview:
Georgetown University, a prestigious Jesuit research institute established in 1789, is located in Washington D.C. It is the oldest Catholic higher education institution in the United States.

The university offers a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs, with over 40 disciplines to choose from. These include English, Global Business, Human Science, and International Politics. Students can apply for bachelor's, master's, doctoral, and certificate programs.

Georgetown University has three campuses: Main Campus, Medical Center, and Law Center. Through its global academic initiative, the university's nine schools provide opportunities for international education through 213 undergraduate study-abroad programs in 57 countries, including popular destinations such as Italy and London. These program types include Area Studies, Direct Matriculation, Business, Language, Nursing, and Service Learning.

The estimated cost of attending the university as an undergraduate student is USD 29,892, while the tuition per credit hour for graduate-level programs is USD 2,278. The university primarily offers need-based financial aid for its students, rather than merit-based scholarships. Students must complete the College Scholarship Service and Free Application for Federal Student Aid to be considered. International students may also apply for limited need-based scholarships.

According to placement records, full-time MBA graduates from Georgetown University have been able to secure jobs with average starting salaries of USD 124,119. This showcases the excellent opportunities and success achieved by graduates of this renowned university.

Upperclassmen can opt for the apartment-style Guzman Hall, which features private bedrooms, semi-private baths, study spaces, a fitness center, computer and printing station, laundry services, and more. Hertel Hall, the largest residence hall, is available to both upperclassmen and new students. It offers amenities such as study rooms, computer labs, printers, entertainment lounges, laundry facilities, and vending machines. Rosary Hall is another option for upperclassmen and new students, providing single and shared rooms. It includes a study lounge, computer labs, television access, and Netflix accounts for student use.

Students residing on campus are offered three tax-free meal plans: the Gold Plan with 2,100 dollars, the Silver Plan with 1,950 dollars, and the Platinum Plan with 400 Dominican Dollars and 1,550 food dollars for on-campus meals. Name: Tarleton State University
Overview:
Tarleton State University, situated in Stephenville, Texas, is a prominent public institute just outside Dallas. It was established in 1899 and currently offers 64 undergraduate, 27 postgraduate, and two doctoral programs across 7 academic colleges. The primary campus is located in Stephenville, while the other campus is situated in Fort Worth, Texas. The university's curriculum encompasses a wide range of disciplines, including agricultural and environmental sciences, business administration, education, graduate studies, health and human service, liberal and fine arts, as well as science and technology. The institution is renowned for its exceptional programs in environmental engineering, nursing, business, and communications. Furthermore, the university boasts two prominent research centers, namely the Texas Institute for Applied Environmental Research and the Southwest Regional Dairy Center. The tuition fee at Tarleton State University averages around USD 17,448, making it an accessible educational option for students. 
Tarleton State University also offers specialty courses at its Dora Lee Langdon Cultural and Educational Center, as well as additional programs at McLennan Community College in Waco, Weatherford College in Weatherford, Bryan at the RELLIS Campus, and Fort Worth. The university provides on-campus housing options, including Centennial, Heritage, Hunnewell, and Legacy, which feature well-appointed split-style rooms, lobbies, and houses. The institution encompasses a dynamic campus life with over 100 student organizations and clubs, spanning various interests such as athletics, recreational sports, health services, counseling, university police, and emergency information. The cost of living, including housing expenses, sums up to an average of USD 10,480. The campus also houses an extensive library with vast academic resources for the students, besides organizing annual football tournaments. Furthermore, Tarleton State University offers need-based financial aid, scholarships, as well as federal grants for students. The university's international scholarship program is a significant initiative catering to the educational needs of international students seeking to study in the US.
Eligibility Overview: The information provided pertains to admission requirements for prospective freshmen at a university. To be considered for admission, applicants must meet certain score requirements, which will determine their eligibility. The necessary steps for application include submitting an official high school transcript, providing SAT or ACT test scores, and fulfilling any additional requests from the Office of Undergraduate Admissions. Fluency in English must also be demonstrated, with scores not exceeding 2 years since the beginning of the intended term. Once accepted, students must complete a financial support affidavit, provide a statement or bank letter, and present a copy of their valid passport. Any further documentation requested by the Undergraduate Admissions – Immigration Office must also be submitted. Test score requirements for the SAT and ACT exams are specified, along with acceptable scores for proof of English proficiency, including TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, TOEFL ITP Plus for China, and DuoLingo.

Name: Valencia College - East Campus
Overview: The beginnings of Valencia College can be traced back to its establishment as Valencia Junior College in 1967, with later realization as Valencia Community College. This public institution is located in Orlando, Florida and has a range of campus locations throughout the city, including Kissimmee and Winter Park. With eight main campuses and three additional sites spanning Orange and Osceola counties, Valencia places emphasis on preparing the next generation for public safety through advanced technology and simulation training. Accredited by the Commission on Colleges of the Southern Association of Schools and Colleges, this college has a multitude of campus locations, each dedicated to providing a reliable education to students. The East Campus is centrally located at 701 North Econlockhatchee Trail in the eastern part of Orange County, serving over 21,000 students annually and housing three regional UCF campuses. The campus boasts a wide range of academic options and was recognized for its friendly, professional, and diligent staff and faculty across various disciplines. Valencia College has over 120 programs, offering both associate and bachelor's degrees. Students must complete an associate degree program before transitioning to a baccalaureate degree program. The college currently offers a variety of bachelor's degrees such as Cardiopulmonary Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering Technology, Nursing, and Radiologic and Imaging Sciences. At the East Campus, students can choose from a range of programs including specializations in Finance, Marketing, Web Development, Graphic and Interactive Design, and more. Additionally, Valencia has top-notch libraries at every campus location, providing students with access to a vast array of educational resources, periodicals, e-books, journals, databases, and multimedia materials. With an acceptance rate of nearly 100%, graduating students can pursue additional career opportunities or further their education at other top universities across the United States.

It is also ideal to find someone whose living habits align with your own and to discuss expectations before moving in together. It may also be beneficial to have separate leases with the landlord to avoid any potential money conflicts.

Name: University of Richmond
Overview: The University of Richmond, established in 1830, is situated on the border of Henrico County and the city of Richmond, in the state capital of Virginia. It is a reputable liberal arts institution that ranks 22nd among National Liberal Arts Colleges. The university operates on a semester-based academic calendar and offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctorate programs. These programs are divided into 5 schools: the School of Arts and Sciences, Jepson School of Leadership Studies, Robins School of Business, Richmond School of Law, and School of Professional and Continuing Studies. ﻿The University's top majors include Business, Management, Marketing, and Related Support Services; Social Sciences; Biological and Biomedical Sciences; Multi/Interdisciplinary Studies; and Psychology. Financial assistance is available to students in the form of both need-based and merit-based scholarships. Need-based aid is determined by the student's family's ability to pay for college, as per the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) calculations.
Eligibility Overview:
Application Requirements: Richmond has a diverse student body, with approximately 10% being international students. Overseas applicants must submit specific documents and materials to be considered for admission. These include academic records such as transcripts, diplomas, and degree certificates. Standardized test scores, such as SAT, ACT, GRE, and GMAT, are not required. However, scores from English proficiency tests like TOEFL or IELTS must be submitted. Students must also provide a form for international financial certification and a scanned copy of their passport's photo page (optional). Additionally, a medical history form must be completed.  
 
English Proficiency Requirements: Richmond sets minimum scores for English Language Proficiency (ELP). However, it is recommended to achieve higher scores for better chances of admission. Acceptable scores for admission are a minimum of 80 on TOEFL-iBT or a PBT score of 550. For IELTS, the minimum score is 7.5. On the SAT, a score of 660 on the English section is accepted. For ACT, a score of 28 on the English section is required. Students may also submit a grade of A or B in A Level English, IB, or AP. It is important to aim for a higher score to increase chances of admission to Richmond.
Placement: Spider-connect is a comprehensive program at University of Richmond that bridges the gap between students and potential employers. They have a dedicated team of career counsellors who assist students in securing internships and jobs. The career services at the University also organize workshops and events to enhance students' employability skills. These include Spider job fairs, career chats, career expos, and an international employment resources library. As a result of these efforts, 95% of students find employment within two years of graduating. After six years, their average annual salary is approximately 64,200 USD, significantly higher than the national average of 33,028 USD.

Name: Iowa State University
Overview: Iowa State University, formerly known as Iowa Agricultural College, is a popular educational institution located in Ames, Iowa with a total enrollment of over 33,391 students. The university offers a wide range of academic programs, including Engineering, Biological and Biomedical Sciences, Journalism, Communication, Agriculture, and Business Management. It is home to 10 schools and colleges that provide over 100 undergraduate degrees, 100 graduate degrees, 80 PhD programs, and one professional degree. The majority of first-year students opt for on-campus living due to the university's numerous extracurricular activities and opportunities. On-campus students also have the chance to earn money while pursuing their chosen degree. Off-campus students can also take advantage of this opportunity by working in the surrounding community. Iowa State University offers several scholarships and awards specifically for international students, such as the Anne Doyle International Student Award, International Merit Scholarships, Freddy Miranda Professional Development Grant Application, and others. The university is highly regarded for its successful job placements and invites renowned companies to recruit its students. The tuition fees vary depending on the program chosen by the student, with the highest being approximately USD 31,018 for graduate students.
Eligibility Overview:
The following information pertains to the admission requirements for students applying to Iowa State University from different countries. We have established minimum performance standards for each country, which must be met in order to be considered for admission. To view the specific requirements for your country, please visit our website.

English proficiency is a vital component of the application process. Only students who have been raised in an environment where English is the sole official language and has been predominantly used at home will be considered to have English as their primary language. International students who do not meet this criterion must demonstrate English proficiency through one of the following methods:

- Submitting results of an approved English proficiency exam
- Providing evidence of having completed secondary education in an English-speaking curriculum
- Passing a proficiency test administered by an Iowa State University approved institution

A scanned copy of test results may be uploaded during the application process. However, if admitted, official scores directly from the testing agency must be sent to the university. This is a crucial step in the admission process for international students as it ensures that they will be able to effectively communicate and succeed in their studies at Iowa State University.

Course Description:
Iowa State University is a globally renowned higher education institution, established in 1858. Located in Ames,USA, the university attracts about 2532 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. It is highly recognized for its exceptional educational standards and research outcomes, making it one of the top universities worldwide. Iowa State University is ranked as the 104th best university by Webometrics - World. The university offers a variety of bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees in diverse disciplines, including Business, Humanities, Engineering, and more. With 2 intakes in September and January, the university offers six undergraduate and two postgraduate programs, with the duration of the bachelor's degree being four years and master's degree being one year. 
The average annual tuition fees for Iowa State University is approximately 12916 USD. There are several scholarships and grants available for students, providing financial assistance. Some of the prominent scholarships offered by Iowa State University include USC Associates Scholarships for undergraduate Business programs, Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship, You Are Welcome Here Scholarship for Bachelor of Science in Kinesiology at Michigan State University, and Graduate Incentive Award for Master of Science in Applied Economics. 
The campus of Iowa State University is sprawling and well-equipped, encompassing state-of-the-art buildings, cutting-edge research libraries, laboratory spaces, centers, clubs, and hostels, among other facilities for students and staff. 
Apart from its exceptional educational offerings, another prime factor attracting international students to Iowa State University is the post-study work opportunities available in USA. The university provides students with mentorship and guidance to excel in their careers and make a positive impact on society. 
To gain admission, Iowa State University requires students to meet certain criteria, such as demonstrating proficiency in English through IELTS or TOEFL scores, and submitting standardized test scores, like GRE, SAT, GMAT, etc. Additionally, students must provide letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, transcripts from schools or colleges, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Brooklyn College

Name: Life University
Overview:
Life University, located in Marietta, Georgia, USA, was founded in 1974 by renowned chiropractor Sid. E. Williams as a private college. It is recognized as the largest chiropractic college globally, providing bachelor's, master's, and associate degrees. This esteemed institution is dedicated to holistic development, promoting a healthy lifestyle. It comprises several academic divisions, including Basic Sciences, Chiropractic Sciences, Clinical Sciences, Health Sciences, and Clinics. These divisions encompass various fields, such as anatomy, biochemistry, pathology, physiology, analysis, chiropractic principles and philosophy, research, technique, clinical education, diagnosis, psychology, public health, radiology, athletic training, exercise science, nutrition, sports health science, and more. Additionally, the University offers practical learning experiences through the P.E.A.K. Clinic, which is a doctor's office-based clinical experience. For convenient access to campus facilities, the University offers on-campus accommodations at an estimated cost of USD 12,450 for student residents.

Determined to provide accessible education, Life University offers financial assistance in the form of scholarships from over 100 organizations. Upon graduating from the University, the average graduate's salary after ten years is approximately USD 32,000. Apart from academic excellence, the University is also renowned for its outstanding sports programs, particularly its Rugby team, and attracts students from 45 different countries worldwide. With over 3000 student enrolments, it is an inclusive and diverse educational institution that prioritizes the overall development of its students.
Eligibility Overview:
This university requires applicants to meet certain criteria in order to be admitted into their Doctor of Chiropractic Program. The minimum GPA requirement for 90 semester credit hours/135 quarter credit hours is between 2.75-2.99. Additionally, applicants must have a bachelor's degree with a minimum GPA of 2.75-4.0 for the required 90 semester credit hours/135 quarter credit hours, but do not meet the regular admissions criteria set by CCE. 

To begin the chiropractic studies, a minimum of 90 semester credit hours or 135 quarter credit hours of non-duplicate coursework must have been completed with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. All science courses used for admissions must have a minimum grade of C and at least half must include a laboratory component. Each applicant who qualifies for admission through the AAT will be evaluated on an individual basis using their educational transcripts. The final decision on admission will be made by the Dean of the College of Chiropractic.
Placement:
Life University empowers students to take charge of their career path and guide them towards their professional goals. The university believes in the concept of Lasting Purpose, where graduates are encouraged to use their unique skills to make a positive impact in the world.

Life University recognizes that career planning is an ongoing process, and it inspires graduates to embody its guiding principle of Lasting Purpose: To Give, To Do, To Love, To Serve – diving from an abundance mindset and sharing their abilities with the world upon completion of their studies. We strive to create an environment at Life University where our students can thrive, evolve, and reach their full potential.

Our ultimate mission at Life University is to cultivate an atmosphere where students can embrace their talents, grow, and accomplish their academic and professional aspirations. Our diligent Professional Services department assists students in identifying their career path and devising a plan to achieve their goals.
Accommodation:
As a requirement for enrollment in the College of Undergraduate Studies at Life University, all incoming first-year freshmen must reside in University Housing for a full academic year consisting of three quarters: Fall, Winter, and Spring. However, there are some exemptions that may apply:

1. Individual must be 22 years old or older.
2. Individual must be married and/or have dependents (proof of marriage is required).
3. Individual must reside full-time with their parent(s) or legal guardian within a 15-mile radius of Life University, as verified by Google Maps.
Please note that this exemption does not apply to freshman student athletes who receive an athletic scholarship. Additionally, any student who enrolls for less than 12 quarter credit hours in each of the first four quarters of attendance is also ineligible for this exemption.

Accommodation:
The main campus of Union Township occupies around 121.5 acres and is the main campus of the University. In addition to providing students with up-to-date infrastructure, such as facilities at Nancy Thompson Library, the Human Rights Institute and the Jack Lane Center for Academic Success, this campus also serves as the university's primary academic campus. Apart from the campus in Union, the Liberty Hall Campus and the East Campus, located in Hillside, are other major university campuses. The estimated annual cost for attending this university is approximately $31,000. It boasts of over 160 student organizations, sororities, and fraternities. These organizations enable students from different parts of the university to actively participate and be engaged throughout their studies. The campus also provides counseling and healthcare services to ensure the well-being of its students. The Kean University Cougars actively participate in various sports competitions across the country. They also organize intramural events within the campus to encourage students to stay physically fit and active. Students can only begin the housing application process after they have been accepted into Kean University. Once accepted, students will receive their Kean University login credentials and password, which they can use to access the university's computerized registration system, "KeanWISE," along with their acceptance packet.

Housing Application: To begin, please log in to your Housing Portal by clicking HERE. Use your Kean login information, which is the same as your Kean email information. Make sure to select "Housing Applications and Requests." Next, select "2022-2023 Application" to start your housing application.

Residence Halls:

1. Cougar Hall: Cougar Hall features traditional-style suites with two double bedrooms connected by a kitchenette. Each suite shares a private bathroom with a shower. The bedrooms are furnished with beds, closets, workstations, and desk chairs. The first floor of Cougar Hall has a lounge, game room, business center, food warming room, and a small Bistro. Each residential floor has 15 suites, two study lounges, and one social room. Two resident aides are available on each floor. The suites have independently regulated air conditioning and heating systems. Cable and internet services are included in each suite's amenities.

2. Freshman Residence Hall: The first-year residence hall features traditional-style suites with two double bedrooms connected by a common area. Each suite shares a private bathroom with a shower. The bedrooms are furnished with beds, wardrobes, workstations, desk chairs, and a small refrigerator. The main level of the complex has a lounge, a game room, multipurpose rooms, and a laundry room with coinless washers and dryers. There are 15 units on each residential floor, and two resident assistants are available on each floor. The suites have independently regulated air conditioning and heating systems. Cable television, a telephone, and internet access are included in each unit.

3. Bartlett Hall / Rogers Hall / Sozio Hall / Burch Hall: Each hall features a living room, a fully equipped kitchen, a dining space, and a private bathroom. Each bedroom has two beds, two wardrobes, two desks, and two desk chairs. The kitchen includes a full-size refrigerator, microwave, sink area, and cabinet space. The first floor of each hall has a community center, a community kitchen, and a laundry room. Sozio Hall is open during the winter holidays, and its Graduate Community is located on the 6th floor. Bartlett Hall's Transfer Community is on the 5th floor.

4. Upperclass Residence Hall: The Upperclass Residence Hall offers apartments with two to three bedrooms for double occupancy or four single bedrooms. The apartments have independently regulated air conditioning and heating systems. The living room is furnished with sofas, chairs, end tables, and a TV stand. The kitchen includes a round dining table, four chairs, a full-size refrigerator, cabinet storage space, a sink area, and a microwave. The first level of the complex has a 300-seat "all-you-can-eat" cafe, a 50-seat screening room, and a student mailbox area. It also features a computer lab, a flexible multipurpose room, a game room, a centralised laundry area, and a community center.

Name: Auburn University at Montogomery
Overview:
Auburn University at Montgomery is a prestigious educational institution located in the city of Montgomery, USA. It offers a wide range of courses such as undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs, including online degree programs for distance learning students. The university is situated in the city of Montgomery and has a main campus. The courses offered by Auburn University at Montgomery are in various fields of study, with a focus on Business. The university has more than 8 undergraduate programs and 6 postgraduate programs available for its students. International and domestic students have different costs of attendance depending upon their chosen course. Auburn University at Montgomery also provides scholarships, work-study opportunities and other funding options to its students. The university has a dedicated Career Planning Service team that assists students in building a strong CV and securing a job after graduation, whether it is a full-time job, part-time job, summer job or an internship. For more information about Auburn University at Montgomery, check out Leap Scholar and discover the perfect course for your future aspirations.

The average tuition and fees for undergraduate students at Auburn University are 11,796 USD, while the domestic cost of tuition is 31,956 USD. The credit enrollment is 12 credits per semester for undergraduate students and 9 credits per semester for graduate students.

Admission to Auburn University is based on several factors, including high school GPA (minimum of 3.85), ACT/SAT scores (minimum of 29/1330), essays, and extracurricular activities such as leadership and community service. Consideration may also be given to current Auburn University students with an unadjusted GPA of 3.4.

Course Description:
Auburn University at Montogomery is a highly reputable institution of higher learning that boasts a global recognition for its exceptional quality of education and research achievements. Founded in 1967, the university is situated in Montgomery, USA and proudly hosts a diverse community of approximately 275 international students. The university offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs in various fields of study such as Business, Humanities, Engineering, and more. With 8 intakes available in August, January, May, and September, students have the flexibility to begin their academic journey at Auburn University at Montogomery at their preferred time. The standard duration of bachelor's degree courses is four years, while master's programs can be completed within one year.

In the US News Top Universities rankings, Auburn University at Montogomery is placed at an impressive 579th spot. The university's sprawling campus is equipped with state-of-the-art buildings, research libraries, laboratory facilities, centers, clubs, hostels, and other amenities for the benefit of students and faculty. Name: Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology
Overview:
Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is a prestigious, private university with a focus on teaching science, engineering, and math. It is located in Terre Haute, Indiana. The institute was established in 1874 and is currently led by President Robert A. Coons.

The main focus of Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is its undergraduate curriculum, which also offers graduate studies in eight different disciplines. The institute has a strong emphasis on engineering and the natural sciences and is recognized by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology for its programs in software engineering, biomedical engineering, optical engineering, chemical engineering, and computer science.

Spread over 1300 acres, the campus of Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is home to eight social fraternities and three social sororities, some of which have houses on site. Middle and high school students in Indiana can access free homework assistance and tutoring through the institute's student-centered services, including the Homework Hotline. Additionally, Rose-Hulman Enterprises in an annex of the institute that provides internship and employment opportunities to students and alumni with both new and established businesses.

Notable alumni of the university include Abe Silverstein, Tim Cindric, Marshall Goldsmith, Ernest R. Davidson, Art Nehf, Don Lincoln, Bernard V. Vonderschmitt, Jim Umpleby, Lawrence J. Giacoletto, and Matt Branam, who currently serves as the President of Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology.
